loans.name: Berita

texts.es: Berita, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y muy dinámica, deseosa de progresar. Vive con  Dan, su pareja y fruto de esta unión tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años en su casa propia. La actividad a la que de dedica Berita es la costura, actividad que aprendió desde muy joven, ayudando  a su prima en este oficio durante tres años, en los que logró conocer todo lo necesario para desempeñar este trabajo y hacerse conocida ganándose algunos clientes. Así se independizo e instaló su propio taller en su casa, desde donde atiende los requerimientos de sus clientes, que han ido en aumento, por lo que ya tiene seis años realizando esta actividad sola. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico, con el cual pueda solventar los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo viaja constantemente siendo extractor de oro, actividad que realiza en los ríos de la selva. Lo que no le gusta de su actividad es el cansancio físico por las largas horas de estar en la misma posición, pero eso no la desanima y continua trabajando. Mas adelante desea ampliar su negocio, y abrir una boutique en su propia casa. Este sería el cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, se siente cómoda con los miembros de su grupo comunal, los considera personas responsables y solidarias. Con  el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales  para costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, botones.
texts.en: Berita, age 33, is a happy, very dynamic, and hard-working woman who wants to succeed. She lives with her partner, Dan, with whom she has two children ages 16 and 14. They have their own home. Berita is a seamstress, a job that she learned at a very young age. She helped her cousin to to this work for three years, during which time she has been able to learn everything she needs to know to do this work, gain clientele, and become known. Then, she became independent and opened her own workshop in her home. Her customers' demand has increased, and she has now been working alone for six years. She enjoys being able to count in an income with which to cover her household costs, since her husband travels a lot--he is a gold miner and works in the jungle rivers. Berita does not enjoy the physical strain caused by the long hours of sitting in the same position, but this does not discourage her and she keeps working. In the future, she wants to expand her business and open a boutique in her home. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She feels comfortable with the members of her communal group; she considers them to be responsible and united people. With the amount requested, she will invest in the purchase of materials for sewing, such as fabric, thread, elastics, and buttons.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 28 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene un hijo.  Cuenta con estudios de educación superior.
Desde hace siete años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de veta de chifleria (productos personales y juguetes al menudeo) como detergentes,  colonias, cuadernos, peluches, gas, escobas, pilas etc.
Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 2500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de juguetes, carros, muñecas, pelotas, joyeros,  peluches, huesillos, etc., estos productos los compra en la ciudad de Tacna.  En el negocio le ayuda su esposo quien se dedica a la carpintería.
Su sueño es tener una casa.  Lo que le gusta del Baco comunal son las reuniones y los encuentros deportivos.
texts.en:
Rosmery belongs to the Santa Rosa de Lima Communal Bank, which is in the Juli District of Chucuito Province in the department of Puno.  She is 28 years old, lives with her partner, and has a son.  She has a higher education.

She has worked with El Movimiento Manuela Ramos for seven years now.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles, which she invested in her business selling sundries (personal products and retail toys) such as detergent, cologne, notebooks, stuffed animals, gas, brooms, batteries, etc.  She will be asking for a new loan for 2,500 nuevos soles to buy toys, cars, dolls, balls, jewelry boxes, stuffed animals, dried peaches, etc.  She buys these products in the city of Tacna.  Her husband, who is a carpenter, helps her with her business.  

Her dream is to have her own home.  What she likes about the communal bank are the meetings and the sports outings.

loans.use: to buy toys, cars, dolls, balls, jewelry boxes, stuffed animals, dried peaches, etc.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive por la comunidad de Racar en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la artesanía como es la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña María tiene 47 años, está separada de su esposo y en su unión ha concebido 5 hijos de 25, 19, 18, 12 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo es casado e independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su tercera hija está estudiando en una universidad de la ciudad, su penúltima hija estudia en el colegio y su ultima hija  en una escuelita de la ciudad. la casa en la que vive es el fruto de su trabajo.

La Señora. María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado de sus hijos, como pasa en casa cría y vende animales como cerdos, cuyes y pollos.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, cerdos, cuyes y en alimento para animales.

Sus metas son terminar su casa y llegar a tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Futuro para un Bienestar (Future for Well-Being) communal bank. She lives in the Racar community in Cuenca, where one can admire beautiful landscapes. Its people dedicate themselves to artisan work such as making tiles and bricks. Many work in the city in various activities, and they maintain the culture and tradition of their parents.

María is 47 years old. She is separated from her husband, and together they have 5 children aged 8, 12, 18, 19, and 25 years. Their oldest child is married and independent, their second-oldest works and helps out with the family finances, their third child is studying at a university in the city, their second-youngest child is in school, and their youngest child attends a little school in the city. The house in which she lives is the fruit of her labor.

María devotes her time to household chores and caring for her children. As she is at home, she raises and sells animals such as pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years, and with her new loan she will purchase chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and animal feed. 

Her goals are to finish her house and to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, pigs, guinea pigs, and animal feed

loans.name: Nahin Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Nahin tiene 30 años y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula. Ha estado en un unión libre con Brenda por los últimos 5 años. La pareja tiene un hijo de 6 años, lo cual asiste a la escuela. Él vive en tranquilidad con su familia pero nota que en Honduras hay mucha necesidad. 

Hace 2 años, Nahin dejó de ser agricultor y empezó un servicio de transporte. Hoy en día pasa entre 9  y 11 horas diarias transportando clientes abonados y no abonados de la zona. Hizo el cambio de profesión por su familia y la necesidad de cubrir gastos y hacerlo de forma propia. 

Solicitó un crédito para L12,000 para la reparación de su vehículo, ya que se ha descompuesto. Su sueño es comprar otro vehículo para su negocio para así crear otra fuente de empleo y ingreso para su familia que tanto se necesita.  Nahin agradece a ODEF y a Kiva por dejarse crecer y la grandiosa labor que hacen por la gente como él.
texts.en:
Sr. Nahin is 30 years old and lives in the town of San Pedro Sula. He has been in a common-law relationship with Brenda for the past five years. His partner has a six-year-old son who attends school. Nahin says that he lives peacefully with his family, but that there is great need in Honduras.

Two years ago, Nahin quit farming so that he could start in the transportation business. Today he works between 9 and 11 hours each day transporting his regular customers and random passengers throughout the area. He changed jobs for his family since they need to cover their expenses and make a life of their own.

Nahin is requesting a loan of 12,000 HNL so that he can repair his vehicle, which is already falling apart. His dream is to buy another vehicle for his business as a way of creating another job and generating income that his family needs. Nahin is grateful to ODEF and Kiva for giving people like him the chance to grow and do great work.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: Don Mario es un humilde  agricultor del municipio de Masaya , junto a su familia , los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y lograr construir su vivienda , don Mario desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de cítricos , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder logar darle el mantenimiento adecuado para que las frutas den un buen tamaño , color y sabor .Sus sueños es poder diversificar el cultivo para poder optar a un mejor bienestar ya que si lo logrará esto podría cambiar su vida . Agradece la confianza y el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic Atraves del fondo Kiva ya que sin estos programas de apoyo a pequeños agricultores no podrían salir adelante con su producción.
texts.en:
Mario is a modest farmer, who lives with his family in the municipality of Masaya. His plan for the future is to improve his family's living conditions, and succeed in building his house.  

Mario has been growing citrus fruit for several years. His greatest challenge is not having enough financial resources to adequately maintain his crop, and produce fruit that is of good size, color and taste. His dream is to be able to diversify his crops and strive for better well-being; since if he succeeds, this could change his life. 

He appreciates the trust and support that Afodenic offers him, by means of Kiva funding.  Without these support programs for small farmers, he wouldn't be able to make progress with his production.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 40 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora y le gusta ser productiva. Esta casada con Armando, fruto de esa unión tienen un hijo de 9 años. Juntos habitan en su casa que logró construir con la ayuda de su esposo. La actividad que realiza Doris, consiste en la venta de vestuario para policias, lo confecciona en su pequeño taller, instalado en su propia casa, y cada confección es previamente solicitado con las instituciones y de manera independiente. Se inició en este negocio gracias a que su esposo es policía en actividad, de esta manera incursionó en este rubro y hoy es solicitada por el buen acabado de sus trabajos. Ya tiene más de cinco años realizando esta actividad. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder estar ocupada, sentirse productiva, y mas adelatne desea ser una pequeña empresaria, y hacer lo que le gusta, que es la costura. Lo que no le gusta es cuando vende a crédito y algunos de sus clientes se retrasan en el pago. Tiene planes de seguir mejorando su negocio, ampliar su taller, poner algún personal que lo apoye. Este sería el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente bien con el trabajo de su banco comunal y desea seguir contando con este apoyo. Seguirá siendo puntal en sus pagos y así tener un buen record crediticio para tener acceso a más prestamos futuros. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de más telas e hilos para confeccionar sus vestuarios.
texts.en:
Doris is 40, and is a cheerful, very hard-working woman, who likes to be productive. She is married to Armando, and they have a nine year-old son. They live together in a house she managed to build with her husband's help. 

Doris sells police uniforms. She makes them in her small workshop, that she set up in her own house. Every job is ordered in advance by each institution independently. She got started in this business thanks to the fact that her husband is a policeman. This is how she ventured into this line of business, and today she is sought after because of her good workmanship. 

She has been doing this work for more than five years. What she likes about it, is that she can be busy and feel productive. In the future she wants to be a small entrepreneur, and do what she likes to do, which is sewing. What she doesn't like is when she sells on credit and some of her clients are late in paying.  She plans to continue improving her business, expanding the workshop, and hiring staff to help her.

This will be the third loan with MFP. She feels good about the work of her communal bank, and wishes to continue having this support. She will continue to make her payments on time, and so have a good credit record, in order to have access to future loans. With the amount applied for, she will buy more fabric and thread to make her uniforms.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and thread.

loans.name: Hector Ivan

texts.es:
El señor Héctor, tiene 35 años de edad, se caso muy joven tiene 18 años de casado, tiene 3 hijos de 5, 13 y 17 años de edad, vive en la zona periférica de San Pedro Sula.

Héctor es un hombre muy trabajador, hace dos años inicio un negocio de venta de comida, adiciona refrescos, churros, dulces, pan y otros. Vende en un lugar donde se estacionan buses de transporte y los empleados son Sus clientes, allí tiene establecido el local donde prepara y vende la comida. 

Además de este negocio también recibe otros ingresos, en este mismo lugar trabaja como guardia de seguridad en la noche, y de mediodía hasta la tarde apoya a su esposa con esta actividad. Ella le ayuda mucho con la administración del negocio.

A comenzado con un préstamo pequeño con ODEF, para comprar ingredientes para elaborar comida y mas adelante va solicitar otro de mayor cantidad para ampliar el negocio y surtir de otros productos.
texts.en:
Sr. Héctor, age 35, is a young man who has been married for 18 years. He has three children (ages 5, 13, and 17). Héctor lives on the outskirts of San Pedro Sula.

He is a hardworking gentleman who started a business selling food two years ago. In addition, Héctor sells soft drinks, donuts, candy, bread, and other items. He sells at a place where buses are parked and the employees are his customers. This establishment is where he prepares and sells food.

In addition to this business, Héctor earns additional income by working as a security guard at night. From noon until the end of the afternoon, his wife helps with the business. She has been a great assistant when it comes to managing the business. Héctor started out with a small loan from ODEF, which he used to buy ingredients for making food. Later on, he requested another loan for a larger amount so that he could expand his business and restock with other products.

loans.use: to buy meats, condiments, vegetables, soft drinks, bread, and other ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: María Carmita

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive por la comunidad de Racar en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la artesanía como es la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

La Señora. María tiene 38 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 16, 9 y 4 años de edad, su primera hija está estudiando en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja en la construcción como albañil, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a laborar en diferentes actividades, labrando tierras ajenas o lavando ropa ajena.
 
En el banco comunal es socia hace un año y su crédito lo va a invertir en pollos y alimento para los mismos para iniciar con el negocio de cría de pollos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the "Futuro para un Bienestar" communal bank. She lives in the community of Racar near Cuenca, a place where one can admire beautiful scenery. People make their living in crafts, such as making bricks and roof tiles. Many work in the city in various livelihoods, while maintaining the culture and traditions of their forefathers.  

María is 38, married, and has three children ages 16, 9 and 4.  Her eldest daughter is in high school, and her second child goes to a small local school. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. She doesn't have her own house, so she rents.

She works at various activities, working other people's land, or doing their laundry. She has been in the communal bank for a year, and she is going to use her loan to buy chickens and chicken feed, and start a chicken-raising business. Her dream is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 35  años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Estudió educación secundaria (incompleta).
Desde hace un año trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de chifleria (venta al menudeo de artículos diversos), también la señora se dedica a la venta de artesanía como bordados en bayeta (telares).
Con este nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercadería como candados, chapas, colino, jabón, betún, shamphoo, cuchillos, etc., en el negocio le ayudan sus hijos, su esposo trabaja en transporte (taxista).
La señora desea agrandar su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.  Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del  préstamo y la ganancia de los ahorros.
texts.en:
Rosalia is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank, located in the Juli district in the Chucuito province in the Puno department. She is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She studied secondary education but did not graduate.

She has been working with the Manuel Ramos Movement for the past year. She invested her first loan from them in her chifleria (sale of miscellaneous items) business. She also sells crafts such as embroidered cloths and weaved items.

With this new loan she will buy merchandise such as locks, B-vitamins, soap, shoe polish, shampoo, knives, etc. Her children help her with her business and her husband works as a taxi driver. Rosalia hopes to grow her business and improve her earnings. What she likes about the community bank is the ease in which she can obtain a loan and increase her savings

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as locks, soap, shoe polish, shampoo, and knives.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa es socia del banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar, vive por la comunidad de Racar en Cuenca, lugar en donde se puede admirar hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la artesanía como es la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus padres.

Doña Rosa tiene 37 años, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 20, 18, 16, 14, 12 y 10 años de edad, tres de sus hijos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, una de sus hijas pasa en casa y ayuda en los quehaceres, su penúltimo hijo se encuentra estudiando en el colegio y su ultima hija está en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo se encuentra fuera del país ha migrado para que con su trabajo mejorar la economía de su hogar, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosa hace poco tiempo empezó a trabajar en una panadería y labora todo el día  de domingo a jueves.
 
Se encuentra reingresando en el banco comunal ya que anteriormente era socia. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir para el pago de una letra de su máquina de coser y en la compra de tela ya que va a poner con un pequeño taller de costuras en su casa.
 
Su meta es crecer y mejorar el su negocio que va iniciar.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Futuro para un Bienestar Communal Bank.  She lives in the neighborhood of Racar in Cuenca.  This area has beautiful landscapes and its people make traditional crafts, such as tile and bricks.  Many of them live in the city doing different kinds of work, but they maintain the culture and tradition of their parents.

Rosa is 37 years old, married, and has six children who are 20, 18, 16, 14, 12, and 10 years old.  Three of her children work and help with the household expenses.  One of her daughters stays at home and helps with chores.  Her second-to-youngest son is in school and her youngest daughter goes to a small school in the city.  Her husband lives out of the country, having moved so that he could make more money for his family with his work.  They own their home.

A little while ago, Rosa started working in a bakery and she works all day from Sunday to Thursday.

She is rejoining the communal bank, as she used to be a member.  She is going to use the loan money to make a payment on her sewing machine and to buy fabric, as she's going to set up a small sewing workshop in her home.

Her goal is to grow and improve the business she's starting.

loans.use: to buy fabric and make a payment on her sewing machine.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  32  años de edad, es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  Cuenta con estudios de educación primaria.

Desde hace cuatro años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, compró lanas para la confección de  chompas, chompas escolares, gorros, también se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y ganados.

Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles comprará una bolsa de lana de diferentes colores. Nos cuenta que la bolsa de lana la compra a S/. 150.00 nuevo soles.
También se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados junto con su esposo.

Su sueño es tener una empresa de confección de trajes que le permita incrementar sus ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las reuniones con las socias y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Nora is a member of the communal bank "Santa Barbara," in the district and province of Yunguyo in the department of Puno.  She is 32 years old, single, and has 3 children.  She has an elementary school education.

Nora has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos organization for 4 years.  With her first loan of 300 Peruvian soles, she bought wool to make sweaters, school sweaters and caps.  She also has a business selling groceries and livestock.

With this new loan of 500 Peruvian soles, she will buy sacks of different colors of wool.  She tells us that a sack of wool costs 150 soles.

In addition, she has a business buying and selling livestock with her husband.

Her dream is to have a business making suits that would allow her to increase her earnings.

What she likes most about her communal bank is that the members are very punctual, and she also enjoys the meetings.

loans.use: to buy sacks of different colors of wool

loans.name: Eiva

texts.es: Eiva, de 39 años, esta separada desde hace diez años. Vive en compañía de sus tres hijos de 20, 18 y 15 años de edad en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Eiva es la elaboración de manualidades, como bolsones, zapatos; asimismol bisuterías, como: collares y joyas en plata, productos que elabora ella misma. Aprendió este oficio gracias a una capacitación a los que asistió con el fin de crear su propia empresa. Desde hace diez años que se dedica a esta actividad, y gracias al apoyo de su hijo que fue importante en éste trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el sentirse ocupada, además el de estar en casa para atender a sus hijos. Considera rentable su negocio porque gana hasta un 100% de lo invertido, además su elaboración es deacuerdo al pedido que le hacen sus clientes. Su plan es abrir una boutique donde pueda exhibir sus productos, y lograr ser una prospera empresaria. Este sería el préstamo número diez con la institución MFP, considera a los miembros de su banco grupal ser buenas personas y puntuales, y se apoyan entre ellos. Con el préstamo que solicita, comprará piedrecitas, alambres, cadenas, mostacillas y demás, que son accesorios para la elaboración de bisuterías.
texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Eiva has been separated for 10 years now.  She lives in her own home with her three children, who are 20, 18, and 15 years old.  

Eiva makes handicrafts for a living, such as bags and shoes, as well as costume jewelry, such as necklaces and jewels set in silver.  She learned this profession thanks to a training she attended in order to start her own business.  She has been doing this for 10 years now thanks to her son's support, as he has been important to her work.  What she likes about this work is keeping herself occupied, as well as being at home to take care of her children.  She thinks her business is profitable because she gets back up to 100% of what she invests and she makes her pieces according to her customers' orders.  Her plan is to open a boutique where she can display her products and become a prosperous businesswoman.  

This will be her tenth loan with MFP.  She thinks the members of her communal bank are punctual, good people who support each other.  With the loan she is asking for, she will buy small stones, wire, chains, beads, and other things that she needs to make her costume jewelry.

loans.use: to buy precious stones, wire, chains, and beads to make costume jewelry.

loans.name: Teresa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Teresa, es una humilde agricultora de zona de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en un empresa privada para apoyar con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen hijos a su cargo, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y apoyar en sus estudios a su hijos, doña Teresa desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo ya que este carece de fertilizantes e insumos para combatirlas , actualmente la plantación esta invadida de mosca blanca el cual si no se combate podría acabar con la plantación . Agradece el apoyo y la confianza que le brinda Afodenic Atraves de fondo Kiva ya que sin estos financiamiento no fuese posible darle un mantenimiento a la producción de piña .
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is a humble farmer from the District of Ticuantepe. Her husband works at a private company and they support one another with the household expenses. They have dependent children, so their plans for the future are to improve their living conditions and to help their children with their education.

Doña Teresa has been growing pineapple for many years. Her greatest challenge at the moment is dealing with pests that have invaded her crops. She lacks fertilizers and other supplies to combat the whitefly infestation that is preventing her from finishing her planting.

Teresa is grateful for the support and trust that AFODENIC has provided by supplying Kiva funds. Without the financing, it would not be possible for her to maintain her pineapple production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es: Vanessa, de 31 años, es una, mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Vive con Orlando, fruto de su unión tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad a los que quiere mucho. Juntos habitan en casa de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Vanessa es la venta de repuestos de mototaxi, siendo este un negocio familiar, que funciona en otra casa ubicada en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Aprendió de esta actividad de sus padres, y hace dos años decidio abrir su propio negocio de manera independiente, contando con la ayuda de dos mecánicos que dan servicio de reparación a los que paga por semana trabajada. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder sentirse independiente, estar en actividad y ser productiva y no depender solo de los ingresos de su pareja, que es técnico de la Fuerza Aérea en actividad, y así ella misma puede pagar sus gastos y colaborar con la economía del hogar. Desea crecer más su negocio, incrementando el volumen de su mercadería, viendo que tiene bastante demanda ya que esta ubica en una zona céntrica de la ciudad. Este seria el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente bien y le gusta su trabajo de su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de más mercadería, como repuestos de mototaxis.
texts.en:
31-year-old Vanessa is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman.  She lives with Orlando and, as a fruit of their relationship, they have a 3-year-old son who they love very much.  They live together in her parents' home.

Vanessa's business is selling spare parts for motorcycle taxis.  This is a family business.  She runs her business from another house which is located in a central area of the city.  She learned this business from her parents and, two years ago, she decided to open her own independent business, with the help of two mechanics who provide a repair service, whom she pays by the week.  

What Vanessa most enjoys about her business is being able to feel independent, being active, being productive, and not being solely dependent on her partner's income (her partner is an Air Force technician).  In this way, she can cover her expenses herself and contribute towards the household financially.  She would like to grow further in her business, increasing her volume of merchandise, as she can see that she has a fair amount of demand because she is located in a central area of the city.

This will be Vanessa's third loan from MFP and she feels happy.  She enjoys working with her community bank.  Vanessa will invest all of the sum that she has requested in buying more merchandise such as spare parts for motorcycle taxis.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y emprendedora, le gusta los nuevos desafíos. Vive con su pareja Abel y sus dos hijos de 14 y 13 años, además de un sobrino, al cual apoya con su educación. La actividad que realiza carmen es la costura, oficio que aprendió con su madre desde muy joven y ahora le sirve para generarse un ingreso económico, realizándolo desde su propio hogar. Paralela a esta actividad, se dedica a  la compra  y venta de semillas, las cuales compra a los productores y los envía fuera de la región a pedido. El servicio de costura lo realiza desde hace diez años, mientras que la venta de semilla desde hace un año. Lo que le gusta de sus actividades, es que le generan ingresos económicos con los cuales puede pagar sus gastos, así como también el poder conocer y relacionarse con más personas. Comenta que le gusta  la costura desde muy joven, lo considera rentable por que es bastante requerida por la calidad de su trabajo y tiene un clientela fiel que siempre la buscan por su trabajo. Tiene planes de ampliar y mejorar su negocio comprando una maquina de coser semindustrial. Este sería el crédito número siete con MFP, se siente cómoda con el trabajo de su banco comunal, considera a sus miembros buenas personas, puntuales y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de semillas en mayores cantidades, para así poder tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 40 years old and a hardworking, cheerful, and enterprising woman who enjoys new challenges. She lives with her partner Abel and their two children (ages 14 and 13). Carmen also has a nephew who she is supporting with his education.

She is a seamstress and learned this trade from her mother when she was a young girl. Now this skill provides her a source of income. Carmen works from home. In addition to this business, she also buys and sells seeds. She purchases the seeds from the producers and then ships them outside of the region based on her orders. Carmen has been providing sewing services for 10 years, while she has been selling seeds for one year. What she likes about these activities is being able to generate income to pay for expenses. In addition, these businesses provide her with the opportunity to know and build relationships with more people. She says that she has enjoyed sewing since she was a young girl because she considers it to be profitable. This job requires that she produce quality work and she has loyal customers who are always requesting her services. Her plans include expanding and improving her business by purchasing a semi-industrial sewing machine.

This will be her seventh loan with MFP. Carmen feels comfortable working with her Communal Bank because she considers the members to be good people who are both punctual and supportive. The amount she requested will be invested entirely in the purchase of seeds in large quantities so that she can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy seeds in large quantities to sell.

loans.name: Almendra

texts.es: Almendra, de 20 años, es una señorita emprendedora y trabajadora. Es soltera, vive con sus padres, sus dos hermanos de 18 y 16 años de edad respectivamente, la casa que habita es de sus padres. Las actividad que realiza Almendra es la venta de zapatos femeninos, para lo cual cuenta con un local alquilado en una zona comercial denominada Huequito, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace dos años, en ella cuenta con el apoyo de un ayudante para la atención al público. Paralelo a esto, se dedica a la manicure y pedicure a domicilio, tiendo como principales clientes a sus amistades y familiares, o por recomendación, éste oficio lo aprendió en un centro de educación ocupacional, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace cuatro años, y realizándola sola. Lo que le gusta de sus actividades, es el sentirse a gusto realizando una actividad que le gusta, que es la de estilista, y ser una empresaria con la venta de zapatos, a la vez se entretiene. Considera rentable su negocio de venta de zapatos, pues esta ubicada en una zona comercial que tiene una buena afluencia de consumidores, asimismo desea montar un spa en su casa. Este sería el segundo crédito con la institución MFP, le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal, por el apoyo que viene recibiendo. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la compra de zapatos femeninos de diversos modelos a la moda.
texts.en:
20-year-old Almendra is an entrepreneurial and hard-working young lady.  She is single and lives with her parents and her siblings who are 18 and 16 years old.  The house in which she lives belongs to her parents.

Almendra's business is selling women's shoes and she rents a sales location in a commercial area called Huequito.  She has been in this business for two years and has the support of an assistant who helps serve her customers.  In parallel with this, she also provides manicures and pedicures at home.  Her main customers are friends and family members or people who she has been recommended to.  She learned this trade at an occupational training center.  She has been in this business for four years and works alone.

What Almendra likes about her businesses is that she feels happy carrying out work that she enjoys (being a stylist) and she also enjoys being a businesswoman selling shoes.   She considers her shoe sales business to be profitable as it is located in a commercial area which is busy with a good number of consumers.  She would like to set up a spa in her home.

This will be Almendra's second loan from MFP.  She enjoys working with her community bank for the support that she receives.  She will invest all of the sum she has requested in buying different, fashionable styles of women's shoes.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del centro poblado D. Chinumani, distrito, provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene  77  años D. edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos independientes.

La señora es una socia nueva que recientemente se incorpora a trabajar con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, solicitará un préstamo por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra D. dos ovejas, para luego venderlas a un mejor precio.  La señora también venD. chanchos y otros productos como papa, chuño y habas.  VenD. todos los domingos y trabaja junto con su esposo.

La señora desea seguir trabajado en este negocio y mejorar sus ganancias. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Natividad is a member of the Communal Bank “Santa Barbara” which is in the central village of Chinumani in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 77 years old, married, and has two children who are independent.

Sra. Natividad is a new member who recently joined Manuela Ramos. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 300 PEN and will invest the money in the purchase of two sheep that she can sell later at a higher price. Sra. Natividad also sells pigs and other products such as potatoes, “chuño” (freeze-dried potatoes), and beans. She sells every Sunday and works with her husband.

Sra. Natividad wants to continue working in her business and improve her earnings. What she likes about the Communal Bank is the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to buy two heads of sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy natural medicinal products from the Forever brand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit, eggs, milk, etc. for making ice-cream.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Elva; la socia tiene 37 años de edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 2 hijos ; La socia tiene un negocio de venta de salchipapas,ella tiene un carrito donde vende salchipapas en forma ambulatoria desde las 5:00 p.m hasta las 11:00 p.mn y en las mañnas la socia se sigue dedicando a trbajar como docente,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de salchipapas . La socia desea el crédito para comprar insumos para preparar las salchichas como papa,salchicha y platos al por mayor.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member is Señora Elva; she is 37 years old and married, with two children.  The member has a business selling salchipapas (hot dogs and fries).  She has a small cart from where she sells the salchipapas as a street vendor, from 5 p.m. until 11 p.m.  During the mornings, the member works as a teacher, and by means of this business she has been able to move her children ahead in life.

The member would like to expand and improve her salchipapas business.  She wants this loan to purchase ingredients at wholesale for preparing salchipapas, such as potatoes, sausage, and plates.

The member is grateful for the support which is being provided to her, and likewise, she commits to making her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies at wholesale for preparing salcihipapas (hot dogs and fries), such as potatoes, sausage, and plates.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia sigue teniendo su negocio de venta de desayunos como quinua con leche, manzana con leche, desayuno de maca,tortas,chocolate y sándwich de queso,ella vende en las mañanas en forma ambulatoria desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 a.m,tambien se dedica al negocio de tejidos,ella realiza tejidos de lana como pantalones y chompas tanto para niños y adultos,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar sus negocios de venta de desayunos y venta de tejidos . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer desayunos y comprar lana para tejer los pantalones y chompas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member is 39 years old, living with a partner, and has 3 children. The member continues her business of selling breakfasts such as quinoa with milk, apples with milk, maca breakfasts, tortas, chocolate, and cheese sandwiches. She sells on foot from 5:00AM until 10:00AM in the mornings. She also has a textile business, weaving wool for pants and sweaters for children and adults. Through this business her children have prospered. The member wants to expand and improve her breakfast business and textile sales. She is asking for a loan in order to buy supplies to make breakfast and to buy wool to knit the pants and sweaters. The member is happy for the loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make breakfasts to sell, and buy wool to knit pants and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Jugdernamjil

texts.en: Jugdernamjil is 33 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (Mongolian nomadic tent) in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. Her husband runs a raw materials retailing business and her son goes to kindergarden. She started her small hairdressing salon in 2005. She has two very talented employees who are fast and good at their job. Her salon is the only one in a 1 km radius. Now that her business equipment is getting old, she needs to renew the equipment. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy new equipment for her salon.

loans.use: To buy new equipment

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se forma gracias a que una de las miembros, la cual le dijo a sus amigas y vecinas para formar el comité y ellas gustosas aceptaron. Todas quieren que, por medio del trabajo de cada una de ellas, puedan ayudar a sus familias y sus hijos, dándoles una vida digna y decorosa.
Un ejemplo de lucha es la señora Pascuala, ella tiene una panadería, la cual es el sustento de su casa y de su familia, comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y buena atención ya tiene una clientela bien formada, lo cual le trae muy buenos ingresos, es por ello que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, por lo que solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya, para la compra de harina, leudantes, saborizantes y demás, los cuales son ingredientes esenciales de su negocio.
Ella al igual que sus amigas están muy agradecidas por esta oportunidad que tienen.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to one of the members who suggested to her friends and neighbors that they form a communal bank, to which they happily agreed. All want, through their individual work to be able to help their families and children by giving them a decent and dignified life. 

Sra. Pascuela is one example of the struggle. She owns a bakery, which supports her household and family. She notes that, thanks to her efforts and close attention, she already has an established clientele which generates a very good income. Consequently, she wants to continue investing in her business and is requesting help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya in order to purchase flour, leavening, seasoning and other items which are essential ingredients for her business.

She, together with her friends, is very grateful for the opportunities afforded them.

loans.use: to buy flour, leavening, seasoning and other items.

loans.name: Nadmidsuren

texts.en: Nadmidsuren is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a taxi driver and her two kids are college students. She started her garment retailing business in 2003 by renting a counter in a market. Her business is stable and has many regular customers. Now that winter is approaching, she needs more warmer clothes to sell. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kids joined a college, it is hard to pay fees; however, my husband and I will do everything [we] can to support them." She is requesting 1,200,000 Mongolian tugriks to buy winter clothes.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes.

loans.name: Kuña Renda San Muiguel Group

texts.es:
15 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Caaguazú se juntaron, para que por medio del trabajo en conjunto D. ellas puedan salir adelante y ser útiles no solo a ellas mismas sino también a sus familias. Mediante el trabajo en conjunto ya están en el cuarto ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la fundación
Una mujer muy trabajadora es la señora Catalina, nos comenta que muy temprano se levanta todo los días para poner en orden su almacén ya que desD. muy tempranas horas ya tiene clientes aguardándola. Por medio D. este negocio ella pueD. cubrir los gastos D. su familia, ya que su meta es darles todo lo mejor. Ella solicita la ayuda D. kiva y fundación paraguaya para poder seguir con su negocio, para que pueda comprar huevos, aceite, fideo, verduras, leche y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
Fifteen women in the city of Caaguazú united so that they, through their work as a group, would be able to get ahead and be useful not only to themselves but also to their families. Through their work together they are now in the fourth loan cycle of the Mujeres Emprendedoras Program of Fundación Paraguaya.

One very hardworking woman is Sra. Catalina who tells us that she gets up very early everyday in order to get her grocery store ready, since she has customers waiting for her at very early hours of the morning. Through this business, she is able to cover her family’s expenses since her goal is to give them  the best of everything.  She is requesting help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya in order to be able to continue with her business. She will buy eggs, oil, noodles, vegetables, milk and other items to stock her store and meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy eggs, oil, noodles, vegetables, milk and other items.

loans.name: Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité Kyrey está formado por 15 integrantes D. la ciudad D. Lambaré, todas ellas son mujeres con ganas D. progreso y por sobre todo muy luchadoras. Trabajan por lograr un futuro mejor para sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto y gracias al apoyo D. la fundación y D. Kiva.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Sixta, ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. todo tipo, como ser camisas, remeras, pantalones y otros tipos D. ropas. Nos cuenta que siempre tiene mucha variedad por lo que siempre las personas compran D. ella. Gracias a su buena atención y a la variedad que tiene ya pudo formarse una clientela bien definida, por lo que tiene, por decirlo D. una forma, un ingreso fijo.
Ella solicita la ayuda D. fundación paraguaya para la compra prendas D. verano, ya que esa estación está próxima y quiere abastecerse parta tener un buen stock D. ellas. Sus compañeras al igual que Sixta están muy agradecidas por la ayuda que reciben.
texts.en:
The Kyrey communal bank is maD. up of 15 members in the city of Lambaré. All are women who want to progress in life and who are, above all, very hardworking. They are working to secure a better future for their families through group effort and thanks to the support of the Fundación and Kiva.

One of the members is Sra. Sixta who sells all kinds of clothing such as shirts, T-shirts, pants and other items. She tells us that she always has a large variety of merchandise and for that reason people always buy from her. Thanks to her good service and the variety she offers she has a well established clientele. Consequently she has, in a manner of speaking, a steady income.

She is requesting a loan from Fundación Praguaya in order to buy summer clothing since the season is approaching and she wants to get her merchandise in and have a good supply on hand. The other members of the communal bank, along with Sixta, are very grateful for the help they are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase summer clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 49 years old and lives with her husband and four kids in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her husband is a cab driver, her elder two kids are college students and her younger two are in school. She started her fruit retailing business in 2007 by renting a counter in the market. Now that she has run a business quite a while, she wants to expand her business by selling vegetables. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kids are grown, they need my support more than anything now. In order to support them I will do everything I can." She is requesting 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy apples at a wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy apples at a wholesale price.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Las Divinas” es un comité de 9 mujeres muy bien organizadas, unidas, trabajadoras y solidarias las unas con las otras. Estas señoras son de la ciudad Villarrica, donde todas son vecinas y amigas. Se reúnen semanalmente para brindarse apoyo y ayuda para poder desarrollar su situación económica.
La señora Felisa se dedica a la cocina, en lo cual le va muy bien, ya que ella cocina muy buenos platillos. Tiene una clientela bien formada, quienes siempre van hasta su local a probar lo que prepara.  Por medio de  este trabajo ella pudo sobresalir y cumplir con sus obligaciones. Ya que le va muy bien, quiere seguir creciendo y es por ello que pide la ayuda de la fundación, para la compra de carne, huevos, verduras, y otros ingredientes que puede llegar a necesitar para elaborar sus alimentos.
Estas señoras estan muy contentas de seguir participando en este programa de microcrédito, pues han mejorado así bastante sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
The “Las Divinas” group is a committee of nine women who are very well organized, bonded, hardworking and supportive of each other. These women are from the city of Villarrica where they are all neighbors and friends. They meet weekly to offer each other support and help so as to develop their financial circumstances. 

Ms. Felisa devotes herself to cooking, which is going very well for her, since she prepares very good dishes. She has a well-established clientele who always come to her shop to try whatever she prepares. By means of this work she was able to excel and meet her obligations. Since it is going so well for her she wants to keep growing, and that is why she is asking the foundation for help, in order to buy meat, eggs, vegetables and other ingredients she may need for making her foods. 

These women are very happy to keep participating in this microloan program since they have improved their businesses considerably by it.

loans.use: to purchase meat, eggs, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ragchaa

texts.en:
Ragchaa is 30 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife babysits her two infants. He started his transportation business in 2003 by transporting tourists for a daily fee. He is well experienced and has so many regular customers that he has no day off. He has bought his own yard and upgraded his car with the profit. 

Now that winter is approaching, he needs to service his car in order to survive in the harsh Mongolian winter. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says "I will do everything I can to get my boys educated, I don't want them to live like me." He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to repair the car.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Unurjargal

texts.en:
Unurjargal is 28 years old and lives with her husband and 1-year-old daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. Her husband is a cab driver. She started her garment retailing business in 2008 by renting a counter at the market. She is known for her excellent selection of clothes and good service in the market. 

Now that winter is approaching, she needs more warmer clothes to sell. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "Now that I have a child, I have to do everything I can to support my child". She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy more winter garments to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more winter garments to increase her working capital

loans.name: Johaihupape Ñamba'apo Group

texts.es:
Este comité "Johaihupape Namba'apo" se integra por 14 señoras D. excelente estructura, unidas, diligentes y fraternales entre ellas. Estas señoras se reúnen en forma semanal para poder darse apoyo las unas a las otras. Tienen como fin principal el crecimiento D. todas ellas, tanto en lo personal como en lo económico.
Ramona es una D. las miembros, ella es modista, a lo cual se dedica hace ya un buen tiempo, comenta que por medio D. su trabajo ella pueD. sustentar a sus familiares. Diariamente tiene mucho trabajo que hacer, es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, hilos, agujas y demás, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.
Ella al igual a que sus compañeras D. comité están muy agradecidas por la oportunidad que se les da.
texts.en:
The committee named “Johaihupape Ñamba'apo” consists of 14 women who have excellent organization, unity, diligence, and a bond of sisterhood among them. These ladies meet on a weekly basis in order to support one another. Their main goal is to see every member grow on a personal as well as a financial level.

Ramona is one of the members. She has been a seamstress for quite some time. Ramona says that her work enables her to support her family. She works hard on a daily basis in order to make a living. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies so that she can finish her customers’ orders.

Ramona and the other members of the committee are very grateful for the opportunity that has been given to them.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, needles, and other supplies.

loans.name: Zagar

texts.en: Zagar is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai Province, Mongolia. He started his taxi service business in 2007 with his own car. Now that he has saved some money, he wants to run a garment retailing business with his wife. He has already rented a counter in the biggest market in the province and he has also contacted the supplier. In order to run a business successfully, his money is not quite enough. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "the taxi service business is not expandable. It is basically the same thing everyday so I want to increase my income by operating a clothing sales business." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy clothes for his new business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for his new business

loans.name: Banzragch

texts.en: Banzragch is 23 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Arhangai Province, Mongolia. His wife works in a billiard club. He started his bakery business in 2011 when he quit from the local bakery manufacturer therefore, he is well experienced and has contact with the customers as well. Now that he has all the required knowledge, he is lacking the resources. He is a sharp young man who says "I have to do everything I can in order to support my daughter". He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to buy flour to make bread and cake.

loans.use: To buy flour to make bread and cake

loans.name: Vecinas Alegres Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Vecinas Alegres, se forma gracias a una de las miembros que se puso en contacto con una de las asesoras de la fundación, ya que ella deseaba un bien para sus vecinas del barrio, de allí surgió el grupo que  actualmente está integrado por 11 mujeres. Las señoras son muy unidas, responsables y solidarias, se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto en equipo, con mucho esfuerzo y esmero, en forma conjunta  dentro del programa Comité de Mujeres.
Una de las miembros es la señora Teodolina, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, con la cual da a sus vecinos los productos de primera necesidad. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y muy emprendedora. Nos comenta que se levanta a muy tempranas horas a empezar a ordenar su despensa, ya que desde temprano tiene clientes. Ella quiere seguir aumentando su negocio por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de verduras, harina, huevos, hortalizas y otros, los que le servirán para abastecer su local
texts.en:
The 'Vecinas Alegres' (Happy Neighbors) Women's Committee was created by one of its members who contacted one of the foundation's loan officers as she wanted to create a group for her neighbors.  As a result, this group was formed.  The group currently has 11 female members.  The ladies are very united, responsible and supportive.  They are working very happily together as a team, with a lot of effort and care, within the Women's Committee program.

One of the members is Teodolina who has a well-stocked grocery store where she offers her neighbors basic household products.  She considers herself to be a very hard-working, tenacious, entrepreneurial woman.  She tells us that she gets up very early in the morning to organize her store as her customers start arriving very early.  She would like to continue increasing her business and is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, flour, eggs and other products which will allow her to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, flour, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Verly

texts.en:
Verly is a married woman with two children. She is 36 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Verly owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she's been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Verly has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to gain more profit and to finish paying for her children's study.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital

loans.name: Batsuren

texts.en:
Batsuren is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan Province, Mongolia. His wife babysits their two infants and the eldest son is a school student. He started his dairy retailing business in 2001 by renting a counter at the local market. Now he goes to the rural areas by himself to collect the supplies and sells them. With the business profit, he has expanded his counter space and has bought a car. 

During winter, dairy products' prices become high: before then, he needs to save some supplies. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "My business is highly competitive. I need to work even harder in order to support my children". He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to buy milk and livestock.

loans.use: To buy milk and livestock

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la señora Vicenta quien se motivo en la idea D. producir un bien para sus compañeras, dándoles una visión D. que a través del comité están alcanzando el progreso a cada una. Encantadas aceptaron continuar dentro del comité, y D. esa forma seguir creciendo. El comité cuenta con 16 miembros, donD. todas tienen la esperanza D. seguir luchando por salir adelante, buscando el progreso D. cada una D. ellas y la D. su comunidad.
Una D. ellas es la señora Vicenta, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida, a la cual acuden todos sus vecinos. Nos cuenta que comienza a trabajar a muy tempranas horas del día y acaba ya entrada la noche, su trabajo es muy sacrificado y agotador, pero pese a ello disfruta lo que hace.
Ella quiere poder seguir creciendo y por ello solicita el crédito para la compra D. arroz, fideo, azúcar, panificados, carnes y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con sus clientela.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to Vicenta who suggested the idea of creating well being among the members, giving them a vision that through the group each one of them are achieving progress. The group is maD. up of 16 members, and all of them have the hope to continue fighting to get ahead, each one of them looking to progress in their community.

One of them is Vicenta. She has a well supplied store which all the neighbors frequent. She tells us that she begins to work in the early morning hours of the day and finishes late at night. She makes many self sacrifices for her business and it is tiring, but in spite of that she enjoys what she does.

She wants to be able to continue growing and she is asking for a loan in order to buy rice, noodles, sugar, bread, meats and other items, with which she will be able to supply and meet the requests of her clients.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, bread, meat, and other items

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is a married woman with two children. She is 34 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Susana owns and operates a home products business, selling baked goods in the local community to earn a living and she's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,300 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Susana has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business to gain more profit and to finish paying for her children's study.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Baterdene

texts.en: Baterdene is 31 years old and lives alone in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. He started his taxi service business in 2006 with his own car. Since then, he has renewed his car and bought a yard with the profit. Also, he runs a meat retailing business. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "The cab business is pretty much the same everyday so I rented a counter at the market and hired somebody to run the business. It is going surprisingly well so I need to increase my supply in order to run my new business successfully". He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more meat.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Las Colinas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Emprendedoras D. las Colinas” tiene 3 años D. formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, sus integrantes ya realizan actividades productivas. Ellas se encuentran muy conformes con el comité que lograron formar, ya que les ha sido D. mucha ayuda en los proyectos D. cada una.
La señora Nilda, se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. todo tipo, venD. desD. camisillas, hasta camisas, pantalones y otros. Por medio D. su sacrificio diario ha logrado ir creciendo D. a poco y abrirse camino en su mini proyecto. Gracias a sus ventas ella pueD. cubrir los gastos diaR. D. la casa y la manutención D. su familia.
Ya que su negocio le es D. mucha ayuda, ella quiere seguir invirtiendo, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra D. remeras, shorts, camisillas, pantalones, polleras, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad D. productos que ofrece a su clientela.
texts.en: The committee "Mujeres Emprendedoras D. las Colinas", translates to "The enterprising women of Colinas".  The group was formed 3 years ago and works with the Paraguayan Foundation.  Its members work in various trades.  They follow the rules of the committee and each one has received support for their respective businesses.   Nilda works selling all kinds of women's clothing, from blouses to pants.    Through her daily sacrifice and hard work she has slowly grown her business.  Thanks to the income she generates from sales, she is able to cover her household costs and support her family.   She would like to continue to invest in her business, and part of this loan will be used to purchase shorts, blouses, pants, jackets and other variety of clothing to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, pants, blouses and other women's clothing

loans.name: Stevenson

texts.en:
Stevenson owns and has managed his rice fields for almost 18 years. He is 34 years old, married and has been blessed with two children who are studying.

Stevenson devotes himself to his agricultural business since it is the family's main source of income. He is thankful because his wife is supportive in their business. Stevenson is in charge of taking care of his rice fields while his wife is busy with her hog raising business. The couple works hard to provide for living. According to him, the family's income goes to the allowances, daily needs and some is used to pay for their electricity bills. So for this reason, Stevenson would like to ask for financial assistance amounting to 40,000 PHP which will be used to buy farm supplies and pay for the labor cost of transplanting and sowing crops in his rice fields. This amount would really help him in attaining his goal which to educate his children and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pay for labor to transplant and sow his rice crops

loans.name: Emiliano Florenciano

texts.es:
El  Sr. Emiliano es electricista, está acompañado con la Sra. Mirtha. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo. Ambos tienen juntos cuatro hijos en edad escolar. 
Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y dedicación. Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato y su excelente trabajo en el ramo. Nos cuenta que todo su trabajo es por darle a su familia lo mejor, ya que no quiere que sus hijos, tampoco su esposa pasen por privaciones. Por ello solicita el crédito para la compra de herramientas, como ser pinzas, buscapolos, cables, y demás, con lo cual podrá seguir en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Sr. Emiliano is an electrician. He is married to Sra. Mirtha, who sells all types of food. They have four children who are of school age. With the help of his wife, Emiliano is able to move forward with great sacrifice and dedication.

Today he is a successful micro-entrepreneur with many customers. He provides good service and performs excellent work in this field. Emiliano says that all of his work is aimed at providing his family the best because he does not want his wife and children to experience hardship. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to buy equipment such as pliers, screwdrivers, cables, and other items to that he can continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy pliers, screwdrivers, cables, and other items.

loans.name: Limpia Concepcion

texts.es:
La Sra. Limpia tiene 56 años de edad, es una mujer muy humilde y sacrificada, es madre soltera de varios hijos que ya formaron sus hogares, tiene dos nietos a quienes cuida Luz Milagros de 5 años y Mario Michael de 15 años, viven en Coronel O. hace mas de 20 años.
La Sra. Limpia se dedicó a ser modista por 11 años, pero decidió invertir en un pequeño almacén en su casa para poder ofrecer a sus nietos todo el cuidado que ellos necesitan, ya que su madre los había dejado en busca de otras posibilidades de vida. Su sueño es tener una despensa bien surtida para poder ofrecer variedad y comodidad a sus clientes, es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de comestibles, como ser arroz, fideos, azúcar, verduras y demás.
Está feliz por la oportunidad que le brinda la Fundación Paraguaya ya que de esa manera podrá obtener parte de su sueño tan anhelado del negocio propio.
texts.en:
Sra. Limpia is 56 years old and a humble woman who has made sacrifices. She is a single mother of children who have started their own households. Limpia takes care of two grandchildren, Luz Milagros (age 5) and Mario Michael (age 15). She and her family have lived in Coronel O. for more than 20 years.

Sra. Limpia has been a seamstress for 11 years, but she decided to invest in a small store in her home so that she could provide everything her grandchildren need. Their mother left them with her so that she could look for other opportunities in life. Her dream is to operate a well-stocked food pantry so that she can offer variety and convenience to her customers. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy food products such as rice, noodles, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

She is happy for the opportunity that Fundación Paraguaya has provided. This has helped her achieve part of her long-anticipated dream of having her own business.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Mariela Irene

texts.es:
La Sra. Mariela es de la ciudad de San Santaní, vive con su madre, es soltera y tiene 23 años de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta ambulante de camisas, remeras, zapatos y otro tipo de artículos. Nos cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, ya que  recorre por la ciudad  y también por las compañías vecinas, gracias a su arduo esfuerzo logra tener buen ingreso. 
Ella trabaja mucho, para que algún día pueda tener un local propio y no tenga que recorrer más. Está muy a gusto con su trabajo por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio, es por ello que solicita la ayuda de la fundación, para la compra de camisas, remeras, zapatos y otros con lo cual podrá abastecerse y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en: Mariela is 23 years old and lives in the city of San Santani with her mother.  Mariela works selling women's clothing and shoes to nearby companies as well as around the city.   She tells us that her business requires hard work, as she must traverse much of the city.  Thanks to her efforts she has been able to generate good income.  She works a lot so that one day she will be able to have her own shop, rather than selling door to door.  Mariela likes her work and would like to continue to grow the business.  She is requesting support from the foundation to purchase blouses, shoes and other clothing items to increase her inventory.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks, snack foods, noodles and spices for her store

loans.name: Leslie

texts.en:
Leslie is a married woman with two children aged 13 and 7. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and sells seaweed for a living. Leslie sells items like spices, vinegar and canned goods to the people in her community. Leslie earns about 10,000 PHP per month from her business.

Leslie has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, oil and seaweed. She hopes to have a stable income that will help her sustain her children's education and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as vinegar, oil and seaweed

loans.name: Oscar Alcides

texts.es:
El señor Oscar de 42 años de edad, está casado con la señora Silvia de 38 años,  la pareja tiene 3 hijas, una de 19 años, otra de 17 años y la más pequeña de 12 años, la dos mayores trabajan y estudian, con lo que ayudan con los gastos familiares.
 Oscar tiene un taller de motos, comenta que empezó hace mas de 15 años, alquila un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad donde acuden muchos clientes, tiene todo lo necesario para poder dar los servicios de reparación y mantenimiento de motos. Quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio y es por esto que solicita el crédito, para la compra de repuestos y aceite, necesita  un pequeño stock  de repuestos como cabo de embrague, freno, zapata, rotor, caracolito de embrague, llanta, maza, de manera a solventar  los costos  y que sea mayor su ingreso. 
Agradece a fundación paraguaya por el apoyo ofrecido, como así también a Kiva.
texts.en: Oscar is 42 years old and married to Silvia who is 38.  Together they have 3 children, ages 19, 17 and the youngest 12.  The two older children are working and going to school, and help with some of the household costs.   Oscar has a motorcycle repair shop, which he started more than 15 years ago.  He rents a small place in the center of the city where he has gained many customers, and has everything needed to repair and maintain the bikes.  He would like to continue to grow this business and is requesting a loan to purchase oil and various spare parts.  This will help him manage his costs and continue to increase his income.  Oscar appreciates the support that the Paraguayan Foundation has offered him, as well as Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase tools and parts for his motorcycle repair business

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 30 años, vive en la ciudad de Concepción,  tiene dos hijos pequeños, los que van a la escuela, su familia está compuesta por 4 integrantes: Ña Maria, sus dos hijos y su amor como ella dice, el señor Ricardo.
Maria tiene su negocio de ventas de ropas nuevas y usadas en el mercado municipal de Concepción. Tiene su pequeño local desde el año 2007 en donde trabaja independiente. Nos cuenta que al principio fue muy sacrificado, por el hecho de que ellos no tenían capital para emprender un negocio de forma independiente, pero  con la ayuda de su marido, de su cuñado y con los ahorros que ella tenía pudo obtener su propio local en el mercado y empezar su microempresa, con la experiencia que ella tiene en la venta le está yendo muy bien.
Ya que le está yendo muy bien, ella solicita la ayuda de la Fundación y de Kiva para la compra de prendas nuevas y usadas para la posterior venta, ya que desea poder abastecerse para cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 30 years old and she lives in the city of Concepción.  She has two young children who are in school.  Her family is made up of four people, Maria, her two children, and, as she refers to him, her love, Ricardo.  

Maria has a business selling new and used clothing at the open-air market in Concepción.  She has had her small stall, where she works on her own, since 2007.  She says that in the beginning it was very taxing because they didn't have the capital to start an independent business, but with the help of her husband, her brother-in-law, and the savings she was able to make, she was able to get her own spot in the market and start her small business.  With the experience she has in sales, it's going very well for her.

Since her business is doing very well, she is asking for help from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to buy new and used clothes to resell, since she wants to be able to restock to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy new and used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Maria Justina

texts.es:
La Sra Maria tiene 42 años y está casada con Héctor, tienen 5 hijos, todos ellos aún está estudiando en la escuela.
María es costurera y con ella trabajan sus tres D. sus hijas, todas juntas por medio del apoyo constante ayudan con los gastos D. la casa. Anteriormente Maria trabajaba en una empresa D. costura y D. poco fue juntando su plata hasta comprar una máquina D. coser y así se independizó. Su sueño es tener bastante capital para comprar telas y tener su negocio D. ventas en su casa, la empresa es familiar y también quiere que la empresa siga creciendo para darle oportunidad a otras personas para que trabajen.
Solicita el crédito para la compra D. una máquina D. coser, lo cual le será D. mucha ayuda en su taller D. costura y agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da en el crédito, ya que para ella y su familia es un apoyo importantísimo.
texts.en:
Sra. María is 42 years old and married to Héctor. They have five children who are all attending school.

María is a seamstress and works with three of her daughters. They constantly help one another in this business so that they can cover the household expenses. María previously worked at another sewing business and was gradually setting asiD. enough money so that she could buy a sewing machine and become independent. Her dream is to have enough capital in order to buy fabrics and have a retail business in her home. Her venture is family-owned, but she also wants to continue growing so that she can proviD. employment opportunities to other people.

María is requesting a loan in order to buy a sewing machine, which will be a great help in her workshop. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity given to her through this loan. This is an important source of help for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Derlis

texts.es:
Derlis tiene 27 años de edad, está casado hace 6 años con la señora Laura de 24 años de edad,  tienen una hija de 4 años.
Derlis se dedica a la venta de motorepuestos y mecánica de motos desde hace 6 años. Nos cuenta que desde los 12 años empezó a trabajar como mecánico de motos, primero fue ayudante y con el correr del tiempo se volvió un profesional. Dice que trabajaba mucho y ganaba muy poco dinero por lo que salió de su trabajo y decidió montar su propio taller mecánico con un ahorro juntando. Pudo comprar las herramientas mínimas y con el correr del tiempo  mejoró todas las herramientas y también incorporó repuestos para motos.
Debido a la calidad del servicio que presta, una empresa dedicada a la venta de motos le designo como mecánico oficial para que los motos que la empresa representa pueda entrar en su taller para reparaciones y mantenimientos normales.
El solicita la ayuda de la fundación para la compra de repuestos en general para motos, con lo que podrá abastecerse.
texts.en:
Derlis is 27 years old, married for six years to Ms. Laura, 24, and has a four-year-old daughter. Derlis earns a living selling motorcycle spare parts and servicing bikes, which he has done for six years. He tells us he began to work as a motorcycle mechanic at the age of 12. First he was an assistant and then as time went by he became a professional. He says he was working a lot and earning very little money, and so he left his job and decided to open up his own mechanic's shop with some savings. He was able to buy the essential tools and, as time went by, he improved all the tools and also began carrying spare parts for the bikes. 

Owing to the quality of service he provides, a motorcycle dealership designated him as their official mechanic so that the bikes the company represents can go to his shop for routine maintenance and repairs. 

He is seeking the foundation's help for the purchase of motorcycle parts in general with which to stock up.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.en:
Juanito is 38 years old and married. He has three children aged 11, 10 and 5. Juanito runs a sound system rental business. He has had this business for 20 years. Juanito is also a fisherman and owns his own fishing boat. He works hard to provide for his family and send his children to school.

Juanito has requested a loan to purchase speakers and repair his fishing boat. He hopes to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase speakers and repair his fishing boat

loans.name: Chuluuntsetseg

texts.en:
