Chuluuntsetseg is 30 and lives with her son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Zavhan province, Mongolia. Her son is a student at school. 

She started her bakery business in 2003 by baking at home. Now she has her own workshop and two employees. Her baking technique is unique and tasty. She has many regular customers in the neighborhood. 

Her customer demand is increasing; however, her machinery isn't working properly. In order to meet customer demand, she has to renew her machinery. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My business is shutting down. In order to work, I have to replace certain equipment". 

She is requesting 3,800,000 MNT to purchase new machinery.

loans.use: to purchase new machinery

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is willing to work hard every single day, to give his family a good quality of life. He devotes himself full-time to his corn farm business. He has 10 years' experience in this field. He is 49 years old, married and has four children. His wife helped him to cultivate their farmland to make sure that they would be able to receive and earn a higher income.
 
For this reason, Salvador wants to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides. He hopes that he can receive the amount that he has requested to further develop his farmland.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seedlings and insecticides

loans.name: Larry

texts.en:
Larry is 38 years of age, married and blessed with two school-aged children. He is planting rice crops on his five hectares of farm. He has had this agricultural business for almost 20 years. Larry would like to improve and maintain his rice fields but his income is not enough due to his family household expenses. He is glad to see that his business grows although he experiences hardships.

Larry would like to ask for a loan amount of PHP 30,000 which will be used to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seedlings for his rice fields. He hopes that he can receive the amount that he has requested so that he can send his children into a higher level of education and save some for his family's future. He believes that through his efforts, dedication and additional capital he could be a successful farmer someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides and seedlings for his rice fields

loans.name: Vanh

texts.en: Vanh, 24, is a single woman who lives with her mother in Siem Reap province. Vanh earns a living by giving people massages in her workplace near the province's market. She has been engaged in this business since 2009 and she is able to generate approximately $4.00 per day from her business activity. Her workplace is far away from her house, so every day she takes a motorcycle taxi to work, which makes her spend a fortune per month. Vanh wants to use the amount of $500 to buy a second-hand motorcycle. This loan will help her reduce some of her expenses and save more money for her future business growth.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy squash, beans and tomatoes for her business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
The primary source of income on which Edna and her family relies is through making and selling cacao balls and peanut butter which is ideal for sandwich spreads. Edna has been doing this for 10 years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. 

Edna is 56 years old, married and has been blessed with 10 children. Five of them have settled into marriage so that she didn't even sustain their college education. The rest attend school.

She decided to borrow PHP 14,000 to buy more cacao balls, peanuts, brown sugar and plastic jars for packaging. She needs to increase sales to earn additional profits to sustain her children's schooling. She wants to provide a good education for them to earn a degree so they can someday seek better employment.

loans.use: to buy cacao balls, peanuts, brown sugar and plastic jars for packaging

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 47 years old and married. She has two children aged 15 and 10. Cristita runs a fishing business. This business has been running for four years. Each month, Cristita earns 4,000 PHP.

Cristita has requested this loan to purchase a fishing boat. She hopes to earn more and to be able to sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en: Annabella is married with one child. She is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. Annabella is a farmer and grows assorted vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase a cow. Annabella has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a responsible and kind person. He is 53 years old and married. The couple is glad because they are blessed with three healthy children. Eduardo's wife is businesswoman who manages their fruit farm. One of his goals is to improve his rice fields and fruit farm, which will enable the family to increase their profits. 

Eduardo said that being a farmer is not that easy because you need to prepare a lot of things and see to it that it is productive. He is grateful because his wife supports him in cultivating their rice fields. Eduardo has managed his farm for almost 30 years. 

He would like to ask for additional capital in the amount of 30,000 Philippines pesos to purchase farm supplies and to pay for the labor cost of transplanting and sowing crops in his rice fields. This would really help him because the income generated from the farming business goes immediately to his obligations to traders, allowances, daily household expenses, payment for electric bills and toward the school fees of his children. Eduardo is hoping that he could obtain the loan amount he requested so that he could continually support his family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and to pay for the labor cost of transplanting and sowing crops in his rice fields.

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en: Sarantuya is 41 years old and lives with her mother and daughter in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar dictrict, the capital of Mongolia. Her mother helps with her business and her daughter is a student. She has a part-time job in a local company, and she runs a grocery shop business. Now that winter is approaching, she saw a business opportunity to sell firewood in her shop. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I am the only one in my family with the income, so I have to work [as] hard as possible in order to support them." She is requesting 2,500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy firewood and some products for her small shop.

loans.use: To buy firewood and some products for her small shop.

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is 42 years old and married. She is a patient and diligent person in the community. She has a vegetable stand in front of her house to sell different vegetables from her own backyard. Honorata loves to plant vegetables in her backyard so that she can sell them in the community for her income.

Honorata is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to buy different vegetable seeds to plant in her backyard to sell more vegetables in the future.

Honorata dreams that someday she could have a big farm for her vegetables so that she can meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds for her business.

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur is a father of three children. He is engaged in a corn farm business. He has been in this field for four years and earns 38,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) every harvest season. His wife also sells pancit (noodles) in the village where they are living for additional income. They work hard to give his children a good quality of life and lift them from poor living conditions. At this time, Arthur wants a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy corn seedlings and fertilizers, and to pay for the labor cost for planting. He hopes to grow his business and harvest more corn to sell.

loans.use: to buy corn seedlings and fertilizers, and to pay for the labor cost for planting.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is 30 years old and lives in Talic, Oroquieta City. He is single. 

Randy has a beauty salon business and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase equipment for his beauty salon.

Randy has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Randy hopes to earn money in order to helped his parents. He is a hardworking son, and an honest and respectful person. Randy loves his family and he is also a breadwinner in his family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for his beauty salon.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie is from Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 31 years old and married with two school-aged children. Girlie owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products like soap, sugar, shampoo, salt, dried fish, food for snacks, soft drinks, noodles, eggs and other items in the local community.

Girlie is very glad and thankful to the cooperative and to the people who supported the previous loan she acquired from GDMPC. She started with a meager amount of capital and now her general store is expanding. The investment grows well. The return is excellent. She was able to send her child to a good school and she oftentimes provides for her family's needs.

Girlie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Girlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional grocery products to sell. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Girlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is 45 years old and lives in Talairon, Oroquieta City. She is married with 3 children. Dinah has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Dinah has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to earn money because she wants to have a grocery store. She is a MIGS (member in good standing) member of PMPC. She has a happy family with five children.  She is an honest person and God fearing.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Mrs. Chann, 44 years old and the mother of two single children, is in the business of fishing alongside her husband. She has operated this business for 6 years on the bank of the Tonle Sap River. This couple tries hard to catch fish from the river, earning an average of $4 per day. However, the business activity mainly depends on fishing materials. 

Chann decided to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva in order to purchase some fishing materials to replace the old ones. She hopes that those new materials will enable her to catch more fish and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase some fishing materials to replace the old ones.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Selling grocery items such as sardines, coffee, milk, sugar, soap and detergents to the people in her neighborhood allows Veronica to acquire a minimum daily profit of P200. She has been operating her small store, located just in front of her house, for almost 10 years. 

At this moment, she has to replenish items sold but she has insufficient capital to buy more soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles and shampoo to sell in her store. Profits gained last month were used to buy medicines and vitamins because she has been ill these past few days. 

She is 60 years old and has five grown up children. In the future, Veronica would like to improve her sales and bring back her strength to continuously operate her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, instant noodles and shampoo to sell in her store.

loans.name: Zosa

texts.en: Zosa is 34 years old and lives in Dipolog City. She is married with 3 children. Zosa has a transportation business and earns approximately PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase parts for motorcycle repair and the renewal of her motorcycle  registration. She has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

loans.use: to purchase parts for motorcycle repair and for renewal of her motorcycle registration.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is a 52-year-old single woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has been in the hog-raising business for 5 years. Aurea works hard to improve her business. She extends support in sending her nephews and nieces to school.

Aurea has requested a loan to purchase feeds and piglets. She hopes to have a stable business and improved living conditions. She also hopes for her nephews and nieces to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and piglets

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 50 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is married with 1 child. Susan has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 3,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. She has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло замужем имеет четверых детей. Она вместе с мужем стараются создать все условия для семьи. Они занимаются откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Откорм скота приносит хорошую прибыль. В настоящее время можно закупить скот по низким ценам и к весне после откорма продать дороже. Она хочет получить займ в размере 12500 сомони для ремонта дома. Она хочет завершить штукатурку дома. Построить забор и завершить стяжку тротуара во дворе. Она надеется на вашу помощь и к весне завершить свои работы.
texts.en: Shahlo is married and has four children. Together with her husband, Shahlo works hard to provide for her family. She earns her livelihood by raising and selling cattle, which brings in a good income. At this time of the year, it is possible to buy livestock at a low price, and sell them at a higher rate in the spring, having fattened them up. Shahlo would like a loan of 12,500 TJS to remodel her home. She wants to finish plastering the walls, build a fence, and complete installing a walkway in the yard. She is counting on your help, and will finish her work by spring.

loans.use: to remodel her home.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 47 years old and lives in Bolibol, Oroquieta City. She is married with 5 children. Elvira has a clothing business and earns approximately PHP  10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 8,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yohanis

texts.en:
Yohanis, a 32-year-old man, is married to Yunita, a 26-year-old lady. They have a son named Alfa, 1 year old. Yohanis and family are living in a modest house.

Yohanis is a motorbike mechanic. Prior to running his own business, Yohanis  used to work in a repair shop for two years. As the breadwinner in his family, Yohanis is responsible for covering their daily needs. 

While running his business, Yohanis may have to hire some equipment as he has not not been able to buy his own. Yohanis is thinking to purchase a compressor, inner tubes, lubricant, etc. to support his business.  
 
Yohanis got information that TLM provides an Individual Lending Program to those who want to improve their businesses, particularly for micro and small entrepreneurs.  He is interested in joining the loan program and he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 6,000,000 from TLM. He really hopes that TLM will approve his loan application so he can improve his business and provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor, inner tubes, lubricant, etc.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda's main source of income comes from selling electronic products in her community. She is 56 years old, married, and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Rosenda has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosenda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en: Chona is 30 years old and lives in Mobod, Oroquieta City. She is married and has no children. Chona has a barbeque and vegetable vending business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase ingredients for her barbecue and to purchase more vegetables for her vegetable vending as well. Chona has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her barbecue and to purchase more vegetables for her vegetable vending.

loans.name: Sari Karya Group

texts.en:
To continue to increase their businesses, the group is requesting another loan. This loan will be used to buy more piglets, feed and for renovation the pigpen.

Ni Ketut succeeded in raising two pigs and sold them with a satisfactory price. She sold the pigs at the price of Rp.3.600.000. and after deducting all the costs, she earns a profit of about Rp.1,500,000. She plans to use her profit to develop the business, set aside savings, and for daily life. 

The new loan will be used to buy 4 more piglets and she will buy the feed from the profit that she earned. The business can help her family, specially to support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy 4 piglets.

loans.name: Roma Fe Group

texts.en:
Roma Fe is 58 years old and lives in Molicay, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with four children. Roma Fe has a sari-sari store business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Roma Fe has been a member of PMPC for about one month. In the future, she hopes to be successful in her business dealings. She is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Nizomjon

texts.ru: Низомчон несколько лет занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур и крупного рогатого скота. Он женатый отец троих детей. Воспитание и содержание семьи в настоящее время требует больших усилий. Он на земле выращивает лук и пшеницу. Работа на земле кропотливый труд и требует большого внимания. Он хочет получить займ для обработки земли, покупки минеральных удобрений и семян. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и получить займ в размере 3000 сомони. Он заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: For the past few years, Nizomjon has grown crops and raised cattle. He is a married father of three children. In today's difficult times raising children and supporting a family takes a lot of effort. On his farm, Nizomjon grows onions and wheat. Working on the land is painstaking labour, and requires utmost attention. He wants a loan to prepare the soil, and buy mineral fertilizers and seeds. He is counting on your support and hopes to receive a loan of 3,000 TJS. He is thankful in advance.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a humble tricycle driver. He is 35 years old and married, with two young children. The family lives in Capatan, Tuguegarao City.  Fred has  provided motorcycle transport to the people in this area for almost 10 years. This is what occupies his daily schedule from 6am to 5pm, Mondays through Saturdays. He is a family-oriented person so he spends Sundays with his family. 
 
Fred had to buy new tires but he had insufficient funds so he has asked for  a loan of P13,000. He also plans to spend part of the loan for maintenance to ensure safety for his passengers and himself.

In the future, he would like to earn consistent profits to renovate his house, which was destroyed by a typhoon a few months ago. He also wants to save  for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy new tires and  pay for maintenance for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Ernawati

texts.en:
Ernawati is a 26-year-old lady who is married to Thobias, a 32-year-old man. From their marriage, they are blessed with three children namely: Putra, 7,  attending Primary School, grade 2; Kezia, 4, attending Kindergarten; and Rosalin, 6 months. 

Ernawati owns a business selling woman’s clothing, shoes and bags. She has been engaged in this business for five years. From the business, Ernawati is able to help her husband in covering her family needs. 

Ernawati initiated her business by selling clothing using her own capital. Since her business is improved Ernawati orders more stock from Java Island.  Ernawati usually sells her products from one house to another but there are also some customers who come directly to buy her products. 

Ernawati really enjoys running the business. Currently, she intends to add different items such as sofas, kitchen utensils, bags and sheets as demanded by the customers. She believes that these products will sell out, especially before Christmas.

Therefore, she would like to request a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 8,000,000. She is expecting that TLM is willing to assist her in improving her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sofa, kitchen utensils, bags and sheets to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla is widowed with three children. She is 43 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. Perla sells assorted fruits to earn a living and has had this business for 12 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 24,000 to purchase assorted fruits worth PHP 24,000 for resale. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fruits worth PHP 24,000 for resale.

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
This group, consisting of four members, comes from Siem Reap province. They’ve joined together to ask for some funds from Kiva for their own different purposes.  Among them, Mrs. Son, 29, is the leader of this group. She is a fishery worker, earning a profit of $3 per day to support her family. She has 3 single children who are attending the local public school. 

Recently, Son prepared to fix her present house partially, but she needs a loan from Kiva in the sum of $100 to supplement her saved money to pay local laborers who come to fix her house. She would like to say thanks to all lenders who kindly help her family and other members of her group.

loans.use: to pay local laborers who come to fix her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, beans, leafy vegetables and fruits for her business.

loans.name: Tursunkul

texts.ru: Турсункул занимается бизнесом на протяжении 25 лет. Он женат, имеет детей. Старший сын женился. В бизнесе ему помогают жена и невестка.  Именно полученные доходы помогают ему содержать семью. В настоящее время он имеет несколько голов крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Он хочет получить займ в размере 3000 сомони и приобрести одну корову. Он надеется на ваше великодушие и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Tursunkul has had his business for 25 years. He is married, with children. His oldest son is married. Tursunkul's wife and daughter-in-law help him with his business. The income he brings in allows him to support his family. At this time, he has several heads of cattle and other livestock. He would like a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy a cow. He is counting on your generosity and is grateful to you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Rodiyanto

texts.en:
Rodiyanto, a 29-year-old entrepreneur is married to Fransiska, a 29 -year-old lady. Rodiyanto and Fransiska have a daughter, named Chelsea, 1 year old. 

Rodiyanto owns an internet cafe business; it is located about one km from his residence. He has been running the business for three years. The business is operated from 8 am to 11 pm; it depends on the customers' needs. While running the business, Rodiyanto has been able to buy a photo printing machine to generate more money.  

Rodiyanto is a hard worker and has a passion to improve his business. Currently, he intends to purchase a used photocopy machine but doesn’t have money to do so. Therefore, he is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. Rodiyanto is hoping that TLM will assist him in improving his business through the loan assistance.

loans.use: to purchase a used photocopy machine.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is widowed with three children. Milagros is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Milagros is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippines pesos to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig business.
 
Milagros has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins for her pig business.

loans.name: Usaha Ternak Group

texts.en:
After having evaluated last period, Wayan finds she needs another loan to improve her business. The last loan was used to buy 4 piglets, and now she has a plan to buy a saw. She has a plan to become a piglet seller. 

Because of the business, now she can improve her income and support her husband. Wayan has a dream to renovate her house when she has enough profit to do that. That’s why she is saving from now on.

loans.use: to buy a saw.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Epifanía Group

texts.es:
Keylin es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Epifanía, con apenas 18 años de edad, es una joven muy emprendedora, que tiene muchas  ganas de superarse, es estudiante y está por terminar la secundaria , vive con sus padres y hermanos,  siempre ha buscado la manera de ayudar a su familia, por ello realiza actividades comerciales, vende ropa y bisutería a sus compañeras del colegio y a vecinas de la comunidad, con la intención de ayudarse con los estudios y no ser una carga más para sus padres, que no cuentan con los recursos económicos necesarios para brindarle los estudios a ella y al resto de sus hermanos. 
Este es el primer crédito que solicita, gracias a la invitación y al buen ejemplo de su madre, que también pertenece a este grupo decidió integrarse. El crédito va ser de gran ayuda para ella ya que le permitirá invertir en la compra de mercadería, aprender desde ahora a administrar y hacer crecer su negocio, pero principalmente le dará la oportunidad de obtener un ingreso propio para poder seguir estudiando, ya que su mayor sueño es llegar a ser una profesional, capaz de ayudar a su familia y colaborar también a pagar los estudios de sus hermanos. 
En esta operación de crédito con Keylin están; Kenia, Flor y Xinia, que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y de avicultura.
texts.en:
Keylin is one of the members of "Banco Mujer Epifanía." At barely 18 she is a very enterprising young woman who has a lot of desire to get ahead. She is a student and is about to finish her secondary studies. She lives with her parents and siblings and has always looked for a way to help her family. So she engages in business activities, selling clothes and costume jewelry to her classmates at school and to the neighbors in the area. She intends to help herself with her studies and not be one more burden to her parents, who do not have the necessary economic resources to provide an education to her and the rest of her siblings. 

This is the first loan she has sought, thanks to the invitation and good example of her mother, who also belongs to this group she decided to join. The loan will be a great help to her since it will allow her to invest in the purchase of merchandise, and start learning how to run and grow her business. But primarily it will give her the opportunity to obtain her own income in order to stay in school, since her biggest dream is to become a professional, capable of helping her family and contributing also to the costs of her siblings' educations. 

In this loan operation, along with Keylin are: Kenia, Flor and Xinia, who are going to invest in business activities and poultry farming.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and costume jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 39 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba. She is married and has two children. 

Gemma has a shop that sells assorted groceries and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Gemma has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Reymundo

texts.en: Reymundo is 40 years old. He is married and has four children, three of whom are still studying. They live in Villa Concepcion, Isabela, where he manages their corn field. He has been on his farm for eight years. He only earned 5,000 PHP with his last crop because of an unexpected typhoon. His wife also operates a sari-sari store (variety store) based in their home where she sells groceries and daily goods. They are both thankful because the income they generate from their businesses helps them provide for their daily needs and enables them to continue sending their children to school. Now, Reymundo is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested and he promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 60 years old and lives in Capatan, Tuguegarao City, with her spouse and three children. She has eight children but five of them have settled into marriage and live separately from them. She operates a small store to earn an income. She has been doing this for nearly 10 years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month.

She is asking for a loan to stock more grocery items in her store because nowadays she has many competitors in their village. She needs to improve her services rendered to her customers. She needs a loan amount of 13,000 PHP to buy bread, coffee, milk, sugar and eggs to sell in her store. 

In the future, Maria hopes to see her small store grow into a larger one. She wants to make consistent profits to provide for a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, coffee, milk, sugar and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marga Damai Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut sold her pigs for 1,200,000 Rupiah (IDR) each, yielding a respectable profit. With her profits, and with the help of a new loan from MUK, she plans to purchase additional pigs. 

The last loan helped her to buy four superior quality pigs and she already sold them at a good price. The profit helped her to fulfill they daily needs. She has a dream to get her children to university, so their lives will be better than their parent's.

loans.use: To buy a superior quality pig.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 54 years old and presently lives in Upper Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. He is married and has four children at adult ages.

He maintains his business to support himself. He has been in this business for nearly 15 years. He has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase feed for his hog-raising business.

Milagros has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for three years. In the future, Milagros hopes that he can help with the needs of his family and live a god-fearing life.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Mamajon

texts.ru: Мамаджон 10 лет назад начал заниматься услугами такси. Он женат имеет одного сына. Сын помогает ему в бизнесе. На своей автомашине он предоставляет услуги такси населению. Он хочет получить займ в размере 10000 сомни для ремонта своего дома. Зимой стройматериалы можно закупить по низким ценам. Он на полученный займ хочет закупить стройматериалы для ремонта дома. Он надеется на вашу поддержку и благодарен вам.
texts.en: Ten years ago, Mamajon started a taxi service. He is married and has one son. His son helps him with his business. Using his own car, Mamajon provides a taxi service to the community. He would like a loan of 10,000 TJS to remodel his home. During winter, building materials are available at low prices. With funds from the loan, he would like to purchase building materials to remodel his home. He is counting on your support and is thankful to you.

loans.use: to remodel his home.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
At age 19, Jonalyn got married. Now age 39, she is still married and blessed with three children. Her children are in high school and elementary school. Jonalyn's priority in life is to prepare for the college level of education for her children. She wants to see that her children will become professionals some day.

Jonalyn runs a rice-farming business with an area of five hectares. She and her husband manage their farm. She has been in this business since she got married. Jonalyn and her husband are conducting some field activities to minimize their labor expenses. Since they don’t have enough capital to hire laborers, Jonalyn is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides, and pay for the labor costs of rice farming.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds of rice, fertilizers and herbicides, and pay for the labor cost of rice farming.

loans.name: Lobar

texts.ru: Лобар замужем, любящая мать троих детей. Она занимается купле продажей товаров ежедневного потребления. Ее доходы помогают ей в содержании семьи. Она ежедневно обновляет ассортимент своего товара. Приближаются новогодние праздники и она желает пополнить ассортимент товаров магазина. Но для этого ей нужны средства. Она хочет получить займ  в размере 5000 сомони для расширения своего бизнеса. Она уверенна, что не останется без внимания и найдет поддержку с вашей стороны. Она заранее благодарит вас. Cпасибо!
texts.en: Lobar is married and is a loving mother of three children. She buys and sells groceries and goods for everyday use. Her income helps her to support the family. She renews the variety of the merchandise daily. The New Year holidays are quickly approaching and she would like to restock her store inventory assortment. She needs money to do this. Lobar wants to take out a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to expand her business. She is certain she won't be overlooked and will find support from your side. She is thanking all of you in advance. Thank you!

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina, the leader of this group, is 25, married to a farmer, and the mother of two sons. The older son studies at school and the younger son is of preschool age (under seven). A year ago, with an initial investment of 10,000 soms, Zarina started to sell home products, earning about 6500 soms per month. She is requesting this loan to buy sugar, macaroni, detergents, etc. In the near future Zarina plans to increase the commodity turnover of her trade up to 100,000 soms.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy sugar, macaroni and detergents.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Raising hogs is quite difficult because it requires extra patience and proper maintenance to ensure hogs proper growth and nutrition. Jessie got involved in this kind of business as source of income because she was not able to seek other employment. She only finished high school before getting engaged and married.

She breeds and raises hogs and, upon reaching maturity, sells them to the butchers who come into her village. She has had this business for almost three years now.  

Jessie is 35 years old and has three children, all of whom attend school. She is now asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy livestock feed and vaccines to make her business sustainable. She wants to ensure proper growth of hogs to sell them at a higher price.

In the future, Jessie wants to construct her own pigpen. At the moment, the pigpen she uses for her hogs is owned by her in-laws. She also wants to provide a better living for her family.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en:
Mairamkul is the leader of this borrower group. She is 36 and married to a driver, and together they are raising two sons and two daughters. Except for their youngest daughter, all of their children study at school.

In order to make a living, Mairamkul sells detergent, beverages, socks and many other home products. She started this business five years ago with an initial investment of 8,000 soms. Her monthly profit from this trade is 8,000 soms, and it has made it possible for her to increase the turnover of goods in her business and to build a shed at home where she keeps livestock.

Mairamkul plans to use the proceeds from this loan to buy detergent, sugar, oil and tobacco for trade. In the future, she hopes to use profits realized from her business to purchase furniture to improve her family's living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, sugar, oil and tobacco

loans.name: Furkat

texts.ru: Фуркат работает в центральном местном больнице. Его зарплата не хватает на содержании жены и детей. Поэтому он открыл свой бизнес, который приносить ему стабильный доход. Он занимается выращиванием пшеницы более 6 лет и успешен в своем деле. Его жена помогает ему в бизнесе, особенно по обработки земли и посева семян. Фуркат хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли для того чтобы улучшить свое домашние условия. С этой целью он запрашивает займ, и просить вашу поддержку. Он заранее благодарен вам за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Furkat works at the local central hospital.  His salary is not sufficient to support his wife and children, and this is why he started his own business, which brings him a stable income.  He has been involved in growing wheat for over six years and is successful in his business.  Furkat's wife helps him with the business, especially with treating land and sowing seeds.  Furkat wants to expand his business and make a desired profit in order to improve his living conditions.  He is requesting this loan for this purpose and asks for your support.  Furkat thanks you in advance for you kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to expand his business and make a desired profit

loans.name: Khushrat

texts.ru: Хушрат трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать двоих детей. Её муж скотовод. Хушрат занимается выращиванием пшеницы более 7 лет и одновременно занимается скотоводством. Она хочет увеличить свое поле для посева, чтобы получить хороший урожай. С прибыли она хочет ремонтировать свой дом и создать хорошие условия дома. Ей в бизнесе помогают дети. Хушрат хотела бы получить займ для покупки скота и семена пшеницы.
texts.en: Khushrat is a hardworking and conscientious woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of two children.  Her husband is involved in animal husbandry.  Khushrat has been growing wheat for over seven years and is also involved in animal husbandry.  She wants to increase the size of her field for sowing in order to get a good harvest.  She wants to use the profits to repair her house and create good living conditions.  Khushrat's children help her with the business.  She wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of livestock and wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy livestock and wheat seeds

loans.name: Shurukan's Group

texts.en:
Shurukan is the leader of this group. She is 57 and married to a retiree. Together with her husband she has raised a daughter and a son, both of whom work in Russia. 

Six years ago with an initial investment of 15,000 KGS, Shurukan started a livestock breeding business. Reselling livestock after fattening, she earns about 5,000 KGS per month. This profit allows her to meet their daily needs. 

With money from the loan, Shurukan wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the near future, she plans to enlarge a shed to be able to keep more animals.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a married woman with two children. Perlita is 43 years old, residing at Calamba, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines.

Perlita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products such as shampoo, diapers, soaps and many others. She has been in this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this business.

She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase products to resell. Perlita has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, she wants to expand her store and to enable her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase products to resell.

loans.name: Gairatjon

texts.ru: Гайрат женат и ответственный отец троих детей.  Он матер этим своим мастерством он зарабатывает мало денег. Его дети выросли, ему необходимо их устроит их  в хороших садиках и школах. С этой цель он начал заниматься выращиванием пшеницы 5 лет назад. Этот бизнес приносит ему хорошие доходы, и он хочет расширить этот бизнес. Гайрат планирует получить хорошую прибыль и хочет провести хатнатуй сына. Гайрат хотел бы получить займ для расширения бизнеса и покупки семян пшеницы для посева.
texts.en: Gairat is married and is a responsible father of three children.  He earns little money from his craftsmanship work.  His children are growing up, and he needs to place them into good kindergartens and schools.  This is why he started to grow wheat five years ago.  This business brings him a good income, and he wants to expand this business. Gairat plans to make a good profit and wants to hold a hatnatuy (circumcision) ceremony for his son.  Gairat wants to obtain this loan to expand his business and buy wheat seeds for sowing.

loans.use: to expand his business and buy wheat seeds for sowing

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is 26 years old, married and has one child. He is married to a bookkeeper who is his partner in supporting their family. 

Virgilio has managed a rice farming business for four years. He earns approximately an income of PHP 50,000 per crop in his three hectares of rice field. Due to an unexpected typhoon that destroyed his crops, Virgilio earned just PHP 25,000 last crop.
  
Virgilio’s earnings last crop went for their household expenses. Some leftover amount will be used to pay the labor costs of farming. 

Virgilio is currently facing a financial shortage to maintain his farm. He is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy rice seeds to grow, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care. He knows the loan will help him to maintain his farming business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for plant care.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
A business oriented person named Glenda lives in Bagumbayan, Tuguegarao City. She lives with her husband and four lovely children. 

Glenda established a food selling business a year ago. She cooks and sells daily meals and snacks such as pansit (a term for noodles in Filipino cuisine), pork and chicken viands. Her daily schedule runs from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.. She usually earns about PHP 5,000 each month. The income serves as revolving capital and part of it pays for stall rentals and the allowances of her children.

Glenda now asks for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy pork and chicken meat, eggs, onions, vegetables and rice to use in her food selling business. She needs to improve her sales to attract more customers and boost her profits. 

In the future, Glenda would like to make her business more profitable and own a stall.

loans.use: to buy pork and chicken meat, eggs, onions, vegetables and rice to use in her food selling business.

loans.name: Rogelio Jr.

texts.en:
Rogelio is single and he is 20 years old, residing at Calamba, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. 

Rogelio is operating a fishing business, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for two years. Each month, he earns 5,600 PHP doing this business. 

He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. 

Rogelio has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Rogelio wants to save a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda started her general store after she married Martin. The couple is blessed with six children, and five of them are in school. Their eldest is already working in Manila as a factory worker. Erlinda and her family live in the village of San Ignacio province of Isabela. Their main dialect is Ybanag, the local language in their place. 

Erlinda wants to borrow PHP 15,000 as additional business capital for her store. She plans to use the loan to buy additional merchandise to meet the demands of her customers. Although her business is not that big, it contributes a lot to sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, noodles and spices for her store.

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru: Акрам более тридцати лет занимается индивидуальным пошивом и ремонтом обуви. Он женат, имеет троих совершеннолетних детей. Старший сын пошел по стопам отца, и занимается данным ремеслом жена швея. Они вместе стараются создавать хорошие жилищные условия. Он является владельцем небольшого ремонтного цеха по пошиву и ремонту обуви. Под его  руководством работают три работника. Он хочет получить займ для расширения площади своего цеха и приобретения дополнительного оборудования для пошива обуви. Он надеется получить займ и расширить свой бизнес к зимнему сезону.
texts.en: Akram has been involved in individual shoe-making and repairs for over thirty years.  He is married and has three adult children.  His oldest son followed his father's steps and is involved in the same business, and Akram's wife is a seamstress.  Together, they try to provide good living conditions.  Akram is the owner of a small shoe-making and repair shop and has three employees working under his supervision.  He wants to obtain this loan to expand his shop space and buy additional shoe-making equipment.  Akram hopes to get this loan and expand his business for the winter season.

loans.use: to expand his shop space and purchase additional shoe-making equipment

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. He is 52 years old, married to Mary.  

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, James hopes to improve his farming and get more income so as to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia makes a living running a general store in the rural village of San Ignacio. She aspires to have her business grow and be competitive with other stores in their village. She has four children with Monato, her husband, who works as an overseas Filipino worker in Saudi. Their four children are all studying. They need to help each other to give them a good education so that some day all of them will have a good future. Their eldest is now 15 years old, studying in high school with their second child. The two younger children are both in elementary school. 

Alicia is asking for a loan to be used as additional business capital to purchase commodities for her general store. She hopes to access a loan of PHP 25,000 that will surely be very useful in the improvement of her store. Alicia believes that time is gold; thus, they work very hard and help each other in the progress of their daily lives, doing their best not to waste time.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, coffee, sugar, soy sauce and spices for her store.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
“Time is gold” is a quotation that Vicenta applies in her life. She is 46 years old and married to Fernando, who is a farmer. Together, they have three children. Farming is the main source of income for their family. In order to provide for the growing needs of their family, Vicenta and her husband decided to start a hog raising business.

Vicenta would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 22,000. She will use the loan for the maintenance of her hogs and to buy enough feed for their growth. She is also planning to purchase new piglets for additional income. She is very patient in raising the hogs because she knows that raising them is a big help in meeting her family's needs in a sustainable manner. Vicenta believes that by using her time wisely in her business, she will become successful.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and piglets for her business.

loans.name: Flaviana

texts.en:
Flaviana's priority in life is to earn an income for the education of her children. She is 48 years old, married and has four school age children. 

She used her skills in hair cutting and coloring and established a beauty salon as source of her income. She has been in this business for almost four years and earns about PHP 3,000 monthly. 

Flaviana is now requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more items such as scissors, cutters, towels, blowers, powders and hair dyes to use in her salon. She wants to purchase these necessary items to offer better services to her customers.

In the future, she would like to continuously provide a good education for her children to earn a degree and to seek for better employment someday.

loans.use: to buy more items such as scissors, cutters, towels, blowers, powders and hair dyes to use in her salon.

loans.name: Hamdam

texts.ru: Хамдам занимается перевозкой людей более 15 лет. Он женат и имеет четверо детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Его бизнес приносит ему хорошую прибыль, и он улучшил свое жилищное условия. Прибыль, который он получил от данного бизнеса, он строил один дом. Он хочет продолжать свой бизнес и улучшить свое благосостояние семьи. Хамдам хотел бы получить займ на устройство газового оборудования для своего автомобиля.
texts.en: Hamdam has been involved in transporting people for over 15 years.  He is married and has four children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Hamdam's business brings him a good profit, which enabled him to improve his living conditions.  He used the profit from this business to build one house.  Hamdam wants to continue his business and improve his family's livelihood.  He wants to obtain this loan to install gas equipment for his vehicle.

loans.use: to install gas equipment

loans.name: Ireneo

texts.en:
Ireneo is 57 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom are in high school.  He lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. Ireneo makes a living by farming, which he has been doing for 20 years. He plants seasonal fruits and vegetable to sell. He also drives a school service vehicle that gives him additional income.  He earns a minimum of 8,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every month.

Ireneo is requesting for a loan for 10 000 PHP, which he will use to buy items needed for planting such as fertilizer, pots, and seedlings. He expects a boost in his income as he expands his business. 

Ireneo hopes to send all his children to college to have a good future. Lke most Filipino parents, he believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents can give to their children. As a CCT community partner, he faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where he can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 21 years old and lives in the town of Natete in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is single and has two children who currently attend school. For the past four years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her salon where she does hairdressing for local women. Elizabeth's loan group is comprised of two hardworking women. 

Elizabeth is requesting a 700,000 UGX loan to help expand her business and purchase equipment needed to do special braids. Her loan will help her generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to own a boutique. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Elizabeth's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to do special braids

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is married woman and who is a responsible and hardworking mother of her kids. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of products in the community. 

Flordeliza is requesting a 22,000 PHP loan to buy different products for her store such as such as soap, snack foods, shampoo, and spices. In the future, she wishes that her dreams come true to so that she can meet the needs of her family and give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snack foods, shampoo, soap, and spices for her store

loans.name: Kala Yi Ngangu Plus Group

texts.en:
José, age 23, is the leader of the community bank “Kala Yi Ngangu Plus”, which is composed of 26 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through MFI (microfinance institution) HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

José is single with a two-year-old son. He runs a cellphone booth. He has been in business since 2009. He manages his cell phone booth in an area located east of the city of Kinshasa. He is happy to be one of MFI HOPE DRC's clients. He intends to use the next loan to buy prepaid cell phone cards to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each week, his business brings in a profit of $40. His ambition is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase prepaid cell phone cards for resale.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy construction materials for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, and washing detergent

loans.name: Jhoniffer

texts.en:
Jhoniffer is 29 years old and married Gladys when they were only 19 years old. They now have three children who are all in school. Jhoniffer operates a passenger motorcycle business in the village at San Ignacio. He uses care and patience to maintain his business to provide his family with their daily needs and support the education of his children. Jhoniffer is also glad that his parents gave him a small farm which is a source of additional income. 

Jhoniffer is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan from Kiva lenders to buy spare parts to maintain his motorcycle. He hopes that lenders will give him the chance to improve his business and the welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Vakkos

texts.ru: Ваккос любящий отец и муж. Его жена работает в колхозе. Он сам 12 лет занимается садоводством и скотоводством. Он воспитывает одного ребенка. Для создания лучших условий для семьи он старается много работать. Он хочет получить займ в размере 5000  сомони для приобретения ГСМ и минеральных удобрений для подготовки земли к новому посеву. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарен вам.
texts.en: Vakkos is a loving father and husband.  His wife works at a collective farm.  Vakkos has been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 12 years/  He is raising one child and tries to work a lot to provide the best conditions for his family.  Vakkos wants to obtain a loan in the sum of 3000 somoni to buy fuel and lubricant materials and mineral fertilizers in order to prepare the land for a new sowing.  He hopes to get your help and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel and lubricant materials

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 47 years old and is married with three adult children. She is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. For the past four years, Norma has owned and operated a business where she makes and sells a variety of baked goods in the local community. She earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month and has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. 

Norma is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to invest in the expansion of her business by purchasing the raw ingredients she needs to prepare her baked goods. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make baked goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a dairy unit and buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 62 years old, a mixed crop farmer. She is married to Gathuita who is also a farmer. They are blessed with one child age 30 years. Margaret has been in the farming business as the primary business and selling secondhand clothes as the secondary business for the past 20 years, with a monthly income of 9,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Margaret will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses she will open a retail shop. 

Her hopes and dreams are to venture into a wholesale shop business which will help her educate her child up to university level and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a 36-year-old a business lady. She is married to Paul who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, ages 10 and 8 years respectively. Regina has been running a boutique as a primary business and farming as the secondary business for the past 5 years, with a monthly income of 10,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term with KADET after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Regina will use the loan to buy new clothes to add to her boutique and seedlings. 

With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, she will expand her shop. Her hope and dream is to open another boutique in a different site which will provide for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to add to her boutique and seedlings for the farm

loans.name: Geno

texts.en:
Geno is 26 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is single and has a pig business to earn a living. He requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase feeds and vitamins.

Geno has been a member of PMPC for less than one year. In the future, he hopes to have more income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Khwaka Group

texts.en:
Greetings from the Khwaka Group in Western Kenya! Phylis is the facilitator of the group. This group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Phylis takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phylis had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Phylis was only able to harvest 3.5 bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phylis and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Phylis will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of the Khwaka group will each plant between ½ and one acre of maize.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, nails and glue for the carpentry workshop

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 34 years old and lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. Rosalina is married and has 2 children. Rosalina sells different types of products to earn a living. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to purchase dried fish for her retail business. Rosalina has been a member of PMPC for 2 months. In the future, Rosalina hopes to have a big business someday.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for her retail business

loans.name: Bidii S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is the facilitator of the Bidii S.H.G. group. Elizabeth and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Elizabeth takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund for its low prices, to ensure food security for her family, and, later, to educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acres of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Bidii S.H.G. will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Chile

texts.en:
Chile is 33 years old and lives in Helen, Larena, Siquijor. She is separated from her husband and without children. To earn a living, Chile has a business selling finished food products, like sausage, delivered to her neighboring village. She earns about 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her sausage business. 

Chile has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year. In the future, Chile would to expand and acquire a permanent space to display her products in the right location.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her sausage business

loans.name: Simeona

texts.en:
This is Simeona; she is 61 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is a mother to five children. All of her children already have their own families. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses. 

Simeona operates an ornamental plant business. She grows ornamental plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, dahlias and orchids. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors, and the community. She's been in this business for five years, earning a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of 18,000 PHP. She will be use the money to buy things needed for planting such as fertilizer, pots, seedlings, plastics, and wires. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Simeona hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 34 years old, married, and has three children who attends school. He has operated his timber sales business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  

Thomas is requesting his first loan, which he will use to buy more stock to sell in his business.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of its field officers. 

In future, Thomas hopes to open more branches in Ndunyu Njeru and earn more profits, thereby becoming one of the leading businessmen in the area.

loans.use: to purchase more timber to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 26-year-old married woman and has one child, not in school. Rose has had a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for 4 years.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Apolline

texts.en:
Apolline is 49 years old and is a widow. She has 4 children, ages 16 to 30. 

Apolline sells used clothes in a store she has run for 4 years. She would like a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the profits to make renovations on her house and provide food for her family. She would like to continue to buy clothes in bulk and sell them for a profit.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old, an enterprising business lady. She is married to James who is a businessman. They are blessed with two children, ages 19 and 17 years, respectively. 

Mary has been running a green grocer in an open air market for the past 3 years, with a monthly income of 8,000 KES which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Mary will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profits from the business, she will venture into selling cereals. Her hopes and dreams are to educate her children up to university level and improve the living standard of the family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Sarepta Plus Group

texts.en:
Sarepta Plus is a Community Bank made up of 26 micro entrepreneurs. Their chairwoman is Isabelle. These members are united by the same goal- to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.

Isabelle operates a drugstore in the eastern suburban area of Kinshasa. She is 46 years old, married and the mother of three children who are between the ages of 14 and 18. Two of them attend school. 

Isabelle began her business in 2006. With hard work and good management, and by providing good customer service, Isabelle’s business has prospered and has permanent customers to keep it up. Her business generates about 70 USD of profit per week. Isabelle's strength is purchasing appropriate drugs for her customers. 

Isabelle has already received seven loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and successfully repaid them. With the next loan, she is planning to expand her business by buying more medicine needed by her customers. Her ambition is to open another drugstore.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her drugstore needed by her customers.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Fausto

texts.en:
Fausto is a resident and a farmer in the Murang'a area of Central Kenya. He is 31 and married with one child, age 6 years. Fausto has been in farming for 10 years and currently produces coffee and milk for the local market.

Fausto has made a loan request of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him purchase poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming. He says he wants to spread his farming risks and likes the faster turnovers in the poultry business. He is looking forward to supplying the local market with both birds and eggs.

However, Fausto mentions the high cost of feed as the main challenge, but reiterates with available loans, farming has a better future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz is 50 years old and lives in Tinago, Siquijor with her husband and 11 children. She earns about PHP 5,000 a month by raising pigs and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy feed and medicine for her animals. She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for almost a year, and hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her herd of pigs.

loans.name: Umucyo / Pr Group

texts.fr:
Siméon fait partie du groupe Umucyo/Pr. Il a 38 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 1 à 7 ans, Dont 2 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 1 an de secondaire.

Siméon est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz.  Dans les prochaines années, Siméon voudrait agrandir la surface de culture de riz. Avec les profits, Siméon prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Siméon is a member of the Umucyo/Pr group.  He is 38 years old, married, and has four children who are between 1 and 7 years old.  Two of his children are in school.  Siméon himself studied for one year at high school. 

Siméon is a rice farmer and this is his second loan cycle with ACB.  He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop.

Siméon's strategy for growing his business is to grow selected rice seeds.  In the coming years, he would like to expand the area over which he grows his rice.  With his profits, he plans to educate and take care of his children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice crop

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 53 years, married, has two children and earns a living by raising livestock. He has been in this line of work for 15 years and earns an income of KES 10,000 a month which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after having been introduced to our organization by an existing customer. Joel will use the loan to buy animal feed and a young cow. He hopes to use the increased profit he earns as a result of this loan to improve his family's living standards and start putting money aside to open a retail store in the future.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and a young cow.

loans.name: Ruferia

texts.en: Ruferia is 58 years old and lives in Sandugan, Larena, Siquijor. She is married and has no children. For the last six years, she has earned about PHP 6,000 a month by selling fish. She is applying for a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy fresh fish from boats arriving in the local harbor. Ruferia has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for one year, and hopes to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en: Odette is 31 years old and has two children, ages 2 and 5. She is married to a businessman. She sells shoes in a store she has been running for 12 years. Odette would like a loan to add more shoes to her store. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business. She would like to have a booming business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for resale

loans.name: Sango B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sango B Group in Western Kenya! Maureen is the facilitator of the Sango B group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Maureen  takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Maureen had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Maureen was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Maureen  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Maureen will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sango B group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The total number of members is 11 but two were absent when the photo was taken.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 27 years old and has two children, ages 3 and 5. Both of her children are in school. She is married to a technician. Therese sells bed sheets in a store she has been running for five years. She will use the loan to buy more bed sheets to expand her business. She will use any profits to reinvest in her business and renovate her house. She would love to see her business prosper.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is from Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Norma is married and has three adult children. 

To make a living, Norma sells soft drinks in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for more than four years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

Norma is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2010, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and her living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Umoja B Group

texts.en:
Selina is the facilitator of the Umoja B group. Selina and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Selina takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Selina had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 6 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Selina was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Selina and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Selina will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Umoja B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Selina is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ganbold

texts.en: Ganbold is 24 years old and lives with his mother in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. His mother is a retired woman who stays at home.
