loans.name: Ayshen

texts.ru:
Ayshen yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Karbadjar, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Ona uje 14 kak zamujem i u neyo dve lubimiye dochki. Ayshen rodilas v 1974 qodu.

 Uje bolshe 5 let kak ona zanimayetsya prodajey odejdi. Ayshen prosit 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zimnuyu odejdu novogo sezona dlya pereprodaji. Ona xochet razvit svoy bizness i uvelichet kolichestvo tovarov. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas i svoyey podrugi, Ayshen pomogala yey v yeyo rabote no posle chego spusta neskalko let ona otkrila svoy magazin.
texts.en:
Ayshen is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP). She was resettled from Karbadjar to the Absheron region where she now lives with her family. She has been married for 14 years and has two beloved daughters. Ayshen was born in 1974. 

Ayshen has been selling clothing for over 5 years. She is requesting 2000 AZN in order to buy the winter clothing to sell for the upcoming season. She would like to expand her business and improve the quality of her goods. Ayshen began in business with a friend, but after a few years of helping her Ayshen left to open her own store.

loans.use: buy clothing for resale

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George offers houses for rent to earn an income. He used his previous loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to renovate his rental houses. This made the houses attractive and he obtained more tenants. 

To earn an additional income, George makes and sells furniture. He has requested a loan in the amount of 80,000 Kenya shillings to expand his furniture workshop. He desires to expand his business and to involve his children in running his business.

loans.use: to expand his furniture workshop

loans.name: Enhjargal

texts.en:
Enhjargal is 39 years old and lives with her two sons in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar district, Mongolia. Her elder son is a college student and her younger son is a student in school.

Enhjargal started her meat retailing business in early 2011 by renting a counter in a newly opened market. Her business was slow for several months. However, now that people know the market, her customers have increased so much that she can't meet their demand. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to buy livestock. Enhjargal is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kids are growing, they need my support more than anything so I will work as hard as I can."

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Skylane Jean

texts.en:
As a responsible mother, Skylane Jean operates a hog-raising business to generate income. She is 32 years old and has four school-aged children. Her husband manages their rice farming business. Sometimes the family experiences financial difficulties due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, but with their parents' help, they are able to supplement their needs. 

Skylane Jean aims to improve her hog-raising business and make it a viable source of income. She is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed, vitamins and breeding livestock to raise. She believes that the loan will help her to improve her business if she works hard and strives harder. In the future, she hopes to make her business grow and become profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and breeding livestock to raise

loans.name: Aguiar

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos todos frenquentam a Escola. Fez a 9ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras pela parte dos pais. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem. 

É electrecista ha mais de 14 anos e negociante ha mais de 5 anos dedica-se a venda de produtos de primeira nessecidade e tem um rendimento somando ao salario de 12.990.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt,com qual pretende comprar produtos(cebola, arroz, amendoim, farinha, oleo, e outros),para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer o seu negocio e casar oficialmente , para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Aguiar was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name in southern Mozambique. He is married and the father of two children, who are still in school. He went to school through the ninth grade but had to drop out because of his parents' financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a home they own, and isn't financially responsible for anyone else.

He's been an electrician for more than 14 years and a businessman for more than 5, buying and selling staple goods. He earns a total of 12,990 meticals a month. He uses the money to cover household expenses and is able to save some in his bank account.
He's never had a loan from other banks. He heard about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of the institution. This is his first loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20,000 meticals, which he will use to buy products (onions, rice, peanuts, flour, oil, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise he carries.
He is committed to paying off this loan without any problems and in the future intends to ask for further loans from Hluvuku so he can expand his business and get married.

loans.use: to buy products (onions, rice, peanuts, flour, oil, etc.) to increase the quantity of merchandise he carries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials (glass, windows, cement, beams, etc.) for his house.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Marlyn has operated a shop selling frozen food such as hotdogs, tocino (cured meat) and bacon for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of frozen food to sell. Marlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of frozen food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell products (soft drinks, beer, wine, juice, etc.)

loans.name: Simana Shg Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the facilitator of the Simana SHG group. Beatrice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Beatrice takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed her family and to have additional maize profits to educate her children. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had a good maize yield harvesting 7 ½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Beatrice was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Beatrice will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Simana SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Beatrice is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Izidro

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Mongincual, Província de Nampula, Norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 2 filhos ainda menores. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ele. 

Saiu de Nampula para Maputo no Distrito de Boane a procura de emprego, trabalha na empresa caminho de ferro de Moçambique (CFM) ha mais de 6 anos e tem um salario 5.328.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um colega de trabalho que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade com a obra da sua casa ( cimento, pedra, areia, ferro e outros). O emprestimo anterior foi de 7.000.00mt para a mesma finalidade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a sua casa e comprar mobiliario, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Izidro was born in the Mongincual district, Nampula province, in northern Mozambique.  He is married and father to two young children.  He completed school through the 7th grade but did not continue due to a lack of financial resources.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he supports two nephews who also live with him.  

He left Nampula for the Boane district of Maputo in search of work.  He has worked for the Mozambique railroad (CFM) for more than 6 years and earns a salary of 5.328.00mt per month which he uses for household expenses and savings in his bank account (BIM).

He has never had a loan with other banks.  He learned about Hluvuku through a coworker who is also a client.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction materials to continue building his home (cement, stones, sand, iron, etc.) The prior loan was for 7.000.00mt, for the same purpose.  

He promises to make his payments on time.  In the future he plans to finish his home and purchase furniture, and he intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to continue building his home (cement, stones, sand, iron, etc.)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 40-year-old divorced woman with five children, three of whom are in school. She has operated a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for seven years. Agnes has requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.fr:
Emmanuel  est né au Rwanda et a 28 ans. Il est marié avec 2 enfants de 1 à 6 ans. Il a aussi une autre personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est 4 ans de secondaire en mécanique automobile. 

Emmanuel est mécanicien dans un garage. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des matériaux de construction (ciment, portes et fenêtres métalliques) et payement main d’œuvre pour son business. 

Emmanuel voudrait agrandir son business en ajoutent d’autres matériels dans son garage, avoir des branches dans les différents localités dans le pays de son garage et avoir un garage compétitif avec les services de qualité. Il voudrait acheter la parcelle pour construire une maison pour sa famille et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Emmanuel is born in Rwanda. He is 28 years old. He is married with two children, one year and six years old. In addition to his children, he has one more dependent. His educational level is four years of secondary school, with the specialization in auto repair.

Emmanual is an auto mechanic in a repair shop. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy construction materials (concrete as well metal doors and windows) and pay the cost of labor for his business. Emmanuel would like to expand his business by adding additional materials, opening branch shops in different locations in his region and remaining competitive thanks to the high quality of auto repair services. He would like to purchase a land plot to build a house for his family and also to provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: buy construction materials (concrete as well metal doors and windows) and pay the cost of labor for his business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 46 years old, married and blessed with six children.  She used to farm crops to earn a living, but now she practices dairy farming.  She has been in the business for over ten years and has employed one person. She also relies on her husband for financial support.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Janet has been trained in business management skills.  This has helped her to improve her business.  She has also learned new farming methods from her group members. She needs a loan of 72,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Lucrencia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito da Manhiça, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, viuva e maê de 5  filhos destes  2 ainda frequentam escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou devido a gravidez precoce. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta 1 neto que vive com ela. 

Saiu da Manhiça para o Distrito de Boane quando se casou, tem um negocio proprio de venda de comidas, bebidas e outros produtos alimentares ha mais de 8 anos. Consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria e atraves de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa).
Nunca teve emprestimos noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos para aumentar a sua mercadoria (refrescos, cervejas, sumos, carne, arroz e outros). O emprestimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt aplicados na mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende fazer crescer ainda mais o seu negocio melhorando o seu estabelecimento comercial, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Lucrencia was born in the Manhiça district, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique. She is a widow and mother of 5 children, 2 of whom are still in school.  She completed school through the 7th grade but did not continue due to an early pregnancy.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she also supports one grandson who lives with her.  

She left Manhiça for the Boane district when she married.  She has had her own business selling meals, drinks, and other food items for more than 8 years.  She earns around 5.000.00mt per month which she uses for household expenses and savings both in her bank account and through Xitique, a traditional system of rotating savings.  

She has never had a loan in other banks.  She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 15.000.00mt, which she plans to use to buy products to increase her stock of merchandise (soft drinks, beer, juices, meat, rice, etc.) The prior loan was for 15.000.00mt and was used for the same purpose.  

She promises to make her payments on time and in the future she plans to grow her business even more by making improvements to her shop.  She intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for that purpose.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (soft drinks, beer, juice, meat, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Erdenechimeg, 49, is a seller of perfumeries. She has been in her business for three years. In addition to this job, she runs a second business selling casual clothes. She is widowed and now lives alone; all of her children have moved out. 

Erdenechimeg wants to improve her second business of clothes sales in order to increase her earnings. To do this, she is planning to increase her working capital first. After that, she will add to the types of clothes she sells according to her plan. The loan she is taking out will be used to purchase a large number of clothes from her suppliers to increase her business working capital.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of clothes from her suppliers to increase her business working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more detergent, shampoo & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tables and television sets for her hotel

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira is the leader of this group. She is 44 and unfortunately she is a widow. She has four children: three daughters and a son. The son and the youngest daughter study at school and the other two daughters are employed. In order to earn money for her livelihood, Elmira cultivates wheat and beets. She is also engaged in cattle breeding. Selling dairy products, she earns additional money to meet her daily needs. With money received from the loan Elmira plans to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to provide her younger children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Matutuine, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 5  filhos destes  2 ainda frequentam escola. Fez a 6ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta 1 neto que vive com ele. 

Saiu de Matutuine para o Distrito de Boane quando foi transferido pelos serviços, é motorista da empresa transporte ha mais de 4 anos e tem um salario de 3.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria. A esposa faz comercio de pequena escala ( vende produtos da primeira necessidade).
Nunca teve emprestimos  em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 16.000.00mt  com qual pretende comprar material de construção para melhorar a sua casa (aros de janelas, portas, loiça sanitaria e outros). Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt e 12.000.00mt aplicados no comercio e Habitação respectivamente.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende terminar a obra da sua casa e investir mais no seu negocio, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Matutuine, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. He is married and has five children, two of which still attend school. He completed 6th grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns and supports one grandson who lives with him.
He left Matutuine for the district of Boane when he got transferred because of his work. He has been a driver for a transportation company for over four years and earns a salary of 3.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account. His wife runs a small retail business (she sells essential goods).
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 16.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to make home improvements (window frames, doors, sanitary ware, etc.). The previous loans were for 6.000mt and 12.000mt, respectively for the retail business and for personal housing expenses.
He promises to repay according to the schedule. In the future he plans to finish building his house and to make more investments in his business. For those purposes he intends to request other loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to make home improvements (window frames, doors, sanitary ware, etc.).

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is 31 years old, and is married to Jane, who is a farmer. They are blessed with one child. Geoffrey has been offering motorbike transportation for the past two years.  He earns a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his third loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use the money to service his motorbike. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. He hopes to buy a public service vehicle in the future, which will help him improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To service his motorbike

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop where she sells detergent, beverages & shampoo. She has had this business for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more detergent, shampoo & beverages to sell. Veronica has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more detergent, shampoo & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to make home improvements (sand, cement, doors, sanitary ware, etc.).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair dryer and some stock of sugar and flour

loans.name: Bienjelesia Group

texts.en:
Eliud is the facilitator of the Bienjelesia group. Eliud and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Eliud takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and to access fertilizers and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Eliud had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Eliud was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Eliud and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Eliud will educate his children and build a house.

In 2012, the members of Bienjelesia group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Eliud is pictured with his group members in the photograph above. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more maize cereal for sale.

loans.name: Maris

texts.en:
Maris is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Maris has a shop where she sells timber & lumber in different sizes. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of timber to sell.

Maris has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maris hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy timber to sell

loans.name: Gradi Plus Group

texts.en:
“Gradi Plus” is a Community Bank made up of 14 micro entrepreneurs whose chairman is Faustin. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE DRC. 

Faustin started his business in 1998 selling miscellaneous items. Today, he operates a general boutique. He is 49 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 8 and 17. Three of them go to school.  His boutique has been strengthened thanks to the four different loans he has already received from MFI HOPE DRC, which he repaid properly. With a profit of about $45 earned per week, he plans with the next loan, to increase the inventory of his goods by purchasing items such as some soaps, sacks of sugar, cans, purified water, etc. for reselling at a profit in order to meet his customer’s needs and make additional profits. Currently, Faustin is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups. He is determined to develop his business through the different loans he will be receiving from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC. He sells in the mid-eastern part of Kinshasa.

loans.use: to purchase items such as soap, sacks of sugar, cans, purified water, etc to sell

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 25 years old and married with one child who is in school. She has had a business selling food at a food stall in Yei, South Sudan for three years.

Charity requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a motorcycle in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy dry maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Jovy

texts.en:
Jovy is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Jovy has a shop where she sells beverages, noodles & detergents. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy beverages, noodles & detergents.

Jovy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jovy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, noodles & detergents

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband, she brings up a 16-year-old daughter who studies at school. In order to earn money to live, the family cultivates agricultural products and breeds livestock. By selling some part of the harvest and reselling livestock after fattening, the family earns money to meet their daily needs. With money received from the loan, Gulmira wants to purchase livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling. In the future with the profits gained from reselling livestock, she plans to start repairing their house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Spora

texts.en:
Spora has operated her potato sales business in Nakuru town for the last 10 years.  She is 49 years old and widowed with four school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officer during marketing and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of potatoes to sell in her business.

In the future, Spora hopes to expand her potato business and become one of the leading potato suppliers in Nakuru.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes to sell

loans.name: Rakhim

texts.ru: Рахиму 46  лет, женат и имеет троих детей.  Рахим закончил Зафарабадский строительный техникум (Республика Таджикстан) в 1988 году по специальности бухгалтерский учет и анализ сельского хозяйства  и работал до 2003 года в местной администрации. После ухода с работы, в поисках пути  обеспечения достойного будущего для детей, Рахим решил заняться животноводством и садоводством.  На 14,000 сом (KGS) он купил одну корову, что послужило началом его собственного бизнеса. На сегодняшний день его хозяйство насчитывает три головы коров с телятами и приносит около 12,000 сом ежемесячно от продажи молочных продуктов. Также, в сезон, Рахим получает прибыль от продажи фруктов, выращенных в собственном саду. Доходы от его деятельности позволили Рахиму купить земельный участок для постройки дома для своей семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рахим обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного поголовья скота. Планируемую прибыль Рахим намерен вложить в расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Rakhim is 46 years old and married with three children. Rakhim graduated from the Zafarabad Civil Engineering Technicum (Tajikistan) in 1998 with a degree in accounting and agricultural analysis. He worked until 2003 in the local administration. After leaving work in search of opportunities to ensure a future for his children, Rakhim decided to become involved in animal husbandry and horticulture. For 14,000 Kyrgyzstani som, he bought one cow, which began his own business. Today his business consists of three cows with calves and brings in around 12,000 som every month from the sale of dairy products. Also, when in season, Rakhim earns income from the sale of fruit grown in his personal garden. The income from his work has allowed Rakhim to buy a plot of land in order to build a home for his family. In order to further the growth of his business, Rakhim approached Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som to buy additional livestock. Rakhim plans to use the projected income to invest in expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Kalima

texts.ru:
Калиме 53 года, замужем, имеет два сына, один из которых школьник. На протяжении 20 лет Калима занимается  животноводством – разведением и откормом скота, ежегодно обрабатывает 1,5 га земли с кукурузой,  занимается этим бизнесом вместе с любимым мужем (на фото), который является ее опорой и поддержкой в любых начинаниях. На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Калимы  имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец , имеются все необходимые условия для содержания скота. Также дополнительным источником дохода для семьи является торговля  продуктами питания.
В целях увеличения поголовья скота, Калима обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец. Доходы от кредита семья планирует вложить в покупку участка земли под строительство еще одного сарая для содержания скота.
texts.en:
Kalima is 53 years old, she is married and has two sons one of whom is going to school. During the last 20 years Kalima has been doing animal husbandry – breeding and feeding cattle. Each year she plows 1.5 hectares of land with corn and has been in this business with her beloved husband (on the photo) who is her support in any undertakings. At this time Kalima has two cows and ten sheep in her household and she has all the necessary conditions for keeping the cattle. Also as an additional source of income for the family they sell food products.

With the purpose of increasing the headcount of cattle Kalima has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS to buy calves and sheep. The family plans to use the profit from the loan to buy a parcel of land to build one more shed for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Ushindi B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ushindi B Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne is the facilitator of the Ushindi B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Everlyne takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest four bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Everlyne will invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Ushindi B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The photograph shows six people: three women and three men.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 35 years old and married with two children, ages 6 years and 12 years. He runs a retail shop in Lumley in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. His children are currently attending school. He also takes care of three relatives.

Ibrahim has been in this business for eight years and sells milk, cocoa, bags of rice, soap, batteries and padlocks at his shop. He also earns income from renting out a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is price fluctuation.

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more bags of rice. Ibrahim says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his children. In the future, he would like to import goods from abroad.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Licel

texts.en: Licel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Licel has a shop that sells fruits like mangoes, apples, and pineapples. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fruits to sell. Licel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Licel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Nalondo S. H. G. Group

texts.en:
Peter takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peter was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on one acre of land. With income from maize sales, Peter will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Peter is the facilitator of Nalondo S.H.G. group. Peter and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Nalondo S.H.G. group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kelementina

texts.en: Kelementina is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. All of her children are in school. She has had a business selling food items in Yei, South Sudan for the past 4 years. Kelementina requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions for sale.

loans.name: Yibonelakho A Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Yibonelakho A SHG Group in Western Kenya! George is the facilitator of the Yibonelakho A SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

George is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, George had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, he was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, George will pay for major expenses throughout the year, such as his children's school fees.

In 2012, the members of Yibonelakho A SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 30-year-old married woman with two children. Both her children are in school. She has had a business selling clothes in Yei, South Sudan for the past 5 years. Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Baraka B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Baraka B Group in Western Kenya! Peter is the facilitator of Baraka B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peter takes care of five children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peter was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Peter will pay for major expenses, such as school fees and livestock purchase.
 
In 2012, the members of Baraka B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ziyaddin

texts.ru:
Ziyaddin imeyet drujelubnuyu semyu on jenat i imeyet odnogo rebonka. Ziyaddin yavlyayetsa IDP personom on pereselenec iz Lachin, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Yemu 31 qoda. Uje 3 qoda on rabotayet masterom i delayet derevanniye okna i dveri. Etobu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy imel svoyu masterskuyu. On trudolubiviy i userdvno rabotayet chtobi uludshit svoi semeyniye doxodi. 
Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye i bole usovershenstvovanniye instrumenti dlya uluchsheniya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Ziyadin has a [nice] family. He is married and has one child. Ziyaddin is an Internally Displaced Person from Lachin now living in the Absheron Region together with his beloved family. He is 31 years old. For the last three years he has been manufacturing wooden windows and doors. He learned this business from his father, who used to have his own shop. Ziyaddin is a hard-working person and works with dedication in order to improve his family’s income. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy better-quality work tools needed for enhancing his business.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more spices to increase her inventory.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Naluwa S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Naluwa S.H.G in Western Kenya! Fred is the facilitator of Naluwa S.H.G. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fred takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Fred had a good maize yield harvesting nine bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Fred was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Fred will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Naluwa S.H.G will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 33 years old and married with three children, ages seven to 13.  She runs a local food store in Goderich, in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone.  Her 3 children attend school.  She also has five additional dependent that live with her because they are relatives. 

Kadiatu has operated a food store business for 17 years and sells palm oil, native rice, onions and other items.  She began this business because she wanted to generate enough income to support her family.  Kadiatu says her main challenge is a lack of funds to invest in her business.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more local food, such as palm oil, tomatoes and salt. 

Kadiatu says the extra income will help her educate her children and improve their home welfare.  In the future, she would like to open more stores in town.  She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local food stuff such as palm oil, tomatoes and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy fish for resale.

loans.name: Canaan Youth Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Canaan Youth Group in Western Kenya! With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Kevin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Kevin is the facilitator of the Canaan Youth group. Kevin is pictured alongside his group members  in the photograph. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Canaan Youth group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Kevin takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Kevin had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Kevin was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Kevin will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

loans.use: to source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Went Plus Group

texts.en:
“Went Plus” is a community bank made up of 16 micro-entrepreneurs.  Its chairwoman is Josée.  These members are united with the same goal; to grow their businesses.
 
Josée sells fresh food in the north eastern and most populated areas of Kinshasa.  She began her business in 2009.  Hard work and good management has helped her succeed at making a profit.

She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has already received three loans and repaid them properly.  

With this loan, Josée will buy three boxes of fresh food to resell.  The business gives her a profit of $60 every week. 

Josée is 43 years old, married and the mother of three children who ages vary between three and 12 years old.  Two attend school.  Her ambition is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase three boxes of fresh food to resell.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Venera's Group

texts.en:
Venera is the leader of this group.  She is 26 and married to a farmer.  Together they raise three children who attend school. 

The family is engaged in cultivating agricultural products and livestock breeding.  They started to breed livestock eight years ago with an initial investment of 10000 Soms.  

In order to cover the family expenses, the couple resells livestock after fattening and also sells part of their harvest.  With money received from the loan, Venera wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and reselling.  

In the future she wishes to save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Gulana

texts.ru:
Gulana 22 qoda. Ona molodaya ne zamujnaya i ne imeyet detey. Gulana yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Kalbadjar, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey mamoy. Gulana okonchila komputerniye kursi, posle chego uje qod kak ona nachala sama uchit, detey shkolnogo vozrasta, kompyuteru.
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit yesho kompyutera chtobi ona smogla uchit bolshe detey i tem samim uvelichat svoy mesachniy doxod.
texts.en:
Gulana is twenty-two. She's young, single, and has no children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Kalbadjar and now lives with her mother in the Absheron region.  She completed computer studies program and a year later began teaching computer studies to school-aged kids.

Gulana currently needs 2000AZN to buy another computer so she can teach more children and increase her monthly income.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Mariam from Fullahtown. She is married with five children between the ages of two and 25.  Three children attend school. 

Mariam runs a provision shop and sells milk, sugar and Ovaltine.  Mariam has been in business for three years and her shop is her only source of income.  She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Mariam has requested a loan to buy more provisions to resell.  The extra income will allow her to improve her standard of living.  

In the future, she plans to open a mini supermarket.  She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more provision items such as milk, sugar, and Ovaltine.

loans.name: Charité Plus Group

texts.en:
Charité Plus is a group of 19 owners of small businesses chaired by Batinga.  Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva through MFI (Micro-Finance Institution) HOPE DRC.

Batinga’s main business is selling caterpillars in the mid eastern part of the capital city of Kinshasa. He became a micro entrepreneur in 2001.  

He had already received one loan from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid it. 

Batinga intends to use this loan to expand his inventory.  He will buy more caterpillars and miscellaneous items for resale and hopes to increase his profits.  He seeks to make more profit by selling more goods that his customers want to buy.  

Batinga is 32 years old, married and the father of four sons, ages three to 13.  Three attend school.

loans.use: to expand his inventory.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Marvel

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Marvel from Lumley, located in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Lone.  She is single and has no child.  Marve takes care of four relatives at home. 

Marvel runs a building material store in Lumley.  She sells tiles and pain and has been in business for nine years.  

Marvel has requested a loan of 5,000,000 Leones in order to purchase more tiles and paint.  Even though her customer base has grown, price fluctuations are her biggest challenge.  

The extra income from this loan will help her increase her savings.  In the future, she plans to import more building material from abroad.  Marvel appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more building material such as tiles and paint.

loans.name: Abakundakurima /kzh Group

texts.fr:
Félix fait partie du groupe Abakundakurima/Kzh. Il a 33 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 9 mois à 12 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Félix est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz. Dans les prochaines années,Félix voudrait être le fournisseur de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits,Félix prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Felix is part of the Abakundakurima / Kzh group. He is 33 years old and is married with four children ranging from 9 months to 12 years old, and of whom one attends school. His own education level is 6 years of primary school.

Felix is a rice farmer. It is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his credit to buy fertilizer for his rice-farming activity.

His strategy for growing his business is to use selected rice seedlings.

In coming years, Felix wants to become the supplier of rice for the region. With the profits, Felix plans to educate and care for his children.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his rice-farming activity.

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira is the leader of this group. She is 24 years old and married to a commercial agent. Together with her husband, she brings up two children who are both under the age of seven.  Elmira’s mother helps her take care of the children. 

In order to earn money, Elmira works as an operator in a mobile company. A year ago she saved 10,000 KGS from her salary and purchased livestock. Since that time she has been breeding, fattening and selling livestock to earn additional income to meet the family's needs. With the money she receives from this loan, she wants to purchase more livestock to breed, fatten and sell. In the future Elmira plans to save enough money to purchase an apartment. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Sengeli A Group

texts.en:
Alfred takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund because of One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Alfred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 11 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Alfred was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on a ½ acre of land. With income from maize sales, Alfred will educate his children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

Alfred is the facilitator of Sengeli group. Alfred and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Sengeli group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Alfred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Mwamko Mateka Group

texts.en:
Vermunda is a Tanzanian woman with five children. Four of them are attending secondary school. She engaged in agricultural activities one year ago. She is cultivating maize, beans and sugar cane. Also, she is dealing with business activities, especially buying and selling clothes. Vermunda faces many problems in her agricultural activities. This include high prices of fertilizers, insecticides, hoes and gumboots. In addition to agricultural inputs expenses, there is a lack of a market for her crops.

Vermunda believes that once she gets financial support, she will be able to buy fertilizers,insecticides,hoes and gumboots.
Vermunda dreams of having a good house, keeping cows and goats, and increasing her agricultural activities from the two acres she has at the moment to six acres in the next five years.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, insecticides, hoes and gumboots

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Mary from Grassfield, in the eastern part of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with one child, age seven, who is currently attending school.

Mary has been running her business for seven years now, selling crates of drinks, bottled water, and milk. She also receives income occasionally from her husband and relatives who live abroad. She says that her business is doing well. She is now requesting this loan in order to buy more crates of drinks, bottled water, sugar and milk.

Mary has plans for expansion in the next five to ten years. Her main goal is to see her business develop greatly. She says this loan will enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of drinks, bottled water, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Imara B Group

texts.en:
Epuret is the facilitator of the Imara B group. Epuret and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Epuret takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access to fertilizer and hybrid seed. In the recent 2011 season, Epuret had an excellent maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Epuret was only able to harvest two bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Epuret and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Epuret will educate her children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Imara B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Epuret and her group appear in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vamig

texts.ru: Etot molodoy chelovek jivet v Absheron regione. On jenat, u nego yest odin rebonok. Vamig 28 let. Pochti 5 let tomu nazad on nachal rabotat shoferom v chastnoy firme, no potom on uje 2 qoda kak stal taxistom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca kotoriy v svayo  vremya rabotal chastnim shoferom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya togo chtobi pochinit taxi tak kak on ne mojet rabotat poka ona isporchena. Vamig prismatrivayet i za svoyey mamoy kotoraya uje pojelaya i polzuyetsya mnogimi lekarstvami i poetomu yemu nujno poskoreye pochinit yeyo.
texts.en: This young man lives in the Absheron region.  He is married and has one child.  Vamig is 28 years old.  He started working as a driver for a private firm almost five years ago, but then became a taxi driver and has been working as a taxi driver for two years.  He learned this business from his father, who worked as a private driver in his time.  Currently, Vamig needs 2000 AZN to purchase spare parts and repair his taxi because he cannot work while it is not fixed.  Vamig looks after his mother, who is elderly and uses a lot of medicines, so he needs to repair his car quickly to continue supporting her.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and repair his car

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush, lives in the city of Vanadzor with her retired mother.  She is educated in the field of economics. 

For many years, she has imported and sold clothes and crockery from Yerevan and neighboring countries.  Her shop is located in Vanadzor.  Siranush’s niece helps her with the business.

With her previous Kiva loans, Siranush was able to increase her shop’s assortment of items, sales and profits.  Siranush has never delayed her repayments.

Siranush is now seeking a loan of 1,000,000 AMD from Kiva lenders to buy a variety of winter outerwear to resell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of winter outerwear to resell.

loans.name: Salawata Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Salawata SHG Group in Western Kenya! George is the facilitator of the Salawata SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

George takes care of six children at home with his wife. He joined One Acre Fund in order grow enough to feed his family and have additional maize profits to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, George had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, George was only able to harvest five bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to George and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, George will pay for major expenses such as school fees and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Salawata SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds and milk cans for his dairy.

loans.name: Guguli

texts.en:
Guguli is 60 years old, married and lives with her husband, Jemal in the village of Bobokvati, Georgia.  Guguli and Jemali are retired and their pensions and agriculture are their main sources of income.  

They have a milk cow and citrus garden on a 0.3 hectare piece of family owned land.  They sell dairy products and citrus at the local market.  Their average monthly income is 500 Laris. 

Guguli will use the loan to pay expenses related to harvesting a citrus crop (purchase boxes for storing harvested products, paying the workforce).  Also, part of the loan will purchase hay used to feed their milk cow during winter months.

loans.use: to purchase hay for milk cow and citrus harvest expenses.

loans.name: Sengetiti Facal Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Sengetiti Facal Group in Western Kenya! Carol is the facilitator of the Sengetiti Facal group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Carol takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Carol had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Carol was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Carol and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance

With income from his maize sales, Carol will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Sengetiti Facal group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The person standing on the far left in the photograph is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is an industrious and responsible mother who helps her husband in managing their rice farming business. She is 56 and has four adult children. They endure the hardships of life and pursue the business to support their family and finance the education of their children. Being a farmer is difficult for it takes a long time before harvest, but being resourceful parents they can find an alternative source of income and satisfy their needs. They aimed to expand their plantation to increase their yields but had inadequate capital, so Rosalina is asking for a loan of P32,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her business. She is hoping that this loan will help them to make an improvement to their income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for rice farming business

loans.name: Turatbek

texts.ru:
Туратбеку 43 года, женат  и имеет троих детей,  двое из которых школьники.  В поисках источника финансирования для своих детей, Туратбек начал бизнес  в животноводстве - откорме и перепродаже скота. Стартовав с начальной суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS), Туратбек сумел развить хозяйство, насчитывающее  4  коровы, 20 баранов и 1 лошадь с ежемесячной прибылью в сумме 12,500 сом (KGS).  Откормленный скот  Туратбек продает в живом виде на скотном рынке.  Также, в наделе имеется земля, где Туратбек сеет зерновые культуры и эспарцет, урожай продает постоянным оптовым покупателям. 
Для дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Туратбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупа дополнительного поголовья скота для откорма. Планируемую прибыль Туратбек намерен использовать для заготовки кормов  и сена на зиму, чтобы весной продать откормленный скот по хорошей цене.
texts.en: Turatbek is 43 years old, married and has three children, two of whom attend school.  In search of a financial support for his children, Turatbek started his animal husbandry (fattening up and reselling livestock) business.  Having started with an initial sum of 10,000 som (KGS), Turatbek was able to develop his business, which now has 4 cows, 20 sheep and 1 horse and a monthly profit of 12,500 som (KGS).  Turatbek sells fattened-up livestock at a livestock market.  His property also includes land, where he sows cereal crops and sainfoin.  He sells the harvest to his regular wholesale buyers.  In order to further increase his livestock headcount, Turatbek requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy additional livestock for fattening up.  He plans to use the expected profit to stock up on fodder and hay for the winter in order to sell fattened up livestock at good prices in the spring.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph has operated his butcher's shop in Nakuru town for the last six years.  He is 38 years old, married to Margaret and they have four school-going children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officer during marketing in Nakuru town and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more goats to slaughter and sell to boost and sustain his butcher business. In future, Joseph hopes to expand his butchery business and open shops in other parts of Nakuru town.

loans.use: To buy  goats to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia has been in the cereals and potato business in Nakuru town for the last 20 years.  She is 63 years of age, widowed and has three children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of potatoes and cereals to sell. In future, Cecilia hopes to supply cereals and potatoes in all parts of Nakuru and get more income, thereby improving her family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more cereals and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Mabadiliko Group

texts.en:
Rexnald is the facilitator of the Mabadiliko group. Rexnald and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Rexnald takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to grow enough to feed his family and to have additional maize profit to educate his children. In the recent 2011 season, Rexnald had an excellent maize yield harvesting eight bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Rexnald was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rexnald and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Rexnald will pay school fees for his children, loans and bills.

In 2012, the members of Mabadiliko group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Rexnald and his group members are shown in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Muriel

texts.en:
Muriel is 32 years old and married with two children, ages 3 and 6. She runs a boutique in Aberdeen in the western part of Freetown, Sierra Leone.

She’s been in this business for 15 years, selling items such as baby clothes, baby powder, bags, cosmetics, shoes and clothes in her store. Muriel also earns income from running an internet cafe and photocopying machine. She says that the main challenge to her business is the high tax rates in Sierra Leone.

Muriel requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy items for her boutique. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and improve her business. In the future, Muriel would like to operate an international business. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as baby clothes, baby powder, bags and cosmetics.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam has operated her tailoring shop in Nakuru town for the last 19 years. She is 38 years old, married to Jonathan and they have seven school-going children. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officer during marketing in Nakuru and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more stock of textile materials for her tailoring shop. In future, Miriam hopes to expand her tailoring business to wholesale and become one of the leading textile suppliers in other parts of the country.

loans.use: Add more stock of textiles

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth has been in the cereals and potato business in Nakuru town for the last 13 years.  She is 44 years old, married to John and they have three school-going children. She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officer  during awareness in Nakuru and this will be her first loan. She  plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cereals and potatoes to sell in her business. In future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her business and supply potatoes and cereals to other parts of Nakuru.

loans.use: To buy more cereals and potatoes to sell

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is married and blessed with four children. She is 42 years old. To improve her family living, she plants and harvests rice to sell. She is experienced in this field since she had started when she got married. She earned P45,000 with her last crop.

At this time, she is requesting a loan PHP25,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her business. She hopes to harvest more rice, which will enables her to generate higher income to the betterment of her family and improvement of her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase the inventory of his goods by buying the store's items such us some soaps, cans, toilet papers, sugar, miscellaneous in bulk for resale at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest has been in the business of clothing sales in Nakuru town for the last five years.  He is 49 years old, married to Jane, and they have two school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officer during marketing in Nakuru and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of new clothes for sell in his business.

In the future, Ernest hopes to expand his clothing business and become one of the leading clothing dealers in Nakuru.

loans.use: To add more clothing stock for sale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 28 years old and married with two children who are both in school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a shop for her business extension in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47, married, and has three adult children. Her husband is a farmer and they live happily in a village. They own and manage 2 hectares of rice fields and usually have two cropping seasons. Despite the hardships in farming, they are striving hard to earn and support the needs of their family. They plan to increase their yields so that they will increase their income and support the education of their children. 

Due to financial constraints, Elizabeth is asking for a loan of 28,000 Philippine pesos to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the rice farming business. They mention that this loan will help them to work out their plan and they hope that they will increase their yields this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for her rice farming business.

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn has been engaged in her rice farm business for fifteen years and she usually earns P45,000 per crop year. She is willing to work hard every single day to lift her family out of poverty.

Erlyn is married to a farmer who helps her manage their farm. According to her, through the income generated from her business, she had been able to give daily allowances to her children who are currently in school.

At this time, she is requesting a loan of P20,000 to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to sustain her rice production

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 25 years old and married with no children. She has had a business selling cassava flour in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase cassava flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a store for her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase cassava flour to sell

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena has operated her retail shop in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 12 years. She is 26 years old, married to Samuel and they have three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy maize flour, bathing soap, and tea leaves to sell in her retail shop.

In the future, Philomena hopes to expand her retail shop to wholesale and become one of the leading businesswomen in the area.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, bathing soap, and tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 26 years old and married with two children between the ages of 2 and 3 years old. Jacqueline sells tableware and has two years of experience in this business.

Jacqueline has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more tableware (dishes, plates, spoons, cups, etc) to sell. With any profits, Jacqueline will be able to save for her future and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more tableware (dishes, plates, spoons, cups etc) to sell

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Dede est une femme âgée de  43 ans. Elle est mariée å un maçon carreleur. Elle a un enfant.
Dede  travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2002. Elle  vend du jus, du yaourt et divers produits à domicile aux étudiants de son quartier qui en prennent a la sortie des cours et aux voisins. Elle  achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille avec un  membre de la famille. 
Dede a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter du lait, du sucre et de l’eau en sachets (pure water).  
Dans les prochaines années, Dede voudrait acheter un nouveau réfrigérateur pour augmenter sa production de jus et de yaourts.
texts.en:
Dede is a 43-year old woman, who is married to a mason and tiler, and has one child. She has worked as a retailer since 2002 and sells juice, yoghurt and various other products at home to students in her neighborhood, who come and take them after their lessons, and to neighbors. She buys the products at Lomé's Grand Market. She works with another member of the family.

Dede has requested her first loan from WAGES so that she can buy milk, sugar and water in sachets (pure water). In the coming years, she would like to buy a new fridge in order to increase her quantities of juice and yoghurts.

loans.use: to buy sacks of milk and sugar and mineral water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a resident of the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. She is 33 years old and has been farming for 10 years. She is married with two children aged 12 and 8 and both are in school. Her farm produces potatoes and cabbage and both are sold to the local market.

Caroline has made a request for a loan of 40,000 KES through Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase water pipes for extending her irrigation system and fertilizer to boost her farming output. She says farm inputs have become expensive but hopes the purchase with the loan will help boost her farming income and enable her to educate her children.

She reiterates that her biggest challenges are the high costs of inputs and rampant animal diseases.

loans.use: to purchase water pipes and fertilizer

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson has operated his wholesale business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years. He is 47 years old, married to Dorcas, and they have two school going children.

He was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be his seventh loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more household goods to sell in his shop.

In the future, Wilson hopes to expand his business, get more income, and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy more household goods to sell in his shop

loans.name: Bahadur

texts.ru:
Bahadur 51 god. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Lachin regiona , seychas projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so sovyey lubimoy i ochen drujelubnoy semyoy. Bahadur jenat i imeyet 4 detey. 

Eto uje tretaya ssuda Bahadura perviye 2 ssudi on oplatil udachno i bez zaderjok. On ochen blagodaren Lenderam i Kive za ssudi kotoriye bili predostavleni yemu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti dlya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Bahadur is 51 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person from the Lachin Region, now living in the Baku Region together with his beloved and close-knit family. Bahadur is married and has four children. This is Bahadur’s second loan; the first two loans were repaid successfully, without delays. He is very grateful to lenders and to Kiva for the loans he had obtained. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy the necessary work tools for his business.

loans.use: to buy necessary work tools

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 25 years old and is single. He sells shoes in his business and has three years experience in this business. Emmanuel employs one person to help him.
