Emmanuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes to sell. With any profits from the loan, Emmanuel would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and start saving for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell.

loans.name: Posseh

texts.en:
Meet 55-years-old Posseh from Grassfield, in the eastern part of Freetown. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 21 and 35. In 2001, Posseh established her building materials store. She began her business because she needed a permanent source of income. She also earns income renting out a house and receives income from her children who work in different organizations. She says that the main challenge to her business is that some customers do not pay her the full amount for their purchases.

Posseh requires a loan in order to buy more building materials such as paint, pipes, plumbing tools and paintbrushes. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to extend her business to some family members and help improve her family's welfare. In the future, Posseh plans to extend her business to the provinces. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as paints, pipes, plumbing tools and paintbrushes.

loans.name: Emefa

texts.fr:
Emefa est une femme  âgée de 26 ans. Elle est mariée å un déclarant en douane. Elle n’a pas d’enfants.
Emefa travaille comme coiffeuse depuis 2010. Elle vend également des mèches et des défrisants dans son salon de coiffure  situé dans un quartier de la place. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule dans son salon. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pas avoir d’employées pour satisfaire au mieux ses clientes quand elle est débordée.
Emefa  a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des mèches et des défrisants. Elle veut réaménager son salon avec les profits obtenus.
texts.en:
Emefa is a 26-year-old woman who is married to a customs officer. They have no children. Emefa has been working as a hairdresser since 2010. She also sells hair extensions and relaxers at her hair salon in a local district. She buys her products in Lomé and she works alone. Currently, her main challenge is to work without any employees to help her meet the needs of her customers when demand is high.

Emefa is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy hair extensions and relaxers. She will use her profits to revamp her salon.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and relaxers

loans.name: Enock

texts.en:
Enock is 59 years old and is married with six children between the ages 3 and 19 years old. He has one year of experience in this business and employs three people to help him.

Enock has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more hens for resale. With any profits from the loan, Enock would like to build a house for his business, and he will also be able to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase more hens to sell.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is from the village Supsa, Guria Region, West Georgia. She is 37 years old, married, and lives with her family: husband Avtandil, their 20 year old daughter, and parents in law. Avtandil is musician. He works in a local restaurant. All other family members are involved in the family agricultural business. 

They own a tangerine garden on their family owned plot with total area of 0.15 hectare. They sell harvested tangerines at the local market. Also the family has 4 milk cows and 4 pigs. Khatuna produces dairy products and sells them at the local market as well. Also the family sells piglets locally. Along with the abovementioned they sell nuts, harvested from family owned 400 nut trees. Total average monthly income of the family, including the pensions of Khatuna’s parents in law, is 800 Laris. 

Khatuna requested credit for the development of their family business. In particular, she will use the credit for enclosing the nut garden and renovation of the pig-house. Enclosing of the nut trees is very important, in order to protect the harvest from stealing. The pig house needs renovation in order to create needed conditions for domestic animals for the winter months. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for financing harvesting of maize. All above listed activities will strengthen the business of the family and contribute to increasing their profitability. It will be positively reflected on family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for enclosing the nut garden, pig-house renovation, and harvesting of maize

loans.name: Marie Grace

texts.en:
Marie Grace is 31 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. She owns a store selling items like cosmetics, cooking oil, water, juice, milk, etc. Marie Grace has been in this business for two years and has one employee helping her.

Marie Grace has requested a loan in order to increase her store's inventory of body lotion, cooking oil, juice, water, etc. With the profits, Marie Grace will build her own house and to pay her child's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase various goods for resale such as body lotion, cooking oil, bottles of water, biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dozens of dishes and plastic bowls to sell

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Salamatu from Calabatown, Eastern Area, Freetown. She is married with one child. She has four additional dependents that live with her because they are relatives. They also assist her with her business.   

Salamatu runs a cosmetic and pharmacy store.  She sells malaria drugs, cough syrup, anti-fungal cream, baby oil, and body cream.   She also receives income from her husband, who is also doing business. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Salamatu has requested a loan in order to buy more malarial drugs, cough syrups, anti-fungal creams, baby oils, and body creams.   The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her standard of living.  In the future, she plans to increase her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more malaria drugs, cough syrup, anti-fungal cream and baby oil.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old and married with four children between the ages of 5 and 14. She sells clothes and has one year of experience in this business.

Beatrice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more clothes to sell. With any profits, Beatrice will be able to save money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy dishes, plastic bowls, spoons, shoes, etc. in bulk to add to her business

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha is 32 years old and married with three children between the ages of 3 and 10. Agatha sells maize, beans, and sorghum, and she has five years of experience in this business.

Agatha has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more maize, beans, and sorghum to sell. She will use any additional profits she earns to reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Fast Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Fast” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Adama is the leader of this group. Adama is 35 years old and married with two children who are attending primary school. Adama sells clothes and shoes and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Adama will invest in her business by buying a large quantity of clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is a teacher. She lives in Sevkar village in the Ijevan area with her husband and her two daughters. One of her daughters is a student and the other is a schoolgirl.

For several years Anahit worked at school as a teacher, but because of marriage and her children's birth, she quit her job.

In 2003 Anahit opened a cosmetics business which she runs in Ijevan city. At her shop she sells articles of personal hygiene, creams, hair dye and perfumes. This occupation allows her to cover part of her family's needs and pay for her elder daughter's education. 

Anahit needs a 350,000 AMD loan to diversify her assortment of cosmetics and perfumes.

Anahit’s previous Kiva loan also helped her to develop her business by buying various cosmetic items for her shop.

loans.use: to buy articles of personal hygiene and perfumes to resell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 32 years old and married with four children between one and nine years old. He owns a transportation business that is in its tenth successful year of operation.

Emmanuel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase spare parts (such as tires) for his business. Emmanuel hopes to earn more profits, which will enable him to save for his future and to pay his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Lisbon Group

texts.en:
Masudi, who is in his late 20s, is married.  He has been running a charcoal business for one and a half years now. He works from 7 a.m to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be his 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase the charcoal business and for household expenses and has repaid all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and to take care of his wife. His dream is to one day be able to buy clothes and take them to Kenya.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Lisbon", which has a total of 19 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and to take care of his wife

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a farmer in Nkubu, Central Kenya, and works as a mason besides farming. He has been in farming for 10 years producing and selling cabbages, carrots, potatoes and milk, which all go to the local market. He is married with 2 children aged 8 and 4, with the firstborn already in school.

Fredrick has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank for his farming business. He says they experience climatic changes which limits their farming output and he hopes the purchase of a water tank will improve his output. He intends to use the income to educate his children.

He reiterates the inadequacy of rains is the major challenge to him.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 31 years old and married with two children between the ages of 3 and 10. Beatrice sells Irish potatoes, and she has ten years of experience.

Beatrice has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more Irish potatoes to sell. With any profits, she would like to start saving for her future and to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cigarettes, batteries, soft drinks, etc. in large quantity to add to his business

loans.name: Mzevinar

texts.en:
Mzevinar is from the village of Alambari, West Georgia. She is 51 years old, married and lives in the village with her family: husband Amiran and two children, a 25-year-old daughter and a 15-year-old son. Mzevinar’s son goes to school. Her daughter and Amiran work on the family farm. In particular, the family owns 600 nut trees and 20 citrus trees. Harvested nuts and citrus fruits are sold locally. Mzevinar trades their greengrocery products on the local market. She purchases fruits and vegetables in nearby villages, as well as locally from the wholesalers, and sells them on the open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,000 Laris.

Mzevinar requested credit for increasing her stock for trade. She will use it for purchasing a variety of fruits and vegetables and resell them on the open market. Her sales will increase and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale on open market

loans.name: Imbaturabukungu/kmg Group

texts.fr:
Manassé fait partie du groupe Imbaturabukungu/Kmg. Il a 53 ans et il est marié avec 9 enfants de 11 mois à 32 ans, dont 5 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6  ans de primaire.

Manassé est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est de faire la semence sélectionnée du riz.  Dans les prochaines années, Manassé voudrait agrandir la surface de culture du riz. Avec les profits, Manassé prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Manassé is part of the Imbaturabukungu/Kmg group. He is 53, married, and has 9 children between the ages of 11 months and 32 years, 5 of whom go to school. His education level is 6 years of primary school.
Manassé is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use this loan to buy fertilizers for his rice farming.
His strategy for the growth of his business is to use pedigreed rice seeds. In the coming years, Manassé would like to enlarge the area of rice cultivation. With the profits, Manassé intends to send his children to school and take care of them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming

loans.name: Papias

texts.en:
Papias is 33 years old and married with five children between the ages of 1 and 10. Papias operates a boutique. He has five years of experience in this business, and he employs one person to help him.

Papias has requested a loan from Kiva in order to purchase more products such as body lotion, cooking oil, books, and juice to sell. He will use any additional profits to reinvest in his business and to buy a car to help him.

loans.use: to purchase more products such as cooking oil, body lotion, books, and juice to sell.

loans.name: Tatasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Tatasuthekeh” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone.  They are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 SLL  for each (totaling 4,000,000 SLL) to enable them to further improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured in the right is Sallay, who is the leader of this group. Sallay was born in a small town called Mile-Ninety-One. She is married to a trader.  The couple has five children – three in primary school and two in secondary school.

Sallay sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been doing business for 20 years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying a larger quantity of clothes to add to her current supply.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of clothes to add to her current supply.

loans.name: Zacheaus

texts.en:
Zacheaus is a resident of Nkubu and has been in farming for 10 years.  He sells his produce -- milk, cabbage, carrots and potatoes --  to middlemen in the local market. He is married with four adult children and one minor who is still in school.  Zacheaus operates a retail shop in the local market for additional income.

Zacheaus has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water tank for his farming business. He says the tank will ensure good storage for use by his dairy cows during dry seasons and will help maintain his milk production as well as other farming outputs. He adds that he plans to construct a greenhouse and that the tank will also ensure its water supply.  He hopes his family living standards will be improved.

Zacheaus laments of pests and other crop and animal diseases that limit a farmer's output.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank

loans.name: Try Us Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the “Try Us” group from Magburaka. They are small-business people who are based in Magburaka, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 500,000 SLL for each person to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Sulaiman. Sulaiman is age 51 and was born in Magburaka. He is married to a businesswoman and is the father of nine children, six of whom are in primary and secondary schools.  

Sulaiman sells a variety of items, including biscuits, batteries, mints, soaps, etc. He has been a businessman for 12 years now. He will use his share of the loan to buy the above-mentioned items in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, batteries, mints, soaps, etc. in large quantities to add to his business.

loans.name: Patassoue

texts.fr:
Patassoue est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée à un revendeur et a 2 enfants.  
Patassoue travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1995. Elle achète et revend du maïs, du haricot, des farines et pates de manioc, et des fruits à toutes personnes au marché de HANOUKOPE à Lomé. Elle s’approvisionne dans les localités environnantes de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. 
Patassoue a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des céréales et des fruits destinés à la vente. Elle pense renforcer son activité avec ses profits supplémentaires.  
Dans les prochaines années, Patassoue voudrait agrandir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Patassoue is a 42-year-old woman.  She is married to a retailer and has two children.

Patassoue has been working as a retailer since 1995.  She buys and sells corn, beans, cassava flour and pasta, and fruit to the general public in the Hanoukope market in Lomé.  She stocks up in the towns around Lomé and works alone.

Patassoue has requested her first loan from WAGES to buy cereals and fruit to sell.  She plans to strengthen her business with her extra profits.

Over the coming years, Patassoue would like to expand her business.  She says that she plans to use the profits to contribute towards meeting her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy cereals and fruit

loans.name: Hillary

texts.en:
Hillary is a farmer and a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya. He is married with no children and has been in farming for seven years. He produces and sells milk and onions for the local market.

Hillary has made a second loan request of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says Juhudi loans have changed the livelihood of farmers and he hopes his life and that of his family will continue to improve with the acquisition of an additional dairy cow for his business.

He says the high cost of feed and animal diseases are the major challenges in his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tawopaneh Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the “Tawopaneh II” group from Magburaka. They are small-business people who are based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 700,000.00 SLL for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Osman. Osman is age 30 and was born in a small town called Mile-Ninety-One. He is married to a businesswoman and they have two children – one is in primary school and the other is not of school age.  

Osman sells fish. He has been running this business for 10 years now. He will use his share of this loan to buy several baskets of fish for sale.

loans.use: to buy several baskets of fish for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia  tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia sigue con se negocio de restaurant pero tambien por las noches esta vendiendo salchipapas que es un plato a a base de papas y salchichas fritas,la socia tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de chompas de lana,ella vende en forma independiente,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de salchipapas y restaurant y tambien ampliar el negocio de venta de chompas de lana. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar salchichas y papas y tambien para comprar chompas de lana al por mayor.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is 54, married, and has one child. She is still running her restaurant, but she is also selling salchipapas (a potato-based dish with fried sausages) at night. She also sells wool sweaters independently. She works from 7:00 am to 8:00 pm, and through all these businesses she is getting her children ahead. She wants to expand all three of her businesses. She is requesting this loan to purchase sausages and potatoes, and also to buy wool sweaters wholesale.

She is happy to have this loan and promises to complete all of her payments.

loans.use: to purchase sausages and potatoes, and also to buy sweaters wholesale.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Adjowa est une femme âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée à un employé de la LONATO et a 03enfants. 
Adjowa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1994.  Elle vend des bois de chauffage et du teck à toutes personnes dans un quartier à Lomé.  Elle achète les bois dans quelques localités nord du pays telles que Anié.  Elle travaille avec une personne. 
Adjowa a requis son deuxième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des bois de chauffage et du teck destiné à la vente. Elle veut agrandir son activité avec les profits supplémentaires. 
Dans les prochaines années, Adjowa voudrait avoir d’autres points de vente. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer à l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Adjowa is a 43-year-old woman. She is married to an employee of the LONATO  and has three children. Adjowa has been working as a retailer since 1994. She sells firewood and teak to anyone in her district in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She purchases the wood in a few towns, such as Anié, in the country's north. She works with one person. 

Adjowa has requested her second loan from WAGES in order to buy firewood and some teak to sell. She wants to expand her business by using the extra profit. In the next few years, she would like to have other sales outlets. 

With the profits, Adjovi says she plans to help with her children's eduction.

loans.use: to buy firewood and teak

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée à un enseignant et a 3 enfants.  
Afi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1996. Elle achète et revend des produits de mercerie genre boutons, doublures, fermetures et autres à toutes personnes à Lomé au quartier HANOUKOPE. Elle achète les produits au Ghana. 
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des articles de merceries destinés à la vente. Elle veut agrandir son activité avec ses profits supplémentaires.
Dans les prochaines années, Afi voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de vente à Lomé et à l’intérieur du pays. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit contribuer aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Afi is a 47-year-old woman. She is married to a teacher and has three children.
Afi has worked as a retailer since 1996. She buys and sells haberdashery items such as buttons linings, clasps, and other goods to all customers in the Hanoukope area of Lomé. She buys her products in Ghana.
Afi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy haberdashery articles for resale. She wants to enlarge her business with her supplementary profits.
In the coming years, Afi would like to open additional sales locations in Lomé and in the interior of the country. She says that with the profits, she intends to contribute to providing for the family.

loans.use: To buy haberdashery items.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.en:
Marie Therese is 30 years old and is married without children. She sells boutique (general store items such as body lotion, cooking oil, sugar, rice, cassava flour etc.). Her business is well organized. She work from 6AM until 7PM every day.

Marie Therese has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more cosmetics, cooking oil, sugar, rice, water and so on to sell. With profits from the loan, Marie Therese will reinvest in her business and to save for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics, cooking oil, sugar, rice etc. to sell.

loans.name: Washington

texts.es:
El socio; el socio tiene 63 años de edad, el socio es casado, y tiene 2 hijos; el socio sigue trabajando en su negocio de restaurant,el socio sigue trabajando junto con su esposa en el restaurant donde tambien estan preparando salhipapas (plato a base de salchichas y papas,el socio trabaja desde las 10:00 a.m hasta las 8:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de restaurant. El socio desea invertir el préstamo en comprasr productos para cocinar como papas,salchichas,carne,pollo y verduras.

El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Washington is 63, married, and has two children. He is still working in his restaurant with his wife, where they are also now serving salchipapas (a sausage-based dish with potatoes). He works from 10:00 am to 8:00 pm, and this is how he gets his children ahead. He wants to expand and improve his restaurant. He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of products for cooking, such as potatoes, sausages, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

Washington is grateful for your support and promises to repay her quotas on time.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of products for cooking, such as potatoes, sausages, meat, chicken, and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tejidos,ella tiene un taller de tejidos donde teje pantalones,chompas y chalinas para niños y bebes,ella distribuye a diferentes tiendas donde venden tejidos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como lana, hilos, cierres y botones para tejer las chompas y pantalones y también para el mantenimiento de las maquinas.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is 30 and lives with her partner and their 2 children.  She continues to work in her knitware business.  She has a workshop where she knits pants, sweaters, and scarves for children and babies.  She sells them to different stores that carry knitware.  The member works from 8 am to 7 pm and with this business she has been able to get her children ahead.  

She would like to expand her knitware sales business and she is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as wool, thread, zippers and buttons to knit sweaters and pants, and also to service her machines.

loans.use: to buy supplies like wool, thread, zippers and buttons to knit sweaters and pants and also to service her machines.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 47 years old, and is married with five children between the ages of 10 and 15 years old. Her business is well organized, she sell eggs. Agnes has ten years of experience in this business and works from 6AM until 8PM every day.

Agnes has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more large quantities of eggs. With profits from this loan, Agnes will become wholesale, and pay medical insurance for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio tiene 47 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de molinera,el muele granos de trigo,cebada y maiz y lo convierte en harinas y lo reparte en las diferente tiendas de abarrotes,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de molinera. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar maiz,trigo y cebada.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member is 47 years old and married with three children.  He continues working in his milling business.  He grinds wheat, barley, and corn grain, and converts it into flour to distribute in various grocery stores.  He works from 8 a.m. until 9 p.m.  By means of this job he gets his children ahead.

The member wants to expand his milling business.  He is requesting the loan to buy corn, barley, and corn wholesale.
                                                
He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat and barley.

loans.name: Sheriff

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Sheriff from Kissy, eastern area in Freetown, Sierra Leone.  He is married with 3 children between the ages of 8 years and 21 years. He also takes care of 6 relatives at home. In 2008, Sheriff established his local food stuff business. He began his business because he wanted to generate enough income to support his family.  He also earns income from renting out a house. He says that the main challenge to his business is increases in prices.

Sheriff requires a loan in order to buy more palm oil, garri (cassava product), bulgur (wheat), and corn flour. He hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow him to increase his profits and educate his children. In the future, Sheriff plans to own another store. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more local food stuffs such as palm oil, bulgur, corn flour and garri to sell.

loans.name: Jyambere Muhinzi/nyghnk Group

texts.fr:
Théoneste fait partie du groupe Jyamberemuhinzi/Nyghnk. Il a 32 ans et il est marié avec 3 enfants de 3 à 8 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6  ans de primaire.

Théoneste est cultivateur des tomates. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture des tomates. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est agrandir la récolte des tomates en utilisant des engrais chimiques.  Dans les prochaines années. Avec les profits, Théoneste prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Théoneste belongs to the Jyamberemuhinzi/Nyghnk group. He is 32 years old and married with three children whose ages range from 3 to 8, and one of whom attends school. Théoneste completed six years of primary education.

Théoneste is a tomato farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers to grow tomatoes.

His strategy to expand his business is to increase his tomato harvest by using chemical fertilizers. In the coming years, with his profits, Théoneste intends to educate and take care of his children.

loans.use: To buy chemical fertilizers to grow tomatoes.

loans.name: Marie-Jeanne

texts.fr:
Cliente de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 14 et 20 ans, elle se lance dans la vente des beignets et bouillie de mais et du riz au lait il y’a bientôt 20 ans, pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
Ayant déjà bénéficié de plusieurs cycles de prêts, ces prêts ont largement contribué a l’accroissement de son activité, son capital a largement évolué, ses recettes ont largement augmentées, elle vend en moyenne 50.000 a 75.000 frs par jour et elle a fait des épargnes considérables.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter 5 sacs  de 50 kg de farines, 5 bidons de 25 l  d’huile, 50 kg de riz, 25 kg bouillie de mais, 50kg de lait. Son activité étant située non loin d’une école primaire, elle  a pour stratégie de commencer à frire ses beignets de bon matin pour que les écoliers qui  y passent prennent leur petit déjeuner, le soir elle fait des pâtes à choux, des gâteaux qu’elle vend aussi dans le quartier.
Elle a d’abord améliorée  la qualité de ses services, ses conditions de vie famille ont positivement change, puisqu’elle arrive à payer les études de ses enfants qui sont dans les institutions privées.
Pour l’avenir, elle est entrain de continuer a épargner pour être une grossiste de farine ici au Congo
texts.en:
This borrower is a 48-year-old married woman and mother of three children aged between 14 and 20 years old. She started selling beignets, corn porridge and rice pudding nearly 20 years ago to support her family. She has received several previous loans, which were a great help in expanding her activity, increasing her capital and boosting her revenue. Her daily sales average 50,000 to 75,000 francs and she has made substantial savings. 

She is seeking a new loan to purchase five 50 kg bags of flour, five 25-liter jugs of oil, 50 kg of rice, 25 kg of corn porridge, and 50 kg of milk. Because she runs her business near a primary school, her strategy is to start frying her beignets early every morning so that the schoolchildren may stop by to get their breakfast. Later in the day, she makes choux pastries and cakes to sell around the neighborhood.  

She improved the quality of her services and saw her family’s living conditions take a turn for the better. She can now afford her children’s tuition in private institutions. 

Her goal for the future is to continue to save and become a flour wholesaler in Congo.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, rice, corn and milk

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her food stock.

loans.name: Sheriff

texts.en:
Sheriff is 40 years old and married with 1 child, age 10 years. He runs a general merchandise store in Lumley in Freetown, Sierra Leone.

He's been in this business for 10 years and sells bottled water, sugar, milk, stout, toilet rolls, Heineken and soft drinks at his store. He began this business because he needed to have a permanent source of income. He says that the main challenge to his business is price fluctuation.

Sheriff requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more provisions and assorted drinks. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him educate his child. In the future, Sheriff would like to import goods from overseas. He is grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and assorted drinks to sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 34 years old and is married with three children between the ages 4 and 10 years old. His business is well and clean, he sells charcoal. Alfred has six years of experience in his business and he works from 6am until 7pm every day except Sunday. 

Alfred has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more sacks of charcoal. With the profit from this loan, Alfred will increase his business by buying 20 sacks of charcoal in order to be wholesale, and to build his own house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Pauline

texts.fr:
Cliente de 52 ans, célibataire avec 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 7 et  30 ans, quand elle perd son travail en 1991, avec ses droits reçus, elle se lance dans le commerce de la friperie.
Elle est à son troisième cycle de prêt, elle a fait des bénéfices énormes, et a eu à faire des épargnes formidables.
Ces prêts ont largement contribué à l’avancement de son activité, elle est entrain de réunir  son propre capital maintenant, et a aussi des  stocks de ballots de friperie , elle n’est plus jamais en rupture de stock grâce aux crédits de Hope.
Avec ce nouveau, elle va acheter des ballots de robes d’enfants, des bodies pour préparer les fêtes de fin d’année.  
Très entreprenante, elle est entrain d’investir pour ouvrir un dépôt de ballots de friperie, et s’occupe valablement de ses enfants et est entrain de s’investir pour leurs études.
texts.en:
This client is 52 years old, single with three children between 7 and 30 years of age. When she lost her job in 1991, she used her severance to launch a business selling  used clothing. She is on her third loan cycle. Her revenues are significant, and she has been able to grow her savings in an excellent way.

These loans have helped grow her business. She is now able to use her own capital and maintain a stock of clothes bales. Thanks to loans from Hope, she no longer runs out of stock. With this new [loan], she will purchase bales with children’s and infants clothing in order to prepare for the end of the year holidays. Very enterprising, she is now investing  to open a warehouse for used clothing. She takes care of her children and supports their studies.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Mitzy

texts.es: Mitzy, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Esta casada con Carlos, vive en compañía de él y de su pequeño hijo de tres años en su casa que lograron comprarla a base de mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Mitzy es la venta de ropa y accesorios femeninos, para lo cual cuenta con una boutique que logró abrir hace dos años, en un espacio que acondiciono en su propia casa. De esta manera  ahorra gastos de alquiler, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a todos sus clientes. Esta actividad la realiza sola y le gusta lo que hace porque gracias a ello es independiente y puede ganar su propio dinero, así también apoya a su esposo en los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado se da tiempo para atender a su pequeño hijo. Tiene planes de abrir otro local en una zona céntrica de ciudad, y así poder hacer crecer más su negocio. Este seria el cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, se siente contenta de poder contar con el apoyo de la institución. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en su totalidad en la venta de ropa de diversos modelos y accesorios para las fiestas navideñas.
texts.en: Mitzy, age 27, is an enterprising and very hard-working woman. She is married to Carlos, and lives with him and their three-year-old child in a home which they were able to buy after a great deal of hard work. Mitzy sells clothing and women's accessories; she has her own boutique which she opened two years ago in a special area of her home. This way, she does not have to pay rent. She provides very good customer service, and works alone. She enjoys her work because she is independent and can make her own money and support her husband with the household costs. She also has time to take care of her little one. Mitzy plans to open another location in a central area of the city, in order to expand her business more. This will be her fourth loan with MFP, and she is happy to have their support. She will invest all of this loan in the purchase of a large variety of clothing and accessories for the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy more clothing and accessories for Christmas.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: La señora Blanca se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos de la línea blanca (refrigeradores, cocinas, hornos de micro ondas, etc.) y también de equipos electrónicos. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un cd player, un equipo de sonido y una lavadora eléctrica, ya que se acerca la época navideña y las ventas de estos artículos suben. Esta es su actividad principal con la que genera ingresos para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en casa en alquiler  la misma queda  ubicada en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz, es separada  y  tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que Blanca obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Blanca sells household appliances from the Blanca line (refrigerators, stoves, microwave ovens, etc.).  She also sells electronic equipment.

She needs the loan to buy a CD player, a sound system, and an electric washer.  The Christmas season is approaching, and sales for these items rise.  This is her main business activity that generates income to cover her expenses.

She lives in a rented house in the Miraflores zone of the city of La Paz.  She is separated and has two children.

This is Blanca’s first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a CD player, a sound system, and an electric washer to offer a greater variety of products to her clientele.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith, de 36 años, es una mujer trabajadora, dinámica y deseosa de progresar. Esta separada, pero vive en compañía de su madre y sus dos hijos de 17 y 10 años en su casa que es propia. La actividad que realiza Judith es la costura, elabora todo tipo de prendas de vestir a pedido de sus clientes, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Aprendió este oficio gracias a que se inscribió en un centro de educación ocupacional, viendo las necesidades económicas que tenía en su hogar; y tuvo como herramienta una maquina de coser que logró adquirir gracias a un préstamo que solcito hace ocho años. Lo que le gusta de actividad es el poder contar con un ingreso económico con el cual pueda solventar los gastos de su hogar, ya que ahora estando sola, es el sostén de su familia. Comenta que le gusta coser, desde muy pequeña le llamo la atención, y gracias a esta oportunidad tiene un trabajo. Tiene planes de poder ampliar su negocio, y renovarlo. Comprando otra maquina de coser y así renovar la que tiene. Este sería el crédito número trece con la institución MFP, se siente bien con el trabajo de su banco comunal, el poder compartir con otras personas, y considera a todos sus miembros ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos, elásticos y demás accesorios de costura, ya que cuenta con pedidos que tiene por entregar.
texts.en: Judith is 36 years old. She is a hard-working and dynamic woman with a great desire to make progress. She is separated, but she lives with her mother and her two children, aged 17 and 10, in a house that she owns. Judith's work is tailoring. She makes all kinds of garments in response to orders from her clients, for men, women and children. She learned this profession when she signed up at an occupational education center. She had the economic needs of her household in mind, and she had a sewing machine as a tool, which she was able to acquire thanks to a loan she applied for eight years ago. What she likes about her work is being able to have an income to cover her household expenses, since she is now the only breadwinner in her family. She comments that she likes to sew -- she was already interested in it as a young girl -- and thanks to this opportunity she has a job. She has plans to expand her business and update it by purchasing another sewing machine so she can renovate the one she has. This will be her thirteenth loan with the MFP institution. She feels good about the work of her communal bank, since she can share with other people, and she thinks all of the members are good people. With the amount she is requesting, she will invest in buying fabrics, threads, elastic and other tailoring supplies, since she has orders she needs to fill.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread and elastic.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
El señor Mario tiene 35 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Nueva Esperanza que pertenece al municipio de Concepcion Sur. Mario se casó muy joven (a los 15 años) y lleva 20 años de casado con su esposa Maria. La pareja tiene 4 hijos de 5, 10, 12 y 15 años. 

Don Mario tiene una pulpería donde vende granos básicos como arroz y frijol, y otros productos de la canasta básica como carne, huevos, leche y sal. También vende productos como papel higiénico, pañales, medicamentos, productos de limpieza, champú y pasta de diente, jugos y golosinas. Mario trabaja todo el día en la pulpería como es el único fuente de ingreso de su familia. 

La pulpería fue idea de su esposa. Siguiendo los consejos de ella, don Mario se puso la pulpería. La empezó con capital propio y con un crédito que solicitó en ODEF. Notó un aumento en la venta y en sus ganancias después de haber sacado el crédito. Con el crédito actual de L20,000, don Mario comprará productos para aumentar su inventario y un molino para moler maíz. Espera incrementar su venta para poder vivir mejor y poder sacar adelante sus hijos con el estudio.
texts.en:
Mario, age 35, lives in the village of Nueva Esperanza in the Concepción Sur municipality.  Mario married very young (15 years old), and he has been married to his wife, Maria, for 20 years.  The couple has four children; ages 5, 10, 12, and 15.

Mario has a grocery store where he sells basic grains like rice and beans, and other staple products like meat, eggs, milk, and salt.  He also sells products like toilet paper, diapers, medication, cleaning products, shampoo, toothpaste, juice, and sweets.  Mario works all day in the grocery store as it is the only source of income for his family.

The grocery store was his wife’s idea.  Following her advice, Mario established the grocery store.  He started it with his own capital and with a loan that he requested from ODEF.  He noticed an increase in sales and in his earnings after having taken out the loan.

Mario will use the current loan for 20,000 lempiras to buy products to increase his inventory.  He will also buy a mill to grind corn.  He hopes to increase his sales to be able to live better and to be able to get his children ahead with their education.

loans.use: to buy a mill and inventory.

loans.name: Danny

texts.es: El señor Danny es empleado en una empresa de telecomunicaciones. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una computadora ya que quiere realizar trabajos de investigación para colegiales y universitarios, como una manera de generar ingresos extraordinarios. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Munaypata de la Ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y no tiene hijos. Danny es cliente de Impro desde el año 2009 y esta es la segunda vez que desea que su crédito se canalize a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Danny is employed by a telecommunications company.  

He needs the loan to buy a computer.  He wants to do investigative work for schools and universities as a way to generate extra income.

He lives in his parents’ house in the Munaypata zone of the city of La Paz.  He is single, and he does not have children.

Danny has been a client of IMPRO since 2009.  This is the second time that he wishes to get a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a computer in order to do extra jobs and generate other income.

loans.name: Raimundo

texts.es: El señor Raimundo tiene una pequeña empresa de atención de eventos sociales donde ofrece todo tipo de bocaditos; Raimundo también trabaja como mesero en acontecimientos sociales. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de los bocaditos (harina, polvo de hornear, condimentos, carne, pescado, etc.). Vive en casa en anticretico la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene dos hijos. Raimundo se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que obtuvo anteriormente ya que le ayudaron a crecer como microempresario. Esta es la segunda vez que su crédito se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Raimundo has a small company where he offers all types of snacks at social events.  Raimundo also works as a waiter at social events.

He needs the loan to buy ingredients to make the snacks (flour, baking powder, condiments, meat, fish, etc.). 

He lives in a house with by “anticredito”.  (In an “anticrético” arrangement, the owner leases property for a lump sum deposit in lieu of monthly rent. At the end of the lease period, the money is returned to the renter. If the owner fails to repay the money, the renter gets to keep the property.) He lives in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has two children.

Raimundo is very pleased with the loans that he previously received.  They helped him grow as a small businessman.  

This is the second time that his loan has been referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking powder, condiments, meat, fish, etc.for his small business of providing snacks at social events.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, jeans, shoes, dishes, etc. in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto es jubilado y recibe una renta cada mes. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de un tratamiento medico ya que tiene una enfermedad de las caderas. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona  Bajo San Antonio de la Ciudad de La Paz; es casado y tiene dos hijos pero ya están casados. Humberto ya ha recurrido a Impro en siete ocasiones para solicitar crédito desde el año 2006, y esta es la tercera vez que solicita que su crédito sea fondeado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Humberto is retired, and he receives a pension every month.

He needs the loan to pay the bill for medical treatment because he has a hip disease.

He lives in his own house in the Bajo San Antonio area of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has two children, but they are married.

Humberto has come to Impro on seven occasions since 2006 to request a loan.  This is the third time that he has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to pay for medical treatment for his hips because he suffers from an illness that does not allow him to walk well.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio tiene 33 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; El socio sigue trabjando en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes y tambien sigue trabajando en el area de seguridad de una empresa,el negocio de tienda de abarrotes lo realiza su pareja,por medio D. negocio y de su trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos  .El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como arroz,azúcar,aceite,fideos y golosinas para la tienda de abarrotes.
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, 33, lives with his live-in partner and has three children.  He continues working in his grocery store business and also in the area of security for a company.  His partner takes care of the grocery store business.  By means of the business and the job, the member gets his family ahead.

The member is requesting the loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and candy for the grocery store.                                                

The member is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, noodles, and candy.

loans.name: Edith

texts.fr:
Cliente de 44 ans, celibataire  avec 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 16 et 23 ans, elle ouvre un restaurant en 1996 a l'arrêt de ses etudes en terminal par faute de soutien financier.
Tres pragmatique, elle n'a pas cherche a aller loin dans la cour de la parcelle familiale, elle crée une cuisine ou chaque matin elle se lève très tôt pour préparer , ces clients sont les taxi-mans, des ouvriers qui ont des ateliers au alentour de son resto.Elle a des recettes de 60.000frs a 75.000 frs par jour.

Pour une quatrième fois , elle va encore bénéficier du prêt de Hope , elle compte acheter des cartons de morue, soles, des cartons de poissons de mer, poissons fumes , de l'huile et des assaisonnements.

Tres serviable et dynamique, elle tient a s'affirmer en tant que restauratrice et elle tient a aller loin dans son activité,elle prend soin de ses enfants et assure leur scolarité  et soutient sa fille qui est entrain de faire des etudes de journalisme.
texts.en:
This borrower is a 44-year-old single woman with three children aged between 16 and 23 years old. She opened a restaurant in 1996 after quitting her studies at the end of her high school education for lack of financial support. A very pragmatic woman, she opted to stay close to home and set up a kitchen in the backyard of the family residence. She gets up very early every morning to start cooking. Her customers are taxi drivers and workers from nearby shops. Her revenue averages 60,000 to 75,000 francs daily. 

This is her fourth time seeking a loan from Hope. She will use the credit to buy cartons of cod, sole, seafood, smoked fish, oil and seasonings. 

Very obliging and enthusiastic, she wishes to make a name for herself as a restaurant operator and plans to keep going forward in this activity. She takes care of her children and provides for their education, and she also supports her daughter who started journalism studies.

loans.use: to buy cod, sole, seafood, smoked fish, oil and seasonings for her restaurant

loans.name: Makalie Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Makalie” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. These entrepreneurs are seeking a loan of 800,000 SLL for each in order to further develop their respective businesses. 

The leader of this group is Fatmata who is age 39. Fatmata was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and five children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For four years now, Fatmata has been selling clothes and shoes. With this loan, she will buy clothes and shoes wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia sigue trabajando con su negocio de polleria y tambien tiene un negocio de tienda de abarrotes donde vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,fideos y aceite,el negocio de polleria lo realiza desde las 4:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 p.m,por medio de estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de polleria y el ngeocio de tienda de abarrotes . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar los pollos como papas, condimentos y pollos y tambien para comprar productos como arroz,azucar,leche y fideos al por mayor.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is 35 years old and lives with her partner and their three children. She owns a poultry store and a small business selling groceries such as rice, sugar, pasta and oil. She works in her poultry store from 4:00 a.m. until 11:00 p.m. The income from this business has allowed the member to support her children.

She now wants to expand and improve her businesses. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as potatoes, seasoning, and chicken, as well as wholesale groceries such as rice, sugar, milk and pasta. The member is happy to have access to this loan and is committed to repaying it on time.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as potatoes, seasoning, and chicken, as well as wholesale groceries such as rice, sugar, milk and pasta.

loans.name: Yahaira Karolina

texts.es:
Doña Yahaira tiene 31 años de edad y vive en la aldea de Campana en el departamento Cortes. La señora tiene dos hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad. Lleva 7 años de casado con su esposo Miguel, lo cual es topógrafo. 

Como don Miguel tiene trabajo estable, doña Yahaira anteriormente lo pasaba en casa cuidando de los niños. Cuando estos crecieron, ella decidió junto con su esposo, poner un negocio para tener otro fuente de ingreso para la familia. Abrió un puesto cerca de una escuela de la aldea y allí vende todo tipo de  golosinas para niños. Vende churros, dulces, aguas, chicles, y paletas (helado que se come en un palo). El puesto se abre a las 5 de la mañana y sigue abierto hasta las 5 de la tarde. 

Yahaira solicitó su primer crédito de L4000 para la compra de productos como chicles, frutas, y churros para surtir su negocio. Ella quiere hacer crecer el negocio y realizarse como comerciante para ayudar a sus hijos a culminar sus estudios. El crédito sirve de mucho ya que con el, se tiene más productos y los clientes encuentran lo que buscan. Con un inventario más amplio, Yahaira espera competir con las pulperías cercanas.
texts.en:
Doña Yahaira is 31 years old and lives in the village of Campana in the department of Cortes.  The Señora has two children aged 15 and 12 years old.  She has been married for seven years to Miguel, who is a surveyor.

As Don Miguel has stable work, Doña Yahaira previously stayed at home taking care of the children.  As they grew up, she decided, together with her husband, to start a business to earn another source of income for the family.  She opened a food stall close to a school in the village, and this is where she sells all types of confectionery for children.  She sells churros (dough fritters), sweets, water, gum and paletas (popsicles).  Her food stall opens at five in the morning, and remains open until 5 in the afternoon.

Yahaira has requested her first loan of L4,000 for the purchase of products such as gum, fruit and churros to stock up her business.  She wants to grow her business and establish herself as a businesswoman in order to help her children complete their education.  The loan will be very useful to her as with it, she will be able to have more products in stock and her customers will be able to find what they want.  With a larger inventory, Yahaira hopes to compete with the small grocery stores nearby.

loans.use: to purchase gum, fruit and churros (dough fritters).

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Nohemi; la socia tiene 46 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 3 hijos ; La socia ha cambiado de negocio,ahora se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de pasteles,ella tiene una pasteleria donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,ella lleva los pasteles a diferentes pastelerias,por medio de este engcoio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de pasteles . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer los pasteles como harina,mantequilla,azucar y manteca.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member is Nohemi.  She is 46 years old, lives with her live-in partner, and has three children.

The member has changed businesses.  Now she works selling cakes.  She has a cake shop where she works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She takes the cakes to various cakes shops.  By means of this business she gets her children ahead.

Nohemi wants to expand and improve her business selling cakes.  She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients to make cakes, such as flour, butter, sugar, and lard.

She is grateful for the support that will be given her and also is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make cakes, such as flour, butter, sugar, and lard.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, groundnuts, etc. wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth, clothes and shoes in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Cliente de 54 ans, veuve avec 5 enfants a sa charge dont l’âge varie entre 17 et 36 ans. Elle se lance dans la vente  de la friperie en 1998  avec une somme de 30.000frs.
Elle est déjà passe par  trois cycles de prêts de Hope, elle est leader, très exemplaire, elle a fait ses remboursements sans défauts de paiements, et elle a des épargnes considérables.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle va acheter des ballots de friperie de sous vêtements non utilises, tel que des soutiens et slips des femmes.
Sa stratégie est de choisir les meilleurs produits et d’offrir une bonne qualité de service à ses clients.
Elle a pour ambition d’ouvrir une boutique de sous vêtements, prendre soin de ses enfants et assuré leur avenir.
texts.en:
This client is 54 years old, widowed, and has five children between the ages of 17 and 36 in her care. She began selling second-hand clothing in 1998 with 30,000 Frs. capital.
She has already gone through three loan cycles with Hope; she is an exemplary leader, has repaid her loans without defaulting, and has built up considerable savings.
With this new loan, she is going to buy bales of second-hand clothing, specifically unused undergarments such as bras and women's slips.
Her strategy is to choose the best products and to offer quality service to her customers.
Her ambitions are to open an undergarments store and to take care of her children and ensure a good future for them.

loans.use: To buy bales of second-hand clothing, specifically unused women's undergarments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cloth, clothes and shoes in a larger quantity to add to her business.

loans.name: Katty

texts.es: Katty, de 25 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, alegre y deseosa de ser una empresaria. Esta casada con Iván, fruto de esta unión tiene dos hermosas hijas de 3 y 1 años. Juntos habitan en su casa que es propia. La actividad que ejerce Katty es la venta de ropa, tanto para damas, como para caballeros y niños,  para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos a la ciudad de Lima, donde compra a precios cómodos en el emporio comercial de dicha ciudad. Luego los vende al contado o a crédito ya sea a amistades, familiares y conocidos. Tiene un año dedicándose a esta actividad, y gracias al apoyo de su esposo, la apoya en la búsqueda de nuevos clientes. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el sentirse realizada al poder tener un ingreso propio, depender de su propio negocio, sin embargo le molesta mucho cuando algunos de sus clientes se demoran en cancelar su compra. Su anhelo es tener su boutique en su casa. Este sería el préstamo número tres con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por el apoyo que recibe, y por ello se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de diferentes modelos.
texts.en:
Katty, age 25, is a happy and hardworking woman and an enthusiastic entrepreneur. Her husband is named Iván, and the couple have two beautiful daughters, ages 3 and 1. The family lives in a house that they own.

Katty sells clothing for women, men and children. She travels to Lima periodically to buy clothing at wholesale prices. Her customers are friends, relatives and acquaintances, so she offers sales on credit as well as cash. She has been running her business for 1 year with the support of her husband, who helps bring in new customers. Katty enjoys her work and being able to earn income, although she faces challenges when her customers delay in paying for their credit purchases.

Her goal is to have a clothing boutique in her home. This loan will be her third with MFP. Katty is happy and grateful for the financial support, and is committed to prompt repayment of her loan. With the loan funds she will purchase new clothing styles.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей – фермер из Каменского региона. Он вместе с женой и 8-летним сыном живет в селе Водяное. Сергец занимается выращиванием ранних овощей вот уже 6 лет. На данный момент у него уже есть 6 больших теплиц и 2 теплицы для рассады. В свое дело вложено 70 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку ежегодно составляют 25 000 гривен.  

Сергею необходим кредит в 13 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить пленку и материалы для теплиц, а именно приобрести полиэтиленовую пленку на 5 000 гривен, арматуру для теплиц на сумму 6 000 гривен и семян на 2 000 гривен. В следующем году Сергей хочет купить землю в конце своего огорода и построить там дополнительные теплицы.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Sergei is a farmer from the Kamenka region.  He lives with his wife and 8 year-old son in the Vodyanoe village.  Sergei has been involved in growing early vegetables for six years.  Currently, he has six large greenhouses and two greenhouses for seedlings.  He invested 70,000 hryvnia into his business.  Annual expenses for seeds and plastic is 25,000 hryvnia.  Sergei needs a loan in the sum of 13,000 hryvnia to buy plastic and materials for greenhouses, specifically to 5,000 hryvnia to buy plastic, 6,000 hryvnia to buy fixtures for greenhouses and 2,000 hryvnia to buy seeds.  Sergei wants to buy land at the end of his farm and build additional greenhouses there next year.

loans.use: to buy plastic and materials for greenhouses, specifically to 5,000 hryvnia to buy plastic, 6,000 hryvnia to buy fixtures for greenhouses and 2,000 hryvnia to buy seeds

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Selmith

texts.es: Selmith, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y muy alegre. Es viuda, pero vive en compañía de sus tres hijos de 40, 39 y 29 años, y sus cinco nietos a los que quiere y engríe mucho en su casa que es propia. La actividad que realiza Selmith es la venta de ropa de diversas calidades, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños. Dicha mercadería lo compra en la ciudad de Pucallpa y en ocasiones trae a pedido de la ciudad de Lima. Que luego los lleva a vender en zonas alejadas de la ciudad, como caseríos ubicados a los márgenes del río Ucayali, para ello realiza viajes cortos. Tiene dos años dedicándose a esta actividad, y gracias al apoyo de sus hijos puede continuar con su trabajo. Lo que le gusta es el tener un ingreso económico con el cual pueda solventar sus gastos propios y darse algunos gustos, cómprarles  regalos a sus nietos. Sin embargo, la edad que tiene le resulta un poco pesado el trabajo. Este sería el cuarto préstamo con la institución MFP, por lo que espera el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de diversos modelos y para todos los géneros.
texts.en:
Selmith, 60, is a fighter and a hard-working and very happy woman.  She is widowed, but lives in her own home surrounded by her three children, ages 40, 39, and 29, and her five grandchildren, whom she loves and spoils a lot.

Selmith's job is selling clothing of different classes for women, men, and children.  She buys this merchandise in the city of Pucallpa and occasionally takes orders from the city of Lima to remote parts of the city like communities located on the banks of the Ucayali River, for which she makes short trips.

She has been doing this work for two years, and thanks to the support of her children she can continue with her job.  What she likes is having an income with which she can pay her own expenses, give herself a few pleasures, and buy gifts for her grandchildren.  Nevertheless, because of her age the work is a little tedious for her.

This would be her fourth loan with the MFP institution and she hopes for the support of each one of you.

With the requested loan she will buy clothing in various designs and for all types.

loans.use: to buy clothing in various designs and colors.

loans.name: Irma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Irma, continua trabajando, pero ya no en su negocio propio de su pulperia, pues su inversion se vino a bajo, cuando comenzo a dar creditos, el cual no pagaron cerrando la venta, en donde busco un trabajo fijo. Pues son tres hijos a quien dar estudios, alimentacion entre otros gastos, ya que no cuenta con la ayuda del papa de los niños.
Lleva, casi el año laborando, en servicios domestico, pero su objetivo es seguir mejorando su pequeña casa, con este nuevo financiamiento, hara un muro  lateral, reguardando mas su propiedad, dando a sus hijos seguridad.
texts.en:
Irma is continuing to work, but no longer in her own general store business.  This is because her investment collapsed when she started to extend credit which wasn't repaid, causing the store to close. So she looked for a regular job. 

She has three children to educate and feed, as well as other expenses, as she doesn't have help from the children's father. She has been working as a domestic for almost a year, but her goal is to keep improving her small house. With this new loan, she will have a side wall built, providing more protection for her property, and keeping her children safe.

loans.use: To build a side wall to protect her property.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.ru:
Александр живет и трудится в Каменке. Он занимается сельским хозяйством и, в частности, выращивает ранние овощи: помидоры и редис на продажу. У Александра есть два участка земли: на одном – большая теплица, на втором – две построенных и еще одну строит. Каждый год Александр садит 5 000 высокорослых помидор. В сельскохозяйственном бизнесе он уже 9 год. На данный момент Александр уже вложил в хозяйство 65 000 гривен. Затраты на семена и пленку ежегодно составляют 30 000 гривен. 

Александр планирует использовать кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закончить строительство дополнительной теплицы, купить пленку и установить отопление в уже существующих теплицах. Недавно купив участок в 10 соток, Александр планирует развиваться за счет него и строить там новые дополнительные теплицы. Это позволит ему расширить хозяйство и увеличить доход.   
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Alexander lives and works in Kamenka.  He is involved in agriculture and grows various vegetables, such as tomatoes and radishes, for sale.  Alexander has two plots of land, one of which has a large greenhouse and the other has two completed and one unfinished greenhouse.  He plants 5,000 tall tomatoes every year.  He has been in the agricultural business for the ninth year now.  Alexander invested 65,000 hryvnia into his business to-date.  His annual expenses for seeds and plastic is 30,000 hryvnia.  Alexander plans to use the Kiva loan of 15,000 hryvnia to complete the construction of the additional greenhouse, buy plastic and install heating in the existing greenhouses.  Having recently bought a land plot of 10 sotkas, Alexander plans to grow there and build additional greenhouses.  This will allow him to expand his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to complete the construction of the additional greenhouse, buy plastic and install heating in the existing greenhouses

loans.name: Go Ahead Group

texts.en:
Francis is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Francis was born in Magburaka town, about 45 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple have two children who are attending primary school. Francis sells medicines and has been doing this business for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Francis and his group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Francis will use his share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy basic medicines to add to his current stock of medicines.

loans.use: to buy basic medicines to add to his current stock of medicines.

loans.name: Dina Lizzeth

texts.es:
La señora Dina tiene 36 años de edad y vive en una aldea del municipio de San Pedro Sula. Dina es separada y tiene tres hijos de 4, 14, y 16 años de edad. Los dos mayores están estudiando. Doña Dina cuenta con el apoyo del padre de sus hijos quien la ayuda cubrir los gastos de educación. 

Anteriormente, doña Dina era ama de casa pero con la separación de su esposo hace un año, ella tenía la necesidad de proveer para sus hijos y conseguir un fuente de ingreso. Lo encontró muy difícil conseguir empleo así que ella colocó una chiclera (pequeño puesto donde vende golosinas). La chiclera creció hasta llegar ser una pequeña pulpería. 

En la pulpería vende productos de consumo personal como carnes, cornflakes, pañales, papel, cloro, jabón, huevos, pan, lácteos, azúcar, arroz, frijol, churros y jugos. Dina atiende a su clientela 16 horas al día. Ella nota que el incremento en el costo de la canasta básica ha impactado a sus clientes y por supuesto, a sus ventas. 

Solicitó su primer crédito de L10,000 para surtir el negocio con la compra de refrescos, pan, huevos, churros, lácteos, jugos y agua. Ella espera cumplir con este compromiso con ODEF y hacer crecer su pulpería para estar más orgullosa de ella misma. Ella agradece de antemano por creer en ella y por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en:
Señora Dina is 36 years old, and lives in a village in the municipality of San Pedro Sula.  Dina is separated, and has three children aged 4, 14, and 16.  The two eldest are in school.  Doña Dina has assistance from the father of her children, who helps her cover their education expenses.

Previously Doña Dina was a housewife, but when she separated from her husband a year ago, she needed to provide for her children and identify a source of income.  She had great difficulty in finding employment, so she opened a "chiclera" (a small stand where she sells candies).  The chiclera has grown to the extent that it has now become a small general store.

In her store, she sells everyday items such as meat, cornflakes, diapers, toilet paper, bleach, soap, eggs, bread, dairy products, sugar, rice, beans, churros (dough fritters) and juices.  Dina serves her customers 16 hours a day.  She notes that the increase in the cost of standard goods has impacted her customers, and consequently her sales.

She has requested her first loan of L10,000 to stock up her business with the purchase of sodas, bread, eggs, churros, dairy products, juices and water.  She intends to comply with her commitment to ODEF, and to be able to grow her general store so that she can become even more proud of it.  She is grateful to ODEF for believing in her, and for the opportunity that's being provided.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, bread, eggs, churros (dough fritters), dairy products, juices, and water.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house-building materials like staples, ropes, nails, etc. to add to his business inventory.

loans.name: Tesalia

texts.es: Tesalia, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, alegre y deseosa de progresar. Vive en compañía de su esposo William y su hijo de 15 años de edad en su casa que es de su propiedad. La actividad que realiza Tesalia es la costura, oficio que aprendió ayudando a una amiga en su taller, con los ingresos logró comprar su propia maquina de coser, iniciándose de esta manera en este oficio. Desde hace nueve años, tiempo en el cual ha logrado hacerse conocida y gracias a ello, creció su negocio, contando ahora con la ayuda de una amiga a la que paga por trabajo o pedido entregado. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el poder tener un ingreso económico con el cual ayuda con los gastos del hogar a su esposo. El estar ocupada y sentirse una mujer productiva es lo que más le gusta, por ello desea ampliar su negocio e instalar más maquinas y poder abrir un taller grande, desde donde podría atender a sus clientes, sabiendo que esto le generaría mejores ingresos económicos, así  como el poder dar empleos a otras personas. Este sería el crédito número ocho con la institución MFP, le gusta su trabajo de su banco comunal, se siente cómoda y a gusto. Espera seguir contando con el apoyo de la institución, por lo que será puntual en el pago de su cuota. Con el monto prestado, lo invertirá en materiales de costura, como telas e hilos en mayor cantidad y a menores precios, logrando así mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Tesalia, 44, is a hard-working, enterprising, and happy woman who wants to make progress.  She lives with her husband William and her 15-year-old son in her house, which is her own property.

Tesalia's job is sewing, a trade she learned helping a friend in her workshop.  With her income Tesalia managed to buy her own sewing machine, in this way starting in the trade.  For nine years she has managed to make herself known, thanks to which her business grew.  Now she has the help of a friend whom she pays by job or order completed.

What Tesalia likes about her job is being able to have an income with which she can help her husband with the household expenses.  Being busy and feeling like a productive woman is what she likes most.  This is why she wants to expand her business and install more machines and be able to open a big workshop from where she can take care of her customers.  She knows that this will generate more income for her and that she will be able to give jobs to other people.

This would be her eighth loan with the MFP institution.  She likes the work of her communal bank.  She feels comfortable and at home.  She hopes to continue getting the institution's support, for which she will be punctual with her payments.

With the loan Tesalia will buy sewing materials such as fabric and thread wholesale and at lower prices, getting better profits.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is 29 years old and lives in the town of Hoima, Uganda. He is married and has one child. For the past two years, Gerald has been working hard to manage his electronics shop, which sells mainly phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Gerald has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electronics and phone accessories, and will help Gerald to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. Gerald hopes that in the future he will be able to have a bigger phone center and become a tech consultant for all of mid-western Uganda. 

Gerald is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gerald who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more electronics and phone accessories for resale.

loans.name: Magda Rosa

texts.es:
Magda mujer humilde, emprendedora, su hijos estudiante y un futuro profesional. Tiene su negocio de ventas de cosméticos y variedad, desde que dejo de trabajar para una empresa privada hasta estos tiempos manteniendo su clientela. El préstamo anterior fue de gran beneficio para su familia ya que ha ido mejorando su nivel de vida mediante las ganancias obtenidas.
Con este préstamo comprara productos como: pinturas de labios, sombra, lápices de cejas y labios, perfumes para damas, caballeros y niños, así también variedad de maquillajes entre otros producto que son encargado por los clientes ya que estos tiempos de fiestas navideñas son los mejores regalos. Por tal motivo requiere aumentar el inventario e ingresar nuevas variedades de productos.
