Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al desarrollo de su negocio y el bienestar de su familia en la preparación de un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Magda is a modest, enterprising woman. Her children are a student and a future professional. She has had a business selling a variety of cosmetics, since she stopped working for a private company, and up to now she has been maintaining her clientele. 

The previous loan was of great benefit to her family, as she has gradually improved their standard of living through the profits she has made.

With this loan she will buy products such as lipstick, eye shadow, eyebrow and lip pencils, as well as ladies' men's and children's perfume. She will also buy a variety of make-up and other products ordered by her customers, since they are the best gifts for the Christmas holiday season.

That is why she needs to increase her inventory and bring in new kinds of products.

She is grateful to the financial institution for supporting the development of her business, and her family's well-being, as they make a better future.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: David Abel

texts.es:
David de 44 años, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Isla trinitaria”. Inicio esta actividad ya que desde pequeño le gustaban los carros, ante era chofer de un bus urbano, ahora con un pequeño capital pudo comprar un bus de transporte urbano.

Su labor la inicia desde muy temprano, termina su labor una vez cumplido el valor indicado que es de $50 dólar.
Su dificultad es cuando el bus se daña, no es fácil de componer. Solicita el préstamo para la compra de llantas de nuevas para su bus. Su sueño es construir su vivienda y la compra de otro bus en donde pueda brindar empleo.
texts.en:
David is 44, and lives in an area on the fringe of the city, called "Isla Trinitaria."  He started this business, as ever since he was a small boy, he has liked cars. Before this, he was a driver of a city bus. Now, with a bit of capital, he was able to buy a city bus. 

He starts work very early, and finishes once he has reached the specified amount of 50 dollars. His challenge is that when the bus gets damaged, it is  not easy to repair.  He is applying for the loan to buy new tires for his bus.  His dream is to build a house, and to purchase another bus, wherein he can offer someone employment.

loans.use: To buy new tires.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and clothes wholesale to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Lucia Marilet

texts.es: Lucia , 27 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, esta estudiando 4 grado de la primaria, ella es comerciante vende ropa de hombre ,mujer y niños , vende productos de belleza, también aprendió el oficio de costurera ella cose ropa solo para la temporada en que inicia el años escolar o fechas festivas del año antes se dedica a la costura por completo pero desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender ropa y la costura paso a ser una actividad que realiza en ocasiones especiales durante el año. Ella realizo el préstamo para compra de mercadería tales como ropa para caballero pantalones, camisas, camisetas, ropa para dama, ropa para niños. Esta inversión le ayudara a surtir de ropa nueva su mercadería y aprovechar las ventas navideñas. Entre sus metas esta el tener un local fijo donde pueda vender su mercadería y seguir luchando por darle un hogar digno a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Lucía is 29, married, and has a seven year-old son, who is in fourth grade of primary school. She is a small businessperson and sells men's, women's, and children's clothing; she also sells beauty products.  

She also leaned the seamstress trade. She only sews clothing for the back-to-school season and for holidays. Before, she was fully devoted to sewing, but for the past five years, she has been selling clothing, and sewing became something that that she does on special occasions during the year. 

She took out the loan to buy merchandise such as men's clothing, pants, shirts, T-shirts, ladies' clothing, and children's clothing.  This investment will help her stock her merchandise with new clothing, and take advantage of the Christmas sales season. Among her goals are to have a permanent location where she can sell her merchandise, and to continue striving to provide her small son with a decent home.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as men's clothing, pants, shirts, T-shirts, ladies' clothing and children's clothing.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in the C]coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She has been operating a clothes business for the last seven years. 

A loan of Ksh 30,000 will help Caroline purchase a new stock of babies' and ladies’ clothes. Besides clothing, she also has a three-wheeler vehicle in Malindi. 

She has set her goal at being able to sell clothes wholesale, the main challenges being lack of capital and the low season that comes in February every year. The proceeds from this loan will help Caroline educate her children and meet their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase babies' and ladies' clothes.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 50 años, es una mujer emprendedora y alegre, muy trabajadora. Esta casada con Esteban y juntos viven en su casa propia en compañía de sus dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad y un sobrino, a quien apoya en su educación.  La actividad que realiza Rosa en la venta de comida por las noches, tales como arroz chaufa, pollos fritos,  asados de pollos y demás, los cuales vende en una mesa que instalada en el frontis de su casa, en donde atiende a sus clientes. Dicha actividad lo realiza con el apoyo de su hijos. Paralelo a ello, vende cervezas,  para lo cual cuenta con un congelador donde guarda esta bebidas y las puede vender a la temperatura que les agrada a sus clientes. Teniendo seis años ejerciendo este trabajo y gracias a ello puede tener un ingreso económico, así apoya a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, ya que muchas veces con el sueldo de empelado público de salud que tiene su esposo no les alcanza para poder pagar los estudios universitarios de sus hijos.  Manifiesta que siente productiva, y es indenpendiente, y ahora anhela ampliar su negocio y consolidarse. Este sería el préstamo número seis con la institución MFP, se siente a gusto con su trabajo en su banco comunal y desea poder seguir formando parte. Con el monto solicitado, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza al por mayor, para tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50, is an enterprising and happy woman, and very hardworking. She is married to Esteban and they live together in their own home with their two children, 18 and 15, and a nephew who they support in his schooling. 

Rosa sells food at night like Peruvian fried rice, fried chicken, grilled chicken and other things. She sells them on a table in front of her house, where she tends to her customers. Her kids help her with this business. On the side, she also sells beer that she keeps in a freezer so she can sell them at the temperature that her customers like. She has been doing this for 6 years and it has given her an income so that she can help her husband with the costs of the home; often his public employee's salary does not cover their children's college studies. She feels productive and independent, and now wants to grow and consolidate her businesses. 

This will be her 6th loan with MFP. She likes her work in the village bank and hopes to continue being a part of it. With the requested loan, she will buy beer in bulk so she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy more beer.

loans.name: Maria Gregoria

texts.es: María, de 48 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante, vende jugos y reposterías (todo tipo de pan dulce y postres), madre de 5 hijos. Ella inicio su negocio hace 20 años vendía en una esquina del mercado después adquirió un pequeño kiosko en el mercado central de la ciudad de León donde la afluencia de clientes es constante, su esposo tiene un puesto de helados donde sus hijos después de clases lo ayudan atenderlo. Ella realizo el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para realizar malteadas de leches, batidos de frutas, reposterías, emparedados, sándwich, hamburguesas que son parte de los productos que ella vende en su kiosko. Con esta inversión podar adquirir más productos para vender u mejorar sus ventas durante esta época navideña donde hay bastantes visitas turísticas en la ciudad. Una de sus expectativas es comprar mesas y un exhibidor para colocar su repostería.
texts.en:
Maria, 48, lives in the city of Leon and is a merchant. She sells juices and desserts (all kinds of pastries and desserts). She is a mother of 5 children.

She started her business 20 years ago selling in a corner of the market. Later, she got a small stall in Leon's central market where the customers have more money. Her husband has an ice cream stall where their kids work after school. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for making milkshakes, fruit smoothies, desserts, sandwiches and hamburgers, some of the items that she sells at her kiosk. With this loan she will be able to have more products to offer and improve her sales during the Christmas season when there are a lot of tourists in the city. One of her objectives is to buy tables and a display case for her desserts.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make milkshakes, fruit smoothies, desserts, sandwiches and hamburgers to sell at her kiosk.

loans.name: Mama Salone Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Mama Salone” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to seek a loan of 500,000 SLL for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Nanah. Nanah was born in Magburaka 35 years ago. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary school. Nanah sells rice, cooking oil, pepper, salt, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), onions, etc. and has been doing business for eight years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil, pepper, salt, Maggi cubes, onions, etc. in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.name: Cinthya Carolina

texts.es: Cinthya es una alegre joven de 23 años de edad, que vive en la ciudad de León, es soltera, esta cursando su cuarto año de la carrera de Trabajo Social, trabaja vendiendo cosméticos Avon. Inicio este negocio hace 2 años ella era clienta pero posteriormente  lo vio como un opción de trabajo de medio tiempo pero a medida que fue pasando el tiempo fue adquiriendo clientes  sus ventas fueron incrementando al igual que lo premios que obtenía por ventas , le fue gustando además que esto le sirvió para ayudarla a pagar su universidad y cooperar con los gastos del hogar , ella sale a vender en su universidad, vende también de manera ambulante visitando casa por casa en los barrios aledaños en busca de clientes además de vender en su propia casa que es donde tiene su mercadería, cuando no esta vendiendo ella da clases a niños del jardín infantil que es otra de las actividades que mas disfruta Cinthya. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar  cosméticos Avon para aprovechar las ventas navideñas y tener producto que ofrecer a sus clientas. Por lo pronto desea terminar su carrera universitaria y tener la oportunidad de gerenciar una sucursal de la empresa de cosmético para la cual esta vendiendo.
texts.en:
Cinthya is a happy young woman of 23 who lives in the city of Leon. She is single and is in her 4th year of social work school. She works selling Avon cosmetics. She started doing this two years ago, but was a client before that. She saw it as a part time job opportunity and as time passed she acquired more customers and her sales increased, along with the prizes that she won for sales. She liked it and it also helped to pay for school and living expenses. She sells at her university and also door to door, visiting homes in nearby neighborhoods in search of customers. She also sells in her own home, which is where she keeps the merchandise. When she is not working, she gives classes to preschoolers, another one of her favorite things to do. 

She needs a loan to buy Avon cosmetics so that she can take advantage of Christmas sales opportunities and have products for her customers. She soon wants to finish her degree and have the chance to start her own branch of the cosmetics business that she's selling for.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 21 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the  region of Uganda. For the past four years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her business, which sells timber. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more wood, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and boost her family's welfare. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to complete the houses she is building and will eventually rent out. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more wood.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is 27 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in the  region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past three years, Raymond has been working hard to manage his clothes store, which sells men's, women's and children's wear. 

To help expand his business, Raymond has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cloth to make clothes, and will help Raymond to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Raymond hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big boutique and build a house. 

Raymond is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Raymond who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Juan Ramon es casado, tienen 44 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación primaria, tiene 6 hijos 4 de los cuales estudian, se dedica a la tejeduría y a la preparación del hilo para tejido, tinte y entre otros procesos, inició este trabajo como operario y lleva hasta el momento 14 años de experiencia en este trabajo.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materiales que son hilos y tinte para hilos y poder producir mas, en el futuro espera tener operario y mejor capital.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Ramon is 34 years old and married. He finished elementary school. He has 6 children, 4 of whom study. He works in the weaving industry and prepares yarn for weaving, dying and other processes. He started this work as an employee and up until now has 14 years of experience on the job. 

He is asking for a loan to buy raw materials such as yarn and dyes so as to increase production. In the future he hopes to have an employee and more capital.

loans.use: to buy yarn for weaving.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in Uganda. She is single and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Rose has been working hard to manage her business which sells timber. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more wood, and will help Rose to generate greater profits and improve her standard of living. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to build an estate. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more wood.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Hoima in Uganda. For the past four years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clothes shop, which sells ladies' and children's wear. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cloth to make clothes, and it will help Sarah to generate greater profits and better her family's welfare. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger, better boutique. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to make clothes.

loans.name: Pilar Marisol

texts.es:
Pilar de 43 años, una mujer trabajadora, que a pesar de ser mujer soltera ha podido salir adelante con la ayuda de Dios.
Su negocio es una pequeña tienda que está ubicada en la parte delantera de su vivienda.
Escogió esta actividad porque lo heredo de sus padres.
Su horario es de lunes a domingos, inicia desde las 6:00am hasta las 22:00pm.
Su dificultad es la delincuencia de su sector, ya que en la actualidad se incrementaron los robos.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de víveres como: lácteos, azúcar, arroz, papas, bebidas, etc.
Su sueño es que su negocio se amplia en otro lugar de la urbe.
texts.en: Pilar is 43 years old and a hardworking woman who in spite of being single has be able to get ahead with "God's help" (la ayuda de Dios). She has a small store which is located in the front part of her house. She chose this business because she inherited it from her parents. She works Mondays to Sundays from 6:00am until 22:00pm. Her difficulty is the crime in her area as recently the number of robberies have increased. She is asking for a loan to buy food staples such as: dairy products, sugar, rice, potatoes, beverages, etc. Her dream is that her business expand elsewhere in the city.

loans.use: to buy food staples such as dairy products, sugar, rice, potatoes, beverages, etc

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in Uganda. He is single and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 12 years, Charles has been working hard to manage his welding business, which makes window and door frames among other products. 

To help expand his business, Charles has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more supplies for welding, and it will help Charles to generate greater profits and build more rental houses. Charles hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another business like a restaurant. 

Charles is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charles who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for welding.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
La señora Dulce Maria  tiene tres hijos están en edad escolar y cuenta con el apoyo de su ex esposo los gastos de sus niños. Es originaria de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, tiene como principal actividad económica es la venta de ropa nueva y en ocasiones también vende comida que son tacos y hamburguesas, es muy trabajadora, responsable y quiere darles lo mejor a sus hijos. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio de venta de ropa nueva de invierno y así tener mas ingreso a su negocio y a su familia.
texts.en: Señora Dulce Maria has 3 children who are of school age and receives child maintenance support from her former husband. She is originally from the city of Nuevo Laredo. Her main economic activity is the sale of new clothes and on occasion she also sells food such as tacos and hamburgers. She is very hardworking, responsible and wants to give her children the best. She is asking for the loan to invest in her business selling new winter clothes and so have more income in her business and for her family.

loans.use: to buy new winter clothes for her business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in Uganda. He is married and has six children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his retail business, which sells different types of clothing. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale, and it will help Joseph to generate greater profits and improve his family's well being. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a wholesale business. 

Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in Uganda. For the past one and a half years, Robert has been working hard to manage his electronics shop, which sells mainly phones and phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Robert has requested a loan of 2,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more phones and phone accessories, and it will help Robert to generate greater profits and buy land. Robert hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business into a wholesale business. 

Robert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Robert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more phones and phone accessories.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 42 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, William has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells spare motor parts. 

To help expand his business, William has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more motor oil and tires, and it will help William to generate greater profits and complete the construction of his house. William hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a new, popular kind of motorcycle. 

William is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like William who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more motor oil and tires.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 51 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. She is married and has four children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, Christine has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks like soda, beer and spirits to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more crates of drinks, and it will help Christine to generate greater profits and improve her family's social and economical status. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her bar so that it also includes a depot. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of drinks.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 42 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past four years, Sulaiman has been working hard to manage his bar and lodge, which sells beer and soda in addition to offering beds to sleep in. 

To help expand his business, Sulaiman has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bed frames and crates of beer, and iti will help Sulaiman to generate greater profits and complete his family's second house. Sulaiman hopes that in the future he will be able to open a depot for soda. 

Sulaiman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaiman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bed frames and crates of beer.

loans.name: Las Tres Reynas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las tres Reynas lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Reyna Isabel de 24 años quien tiene una tortillería negocio que inicio hace 1 años con unas libras de maseca ahora compra dos quintales. Además vende ropa por encargo.
Las otras integrantes son María Esther de 28 años quien tiene una pequeña venta la cual inicio con el comercio de chiverías y golosinas y Dayana de 25 años quien vende de ropa usada.
texts.en:
The communal bank group the Tres Reynas consists of 3 hardworking and enterprising women one of whom is Señora Reyna Isabel. She is 24 years old and has a tortilla making business which she started a year ago with a few pounds of maseca. Now she buys 2 quintals (1 quintal = 100lbs). In addition, she sells clothes by order.

The other members of the group are María Esther who is 28 years old and has a small store which she started by selling sweets and chiveria products and Dayana who is 25 and sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy quintals of Maseca (product name for a type of flour), firewood, and clothes.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 32 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. She is widowed and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells ladies' cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase new and different cosmetic products, and it will help Jackline to generate greater profits and build her own house. Jackline hopes that in the future her shop will become the leading wholesale business for cosmetics in all of Masindi. 

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jackline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase new and different cosmetic products.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 32 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in Uganda. She is widowed and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her mobile clothes shop, which sells second-hand clothes to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more bundles of clothes, and it will help Annet to generate greater profits and build her own house. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to continue expanding her business. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of clothes for resale

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Diana de 26 años, una mujer muy emprendedora que se dedica a la elaboración y venta de ropa. Trabaja todos los días sin horarios fijos.

Su único problema que se le presenta es el transporte desde su casa a su trabajo.

Es madres soltera que con todos sus esfuerzo sale adelante para poder mantener a su hija.

El sueño que ella desea alcanzar es poder tener su propio taller de costura con maquinas industriales que le facilita el trabajo y así poder sacar adelante a su hija y a su mama.
texts.en: Diana is 26 years old. She is a very enterprising woman who makes and sells clothes. She works every day without a fixed schedule. The only problem she faces is transport from her house to her work. She is a single mother who with all her effort manages to get ahead and take care of her daughter. The dream she most wants to realize is having her own sewing workshop with industrial type sewing machines which make work easier and so take care of her daughter and mother.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making blouses and pants as well as thread.

loans.name: Aggey

texts.en:
Aggey is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past three years, Aggey has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells sodas, beers and water. 

To help expand his business, Aggey has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more crates of drinks, and it will help Aggey to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Aggey hopes that in the future he will be able to become the owner of a drink depot. 

Aggey is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aggey who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of drinks.

loans.name: Enrique Avenamar

texts.es:
El señor Enrique esta agradecido por su cooperación en los anteriores créditos, los cuales fueron para invertir en su negocio. 
Don Enrique esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en un nuevo productos que son dulces de tamarindo, ya que tendrá mas ventas y ganancias porque es un producto que se podrá vendar todo el año. 
Entre el señor Enrique y su papa quienes son los que atiende el negocio han decidido que con este producto de ventas de tamarindo su negocio tendrá más ganancias y así podrán ayudar a otras personas en darles trabajo.
texts.en:
Enrique is grateful for the help from the previous loans enabling him to invest in his business.

Enrique is requesting a loan to purchase new products such as tamarind (a tropical fruit) sweets because they will offer him more sales and earnings since they can be sold all year.  He and his father who handle the business have decided that with the sales of new products such as tamarind, they will earn more and be able to give work to others.

loans.use: to buy supplies to produce a new product

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Nulu has been working hard to manage his small stationery store, which sells books, pens, pencils and wash basins. 

To help expand his business, Nulu has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase new and different stationery items, and it will help Nulu to generate greater profits and pay for his children's school fees. Nulu hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big stationery shop. 

Nulu is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nulu who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase new and different stationery items.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two currently in school. For the past six years, Wilson has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and soap among other household items. 

To help expand his business, Wilson has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sugar and other commodities for his shop, and will help Wilson to generate greater profits and finish building his house. Wilson hopes that in the future he will be able to own a soap-making machine. 

Wilson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Wilson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar and other commodities for his shop.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María de 25 años, empezó con el negocio de la tienda hace 5 años atrás vendiendo mercadería en una tienda que está ubicada en su casa y su esposo trabaja como taxista todos los días.

María trabaja en su tienda de lunes a domingos de 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. El único problema que presenta su trabajo es la delincuencia y la inestabilidad de la energía eléctrica.

Tiene 2 hijos que estudian en escuela fiscal y una niña de 10 meses de nacida.

Su meta a alcanzar es agrandar mas el negocia para así generar un poco mas de ingresos para poder darle la educación a sus hijos y que su familia cuenta con una buena salud.
texts.en:
María is 25 years old. She started her store 5 years ago selling merchandise from a store that is located in her house. Her husband works every day as a taxi driver.

Maria works in her store Mondays to Sundays from 6 in the morning until 10 at night. The only problem with her work is the crime and unreliability of the electrical supply.

She has 2 children who study at a state school and a girl who is 10 months old.

Her goal is to be able to enlarge her business so as to generate a little more income and so be able to provide her children with an education. She also wants her family be healthy.

loans.use: to buy tuna, colas, and other products.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Propositos 1 Group

texts.en:
Angela is a borrower who lives in Puerto Plata in the Dominican Republic, in one of the most rural communities located on the outside of the city. She is one of the members of the group Mujeres con Propositos 1 (Women with Purpose).

Angela lives with her long term partner and two of her three children in a simple home. This community has scarce resources like bad roads and unsafe transportation, and people need to cross a big river on foot. Despite these difficulties, Angela runs a successful miscellaneous sales business. With this loan, she will be purchasing dozens of shoes, underwear for women and men, and various pieces of clothing.

This is Angela’s fourth loan with Esperanza International in almost 2 years of taking loans with us, and her profits have been saved and spent on her daughter's studies. She hopes to continue the growth of her business. Angela dreams of having a car. She could go to work easily, drive around with friends and visit different places. 

Her most difficult challenge has been to deal with the illness of her father. She enjoys eating and dancing. Thank you for lending to Angela and the Mujeres con Propositos group!

loans.use: to buy shoes, underwear and clothing.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 35, lives in the town of Kijura, Uganda. For the past four years, she has been working hard to manage her hardware store, which sells cement, iron sheets and nails, among other things. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more tools and construction supplies for resale and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and pay for her children's school fees. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to own a machine to manufacture cement. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and construction supplies for resale.

loans.name: Las Unidas Triunfaremos Group

texts.es:
El grupo Unidas Triunfaremos lo conforman María del Carmen, Ileana Francisca y Andrea, tres féminas trabajadoras y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora María del Carmen de 45 años quien desde hace 15 años tiene una fritanga con lo cual saco adelante a sus 8 hijos.
Mientras Ileana Francisca de dedica a la compra de chatarra para reciclaje y Andrea comercializa ropa usada desde hace 3 años.
texts.en: The group Unidas Triunfaremos consists of María del Carmen, Ileana Francisca and Andrea, 3 hardworking and enterprising women. The group coordinator is Señora María del Carmen who is 45 years old who has run a fried snack place for the last 15 years with which she raised her 8 children. Meanwhile Ileana Francisca buys scrap metal for recycling and Andrea has been selling used clothing for 3 years.

loans.use: to buy dry grains, meat, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es:
El señor Hipólito solicita el apoyo de un crédito para solventar el gasto de la colocación de un portón al frente de su vivienda, ya que debido a la inseguridad que hay en la colonia donde vive, es necesario instalar el portón y así este más seguro su patrimonio. 
Don Hipólito trabaja como encargado de una tienda comercia desde hace un año. Este separado de la mama de su hija, el es  responsable de los gastos escolares y manutención de su pequeña.
texts.en:
Hipólito is requesting the support of a loan to cover the cost of installing a main door in front of his home.  Owing to the lack of safety in his area, it is necessary to install the door and thereby keep his property safer.

Hipólito has been working as a store manager for one year.  He is separated from his daughter's mom but is responsible for his little one's education expenses and support.

loans.use: to install a main door in front of his home

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 57 años de edad, esta acompañado con dos hijos.

Él aprendo los trabajos de la agricultura, desde los 14 años de edad. Fue su padre quien le enseño, ya que era esta la manera en que se ganaban la vida.

Don Juan compra los insumos agrícolas en una ciudad del oriente del país, para esto el debe caminar a pie durante treinta minutos hasta llegar a la calle pavimentada, donde aborda un vehiculo (pick up) durante cuarenta minutos hasta llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos agrícolas.

Don Juan esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 12 sacos de abono, 80 libras de semilla, 15 litros de insecticidas, entre otros insumos para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz bajo riego  por gravedad (sistema a través del cual se dispersa el agua para regar los cultivo, sin usar dispositivos solo por la gravedad, se busca una pendiente para derramar el agua y que esta busque su cause, atravesando todo el cultivo).

Al comprar los insumos de una sola vez, don Juan estará seguro de dar a sus cultivos un manejo adecuado y a tiempo; esto permitirá que su producción aumente y también sus ingresos,  asegurando la alimentación de su familia y cancelar su préstamo a tiempo.

Don Juan espera proporcionarles el estudio a sus hijos, para que ellos estudien en la universidad y puedan graduarse.
texts.en:
Señor Juan is 57 years old and has 2 children.

He learned how to farm when he was 14 years old. He was taught by his father who made a living by farming.

Don Juan buys his consumables in a city to the west of the country. To get there he has to walk for 30 minutes to get to the paved highway where he boards a pick-up and travels 40 minutes to get to where he buys his agricultural supplies. 

Don Juan is asking Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy 12 sacks of manure, 80lbs of seed, 15 litres of insecticide and other items to allow him to sow 14,000 square metres of corn with a gravity watering system ( a watering system which disperses water to the crops without storage tanks using only gravity, as the water seeks to flow downhill naturally and so waters the entire crop).

By buying the items at the same time, Don Juan will be certain of providing his crops with adequate and timely care. This will give him a bigger yield and income and guarantee his being able to provide food for his family and make the repayment of his loan on time.

Don Juan hopes to provide his children with an education so that they are able to attend university and graduate.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of manure, 80lbs of seed, 15 litres of insecticide and other consumables.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: El señor José  vive en anticrético hace varios años, se dedica al transporte público, manejando el vehículo de su hijo, el crédito lo necesitan para comprar un carro de hamburguesas ya que quiere incursionar en la venta de hamburguesas ya que en la zona existe un complejo de canchas deportivas y es lleno de jóvenes todas las noches y el quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad y poner a la venta hamburguesas, salchipapas, es una persona luchadora, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señor José has lived in Anticrético for several years. He is a taxi driver and drives his son's vehicle. He needs the loan to buy a hamburger cart as he wants to start selling hamburgers. There is a sports complex in the vicinity which is full of young people every night and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity to sell hamburgers and salchipapas (a traditional sausage and chips dish). He is a determined person and is grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy a hamburger cart.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania, de 37 años, es una mujer entusiasta con ganas de progresar. Es madre soltera, vive con sus tres hijos de 17, 8 y 2 años en su casa propia. Ella es madre y padre, por lo que tiene que esmerarse día a día. El trabajo al que se dedica es la venta de bebidas tales como; gaseosa, yogurt, néctar, lo cual realiza en un espacio muy bien  acondicionado en su propio domicilio, siendo muy concurrido por sus vecinos. Esta actividad viene realizando hace un año, contando con el apoyo de su hija en la atención al público. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que ha logrado ser conocida en el lugar, gracias a ello tiene mayor clientela, y eso le genera ganancias, para así brindar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Nos comenta que tiene planes de implementar su negocio y seguir creciendo. Este será su cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, lo cual se siente contenta por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, y dice sentirse muy bien con su grupo por que son personas responsables. Con el préstamo solicitado, comprará variedades de bebidas como gaseosas, refrescos en mayor cantidad, así incrementará sus ganancias, y tener más acogida en su negocio.
texts.en:
37-year-old Tania is an enthusiastic woman who has a desire to make progress.  She is a single mother and lives with her three children, who are 17, 8 and 2 years old, in her own home.  She is both mother and father to her children and so she must try very hard every day.  Tania's business is selling drinks such as soda, yoghurt and nectars.  She carries out this work in a very well-adapted space in her own home which is very busy with neighbors.  She has been in this business for one year and has the support of her daughter in serving her customers.  What she likes about her work is that she has managed to become well known in her area, which means she has a lot of customers, which makes her profits, which enables her to provide her children with a better quality of life.  She tells us that she has plans to stock her business and continue growing.

This will be Tania's fourth loan from MFP.  She feels happy with the financial support that she has received and says that she feels very happy within her group because they are responsible people.  Tania will use the loan she has requested to buy a variety of drinks, such as sodas and soft drinks, in larger quantities.  This will increase her profits and her business will do better.

loans.use: to buy soda and soft drinks

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La señora Miriam vive en casa de su padre, su esposo es de nacionalidad Argentina ya que anteriormente Vivian en salta, el conyugue se dedica a la construcción, la señora Miriam hace un año que se dedica a la repostería y la elaboración de pan,  le va muy bien ya que antes solo se dedicaba a la venta de pan para otra señora, ahora elabora sus propios productos y cuenta con un mercado amplio mas que todo estas fiestas de todo santos ya que se elabora galletas y panes por cantidad para la venta y también  a pedido, hace que necesite insumos, por este motivo solicito el crédito para la compra de harina, huevo y levadura,  ya que es buena fecha para invertir y tener esta fecha ganancias extras, es una persona joven con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Señora Miriam lives in her father's house. Her husband is an Argentinian national as previously they lived in Salta. Her husband is in the construction industry. Señora Miriam has for the last year been making bread and pasteries. She is doing very well as previously she only sold bread for another lady but now she makes her own products and has an ample market. In addition, with all the saints' feast days, she makes biscuits and bread in quantity to sell and to order which means she needs ingredients. For this reason she is asking for a loan to buy flour, eggs and yeast as it is a good time of the year to invest and have extra income. She is a young person with a desire to succeed. She is grateful to the institution for the support given.

loans.use: to buy consumables such as flour, eggs and yeast to make dough.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa usada y también a la elaboración y venta de tacos, desde hace tres años. Apoyando de esta manera a su esposo quien trabaja de albañil en una construcción, con lo que solventan los gastos familiares. 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en comprar ropa de invierno y así tener más ganancias a su negocio. Y podrá darle es estudio necesaR. a su hijo.
texts.en:
Irma has been selling used clothing and making and selling tacos for three years.  This allows her to support her husband who works as a builder on  construction jobs.  This is how they cover their family expenses.

Irma is requesting a loan to invest in buying winter clothes so that she can make more profits from her business and be able to provide her son with the education he needs.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, and canned food.

loans.name: Luís Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Luís tiene 42 años de edad, esta acompañado con dos hijos.

Él aprendo los trabajos de la agricultura, desde los 15 años de edad. Fue su papá quien le enseño, ya que no podía darle el estudio para que fuera un profesional.

Don Luís debe caminar  a pie durante treinta minutos desde  su casa hasta la carretera, donde aborda un vehiculo (pick up) durante cuarenta minutos hasta llegar al lugar donde compra los insumos agrícolas.

Don Luís esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 6 sacos de abono, 40 libras de semilla de maíz, entre otros insumos para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz bajo riego  por gravedad (sistema a través del cual se dispersa el agua para regar los cultivo, sin usar dispositivos solo por la gravedad, se busca una pendiente para derramar el agua y que esta busque su cause, atravesando todo el cultivo).

Al comprar los insumos de una sola vez, don Luís ahorrara tiempo y dinero. Además estará seguro de dar a sus cultivos un manejo adecuado y a tiempo; esto permitirá que su producción aumente y también sus ingresos, ya que él vende el elote.

Don luís espera ahorrar de las ganancias resultado de la venta del maíz, para comprar dos bueyes, con los cuales podrá arar la tierra de otros agricultores y obtener otro ingreso, que le permita mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Luís is 42 years old and has 2 children.

He learned how to farm when he was 15 years old. His father taught him how to farm as he couldn't provide him with the education to become a professional.

Don Luís has to walk for 30 minutes from his house to the road where he boards a pick-up and travels for 40 minutes to where he buys his agricultural supplies.

Don Luís is asking Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy 6 sacks of manure, 40lbs of corn seed and other supplies to sow 7,000 square metres of land with corn under a gravity irrigation system ( an irrigation system which disperses water to irrigate the crops without using other devices only gravity, as the water seeks to flow downhill naturally and so waters the entire crop).

By buying the items at the same time, Don Luis will save both time and money. In addition, he will be certain of providing his crops with adequate and timely care. This will give him a bigger yield and income as he sells the corn.

Don Luís hopes to save from the resulting profits of selling the corn to buy 2 oxen with which to plough the land of other farmers and obtain another income which will enhance his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy 6 sacks of manure, 40lbs of corn seed and other supplies.

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es:
El señor José Armando comenta que su negocio esta funcionando muy bien, pero que sus clientes le están solicitando mas variedad de mercancía que a un no tiene. Es por eso que solicita el préstamo para invertir en más variedad de mercancía.
     Don José Armando a parte del ingreso que tiene de su negocio, es empleado de una fábrica en el área de producción, y quienes le ayudan atender el negocio son su esposa y una de sus hijas. 
Desea mejorar el ingreso de su negocio, la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José Armando tells us that his business is going very well but his customers are requesting a greater variety of merchandise which he does not have.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in a greater variety of merchandise.

In addition to the income he makes from his business, José Armando also works in a factory, in production.  His wife and one of his daughters help him to serve in his business.

José Armando would like to improve his income from his business and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his stationery store business

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ana Maria es una persona separada que mantiene ella sola a su familia que cuenta  de tres niñas, esta familia humilde se encuentra en la zona del Plan 3000,  a 1 hora del centro del la ciudad, la señora se dedica a la venta de comida para sacar adelante a sus hijas que se encuentran entrando a la adolescencia por lo que la tarea se le hace mas dificil a la señora, las niñas colaboran con su mama porque ella no tiene los recusros para contratar personal, ademas ella solicito el credito para la compra de mesas y sillas de su negocio puesto que las que tiene actualmente estan deterioradas y eso le esta alejando a su clientela y eso es lo peor que le podria pasarle en este momento de necesidad. Lo que la solicitante quiere es sacar adelante a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is separated from her husband and supports her family (three daughters) on her own.  This humble family lives in Plan 3000 district, one hour from the city center.  Ana Maria sells food in order to provide for her daughters.  Her daughters are becoming adolescents which makes her job more difficult.  The girls help their mom because she doesn't have enough money to hire staff.  

Ana Maria requested this loan to buy tables and chairs for her business because those which she has right now are worn and this is losing her customers which is the worst that could happen to her during this moment of need.  What she would like is to get her daughters ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her food stall business

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es:
Desde hace 15 años Maria Ester se dedica a la confección directa junto a su esposo e hija trabaja día a día con la ilusión de sacar su negocio adelante y responder por los pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, su principal labor es la confección de uniformes y delantales para restaurantes y peluquerías, a sus 54 años de edad sueña con ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia, y mejorar los ingresos del hogar.

Con la motivación de cumplir sus sueños, hoy Maria Ester solicita un préstamo, el cual invertirá en compra de materia prima para la confección al por mayor, como: Hilos, telas y otros insumos básicos para realizar las prendas con la mayor calidad posible, pues así las utilidades serán mayores y su calidad de vida se verá altamente beneficiada.
texts.en:
For 15 years, Maria Ester has been sewing garments direct.  Together with her husband and daughter, she works every day with the hope of making progress in her business and filling the orders that her customers place with her.  Her main task is making uniforms and aprons for restaurants and hairdressing salons.  At 54 years of age, Maria Ester dreams of offering her family a better future and improving her household income.

With the motivation of achieving her dreams, Maria Ester is requesting a loan which she will invest in buying raw materials for sewing items to sell wholesale, such as threads, fabric and other basic supplies which she uses to make garments of the best possible quality.  This will increase her profits and her quality of life will be greatly benefited.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making garments (threads, fabric, etc.)

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 68 años, es una mujer luchadora, alegre y dinámica. Es viuda desde ya varios años, vive en su casa propia con su hija mayor de 39 años de edad y su nieto a los cuales quiere mucho, son la inspiración de seguir adelante. El trabajo que realiza Luz consiste en la venta de comida, como tallarines, arroz chaufa, pollos asado y demás, lo cual realiza en el frontis de su propia casa, en un lugar que implementó. Dicha actividad  viene realizando desde hace nueve años, iniciándose con la ayuda de su esposo antes que muriera, actualmente cuenta con la ayuda de su hija en los labores de la cocina. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da un ingreso económico diario, le permite satisfacer sus necesidades, además de socializar con las personas y mantenerse ocupada. Lo que no le gusta es que los precios de los productos no son estables y cada día están en la alza, reduciendo su ganancias. Desea seguir creciendo y ampliar su negocio. Este será el cuatro crédito con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el grupo que está trabajando porque son personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos en cantidad para la elaboración de comida, como: como arroz, aceites, fideos.
texts.en: 68-year-old Luz is a tenacious, cheerful and dynamic woman. She has been a widow for several years. She lives in her own home together with her eldest daughter, who is 39 years old, and her grandson, who she loves very much. They are her inspiration to get ahead. Luz's business is selling food such as tagliatelle, arroz chaufa (Peruvian fried rice), barbecued chicken and other dishes. She makes her sales from out the front of her own home in a space which she set up for the purpose. She has been in this business for nine years. She started out with the help of her husband before he died. She currently has the help of her daughter in cooking her dishes. What Luz likes about her work is that it gives her a daily income which allows her to cover her needs. She also gets to socialize with people and keep busy. What she doesn't like about her work is that product prices are not stable and are always on the rise, which reduces her profits. Luz would like to continue growing and expanding her business. This will be Luz's fourth loan from MFP and she feels happy with the group she is working with because they are responsible people. Luz will use the sum she has requested to buy products in bulk for making her food such as rice, oil and noodles.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and noodles

loans.name: José Leonardo

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 40 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos.

Él  tiene 12 años de experiencia en su taller de reparación de bicicletas, él aprendió el oficio de tanto reparar su bicicleta y hoy en día atiende su negocio junto a sus hijos.

Don José aborda un vehiculo (pick up) en su comunidad y viaja durante cuarenta y cinco minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad donde compra los repuestos.

Don José esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar repuestos como: llantas, tubos, simples, centros, válvulas, entre otros. En mayor cantidad y lograr precios más bajos, para obtener un margen de ganancia mayor. Él tiene una gran demanda y con la inversión tendrá disponible los repuestos que más buscan sus clientes y que estos se sientan satisfechos con el servicio brindado por José. A la vez que se estaría ahorrando tiempo y dinero, ya que el viaje es bastante largo hasta llegar donde compra los repuestos.

José espera ampliar su negocio, para asegurar que sus hijos sean profesionales cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old, married and has three children.  He has 12 years’ experience with his bicycle repair shop.  He learned this occupation from repairing his own bicycle so much and today he tends to his business alongside his children.

José boards his vehicle (pick-up truck) and drives forty minutes from his community to the city where he buys spare parts.  José is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to buy spare parts like: tires, inner tubes, axels, cores and valves, among others in larger amounts so that he can qualify for lower prices and earn higher profits.  

He has high demand and the investment will make it possible for him to have the spare parts his customers most want on hand and they will feel satisfied with the service José’s provides.  He would also save time and money because the trip to buy the parts is quite long.  José hopes to expand the business to insure that his children become professionals when they grow up.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts.

loans.name: Ricardo Candelario

texts.es: El Señor Ricardo titular de este crédito desea mejorar sus ingresos abasteciendo de manera más surtida el kiosco de dulces, cigarrillos y refrescos, porque este es el medio para subsistencia tanto de él como de su familia. Es padre de 2 hijos y además se hace cargo de los hijos de su pareja quien debido a un accidente, se encuentra en recuperación. La hermana de su cónyuge al ver la necesidad y además valorando el sacrificio de Ricardo es que le alquila el Kiosco que se encuentra en un lugar bastante estratégico por la afluencia de gente que hace su compra al paso. Los días que su hijo mayor Leo; no tiene escuela; Ricardo también trabaja como albañil, pues así contribuye para la economía de su hogar. El solo espera que sus hijos sean hombres de bien por lo que insiste en darles buena educación y en lo posible darles todo lo que ellos necesitan. Su hijo mayor tiene 16 años el segundo tiene 12 años, y los pequeños son de 6 y 4 años. El hijo mayor también tiene su aporte en la familia pues él se hace cargo de la supervisión de sus hermanos pequeños mientras su padre está en su fuente de trabajo. Durante la  evaluación del crédito pude conocer a la cónyuge del Sr Ricardo, ella se llama Patricia, quien está en etapa de recuperación por una caída que sufrió, estuvo por más de un año en tratamiento médico pues se encontraba inconsciente, ahora sin embargo el proceso de su recuperación es totalmente favorable. Hay días que ella también baja al kiosco para acompañar a Ricardo de manera que pueda distraerse y ayudar a su recuperación. Ella trata de colaborar en el Kiosquito.
texts.en:
Ricardo, the man who is requesting this loan, would like to improve his income by better stocking his kiosk where he sells candies, cigarettes and soft drinks as this is how he supports himself and his family.  Ricardo has two children and also takes care of the children of his partner who had an accident and is in recovery.  It was his partner's sister who, seeing the need and also valuing the sacrifice that Ricardo was making, hired the kiosk which is located in quite a strategic location owing to the large number of people who purchase things from it as they pass by.  On days when his eldest son Leo doesn't have school, Ricardo also works as a builder so that he can further contribute towards his household finances.

Ricardo hopes for his sons to become fine, upstanding young men and so he insists in providing them with a good education and, so far as he can, provides them with everything they need.  His eldest son is 16 years old and his second is 12 years old.  The little ones are 6 and 4.  His eldest son also contributes towards the family as he looks after his young siblings while his father is working.  During the loan evaluation, I was able to meet Ricardo's partner, Patricia, who is recovering from a fall that she suffered.  She was receiving medical treatment for more than a year as she was found unconscious.  Now, however, her recovery process is completely favorable.  There are days when she also goes down to the kiosk to accompany Ricardo so that she can occupy herself and aid her own recovery.  She tries to help out with the small kiosk.

loans.use: to have working capital for his business selling candies, cookies, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for her vehicle

loans.name: Santos Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Santos tiene 34 años de edad, es casado con dos hijos.

Él aprendo la agricultura, desde los 10 años de edad. Fue su papá quien le enseño, ya que no tenían un empleo fijo y son varios hermanos. Por lo que encontraron en la agricultura un medio de subsistencia y un modo de vida. Él actualmente siembra maíz con riego por gravedad (sistema a través del cual se dispersa el agua para regar los cultivo, sin usar dispositivos solo por la gravedad, se busca una pendiente para derramar el agua y que esta busque su cause, atravesando todo el cultivo) ya que es época seca, aunque cuando llueve manifiesta don Santos tienen perdidas por inundaciones, ya que el agua es poca profunda.

Don Santos camina a pie durante quince minutos desde  su casa hasta la carretera principal, donde aborda un autobús durante treinta minutos hasta llegar a la ciudad donde compra los insumos agrícolas.

Don Santos esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 12 sacos de fertilizantes, 80 libras de semilla de maíz, entre otros insumos para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, los cuales vende en elote bajo riego  por gravedad.

Al comprar los insumos de una sola vez, don Santos consigue precios más bajos y evita viajar tanto a comprar por poquitos. Además estará seguro de dar a sus cultivos un manejo adecuado y a tiempo; esto permitirá que su producción aumente y también sus ingresos.

Don santos trabajara fuerte, para construir una casa de ladrillo, ya que actualmente vive en una de adobe y sin habitaciones.
texts.en:
Santos is 34 years old.  He is married and has two children.

Santos learned to farm when he was 10 years old.  It was his dad who taught him because they didn't have a regular job and he has several siblings.  In farming, they found a way of making a living and a way of life.  Santos currently sows corn with a gravity irrigation system as it is the dry season (a system through which water for irrigating the crops doesn't need any mechanisms, just gravity.  A slope is found for the water to run down and find its level, watering all the crops). However, when it rains, Santos says that they lose crops through flooding as the water is not very deep.

Santos walks for fifteen minutes from his house to the main road where he boards a bus which takes thirty minutes to get to the city where he buys his farming supplies.

Santos is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo so that he can buy 12 sacks of fertilizer, 80 pounds of corn seed, and other supplies that he needs to sow 14,000 square meters of corn which he waters with a gravity irrigation system and sells on the cob.

By purchasing his supplies all in one go, Santos obtains lower prices and avoids having to travel to buy in small amounts.  In addition, he will be certain that he can give his crops the care they need, when they need it.  This will allow his production to increase and also his income.

Santos will work hard to build a house from brick as he currently lives in a house made from adobe which doesn't have internal room divisions.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer, 80 pounds of corn seed and other supplies he needs to sow 14,000 square meters of corn

loans.name: Manuel José

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad Manuel José es un emprendedor dedicado a la recolección de empaques, específicamente costales, esta labor la desempeña en su moto, logrando una mejor cobertura y optimizando los tiempos de transporte y comercialización.

Actualmente genera 2 empleos, y con la ilusión de seguir progresando quiere comprar otra moto que le permita tener mas capacidad de recolección y comercialización, igualmente podrá generar otro empleo, ayudar más con los gastos del hogar, y mejorar la difícil situación económica. Sin embardo Manuel José no cuenta con el capital necesario para la compra de la moto por lo que solicita un préstamo, que le ayude a su negocio a mejorar el transporte de los empaques, recolectarlos, y posteriormente comercializarlos, mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida proporcionalmente.
texts.en:
At 63 years of age, Manuel José is an entrepreneur who works collecting packing materials, specifically sacks.  He carries out this work on his motorbike which allows him to cover a larger area and optimize his transportation and sales times.

Manuel José currently creates two jobs and, with the hope of continuing to make progress, he would like to buy another motorbike which would allow him to enjoy a greater collection and sales capacity.  He will also be able to create another job, help more with his household expenses and improve his difficult economic situation.  However, Manuel José does not have the capital he needs to buy a motorbike and so he is requesting a loan which will help his business to improve in the transportation, collection and later sale of packing materials.  This will improve his income and his quality of life proportionally.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for transporting sacks

loans.name: Oscar Rene

texts.es:
¡Saludos desde Honduras! Le presento Oscar. El señor Oscar tiene 31 años y vive en la aldea de Callejas en el departamento Cortes. Oscar es soltero sin hijos y vive sólo. 

Hace 3 años puso una pulpería. Anteriormente en su pueblo de origen, Oscar se dedicaba a la agricultura. Se motivó con poner una pulpería para superarse económicamente y tener su propio negocio. Empezó vendiendo chicle y, poco a poco, se fue ampliando sus productos hasta poner la pulpería. Hoy en día vende granos básicos y productos de la canasta básica como frijoles, arroz, azúcar, cafe y refrescos. Trabaja 9 horas al día atendiendo a su clientela. Nota que cuando los precios de los productos de la canasta básica suben, sus ventas caen. 

Ha solicitado un crédito de L15,000 para abastecer su inventario con productos como refrescos, arroz y azúcar: todo lo que compone la canasta básica. Espera que con su primer crédito va a fortalecer su negocio lo más posible y hacerlo crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Greetings from Honduras!  Let me introduce you to Oscar.  Señor Oscar is 31 years old, and lives in the village of Callejas in the department of Cortes.  Oscar is single with no children, and lives on his own.

Three years ago, he opened a general store.  Previously, in the village he is from originally, Oscar worked in agriculture.  His motivation in opening his general store was to get ahead financially and to have his own business.  He began by selling chewing gum, and little by little he was able to expand his products until he had the general store.  Today he sells basic grains and everyday products, such as beans, rice, sugar, coffee and sodas.  He works 9 hours a day serving his customers.  He notes that when prices of everyday products go up, his sales fall.

He has requested a loan for L15,000 to stock up his inventory with products such as sodas, rice and sugar; everything that makes up basic grocery requirements.  He hopes that with his first loan, he will be able to strengthen his business to the greatest degree possible, and achieve financial growth.

loans.use: to purchase sodas, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Tania Judith

texts.es:
La señora Tania,  es casada  tiene dos hermosas hijas, viven en la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba.
Tania se dedica a trabajar en la magisterio de profesora conjuntamente con su esposo ellos por motivos de trabajo vinieron desde muy lejos. Ahora ellos están iniciando su trabajo en un lugar muy lejano de su lugar de origen, como están iniciando no les alcanza el salario que tienen.    
Tania  es muy querida y respetada en el pueblo de Mizque, por lo que se dedicada a su  trabajo y sus dos  pequeñas hijas, ella está solicitando el crédito para   comprarse un horno industrial para ayudarse en los ingresos económicos que tiene y así  aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar su condición de vida que llevan al realizar trabajos de panadería en lo que también tiene experiencia.  El crédito ayudara mucho en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Tania is married and has two beautiful daughters.  They live together in Mizque province, in Cochabamba department.  

Tania works in the teaching profession together with her husband.  For work reasons, they both came here from very far away.  Now they are starting work in a place which is a very long way from their home town.  As they are just starting out, their salaries are not enough.

Tania is very well liked and respected in the small town of Mizque because of her commitment to her work and her two young daughters.  She is requesting this loan to buy an industrial oven to help her increase her income and improve her living conditions, by carrying out bakery work which is an area in which she also has experience.  This loan will help her a lot in the hard work that she carries out.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven for carrying out bakery work

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 40 años, es una mujer carismática, emprendedora. Vive en compañía de su pareja y de sus tres hijos de 17, 10 y 3 años en su casa propia. El trabajo que realiza Marleni es la elaboración de pan, para lo cual cuenta con un  horno ubicado en la casa de su madre, en un ambiente apropiado para la elaboración de pan. Tiene cinco meses realizando esta actividad, tiempo suficiente para ser conocida dentro de su localidad. Para dicha actividad cuenta con la ayuda de un empleado, que le ayuda en la elaboración de la masa, y de su hija para la venta. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da un ingreso económico, que le permite saciar sus necesidades, y dar una buena educación a sus hijos. Sin embargo, se requiere de mucho esfuerzo para hacer este trabajo, pero eso no la desanima y nos comenta que espera seguir creciendo y construir su propio horno. Este será el tercer crédito con la institución MFP, se siente feliz por formar parte de un grupo responsable. Con el préstamo solicitado de 600 soles, comprará materiales para la elaboración de pan como harina, manteca, levadura y demás al por mayor.
texts.en:
40-year-old Marleni is a charismatic and entrepreneurial woman.  She lives together with her partner and three children, who are 17, 10 and 3, in her own home.  Marleni's business is making bread.  She has an oven located in her mother's house, in an environment which is suitable for making bread.  She has been in this business for five months, enough time for her to become well known in her town.  In her business, she has the help of one employee who helps her make the dough.  Her daughter also helps her make her sales. 

What Marleni likes about her work is that it gives her an income which allows her to meet her needs and provide her children with a good education.  However, it requires a lot of effort to do this work.  This does not discourage her though and she tells us that she hopes to continue growing and to build her own oven.

This will be Marleni's third loan from MFP.  She feels happy to be part of a responsible group.  She will use her loan for 600 soles to buy supplies for making bread such as flour, butter and yeast, wholesale.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and yeast

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: El Sr. Hugo se dedica al transporte publico, vive en alquiler recientemente enviudo, fue un golpe para el cuenta el sr, ya que perdió a su compañera con la que compartió muchos momentos y todavía le da nostalgia su partida, vive con una sobrina en la casa, el crédito lo necesita para poder reparar el motor de su vehículo mismo que ya esta terminando de pagar. Trabaja en la parada de un hospital de la ciudad de Cochabamba es cofundador de ese sindicato, es una persona muy amable y se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo.
texts.en:
Hugo provides a public transport service.  He lives in rental accommodation and was recently widowed.  This was a blow for the gentleman as he lost his partner with whom he had shared many moments and his loss still fills him with nostalgic longing.  He now lives with a niece.  

Hugo needs this loan so that he can repair his vehicle's engine.  He has already finished paying for his vehicle.  He works on a taxi stand at a hospital in the city of Cochabamba and is a co-founder of his union.  He is a very kind person and is grateful to the institution for their support.

loans.use: to repair his engine

loans.name: Orlando Jose

texts.es:
Orlando su oficio es taxista, padre de familia, tiene planes mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda ya que en algunas partes de ella están en mal estado. Con el préstamo anterior logro darle mantenimiento a su vehículo, el cual es su medio de trabajo y fuente de ingreso. 
El motor del auto ha presentado fallas muy graves las cuales requieren de cambio por completo. Con el préstamo comprara los siguientes repuestos a cambiar: bielas, bancadas, anillos std, pistones std, camisas s/f, guías válvulas, empaques del motor entre otros para  elaborar lo que se le llama overjoll, el desarme y el arme del motor. También la calibración y rectificación de los asientos. 
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo al mejoramiento de su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando works as a taxi driver, is the head of a family, and his dream is to make improvements to his housing because some parts of it are in poor condition. With his last loan he was able to give maintenance to his car, which he uses for work and is his source of income. 

The engine of the car is seriously in need of work and requires a complete change. With this loan he will buy rods, work benches, piston rings, pistons standard, S/F sleeves, valve guides, engine gaskets and other necessary items to complete an overhaul, disassembling, and reassembling the engine. He also needs to make adjustments to the  calibration.

He is grateful to the community bank for the support that improves his standard of living.

loans.use: to overhaul his engine

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Oscar tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y cuatro hijos de 8, 10, 12 y 14 años de edad respectivamente. Él es una persona trabajadora, que toda su vida ha trabajado en la agricultura y ganadería, estas actividades las aprendió gracias a su papá, quien le enseño la manera de ganarse la vida honradamente, a pesar de su grado académico, Oscar a puesto todo de su parte para superarse y también forma parte de un comité que le ha fortalecido sus conocimientos educativos.

El préstamo que solicita Oscar, será invertido en la compra de dos vacas lecheras, con el objetivo de tener una fuente de ingresos y la otra parte la empleara en la compra de una achicadora para riego de la agricultura en verano. Debido a que Oscar tiene los residuos de la cosecha de invierno, quiere comprar ganado para aprovechar el pasto y obtener ganancias de la venta de la leche. De esta manera Oscar continuara trabajando en lo que siempre ha realizado y generar ingresos extra que le ayude a él y a su familia.

Con esos ingresos, él desea terminar de construir su casa que tiene las paredes y le falta el techo, ese es su mayor deseo el tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Oscar is 36 years old.  He lives with his life partner and his four children who are 8, 10, 12 and 14 years old.  Oscar is a hard-working person who has worked in farming and livestock raising his whole life.  He learned these businesses from his dad, who showed him how to earn an honest living.  In spite of his academic level, Oscar has worked hard to improve himself.  He is a member of a committee which has strengthened his educational skills.

The loan that Oscar is requesting will be invested in buying two dairy cows with the aim of creating a source of income.  The rest will be used to buy a small water pump for watering his crops in the summer.  As Oscar has waste left over from his winter harvest, he would like to buy cattle so that he can make the most of the pasture and make profits from selling their milk.  In this way, Oscar will continue working, doing what he has always done, and will make extra income which will help him and his family.  With this income, he would like to finish building his house which has walls but still lacks a roof.  Owning his own home is his biggest wish.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Yeris Antonio

texts.es: Yaris estudia Derecho, dentro de algunos años se mira trabajando en una institución pública del estado, espera apoyar y mejorar la atención al público que hace uso de éstas instituciones. Su amyor inspiración es su madre porque siempre me apoyaba y me impulsaba a salir adelante. Es una persona responsable con ética y principios morlaes. Ha tenido dificultad para costearse sus estudios y ya a la finalización de los mismos solicita el préstamo para pagar los módulos del curso de titulación
texts.en: Yaris is studying law.  In a few years time he sees himself working in a public state institution.  He hopes to support and improve the service provided to members of the public who use these institutions.
