His biggest inspiration is his mother because "she always supported me and encouraged me to do well".  Yaris is a responsible person with ethics and moral principles.  He has found it difficult to pay for his studies and, now that he is at the end of his studies, he is requesting a loan to pay for his degree.

loans.use: to pay to obtain his degree

loans.name: Lideres De Villa Rica Group

texts.es: La Sra. Yanina   es casada, tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Lideres de Villa Ricra” grupo  conformado por 10 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Yanina trabaja desde hace  3 años en la venta de productos de belleza a domicilio este negocio surge con la idea de obtener mejore ingresos ya que Yanina nos cuenta que empezo con un capital de S/. 200 soles y compro algunos productos de belleza, hoy en dia tiene clientes fidelizados. y cada dia su negocio es mas rentable, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicacion  ha logrado mejores ingresos economicos y su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería Lapiz labial, cremas, esmalte etc , Sabemos que Yanina  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Yanina is married and has one school-age child.  She is currently a member of the "Líderes de Villa Ricra" community bank.  This group has ten members who work in different commercial activities.  Yanina has been selling beauty products from home for three years.  This business came about because she wanted to make better income.  Yanina tells us that she started out with 200 soles in capital and bought some beauty products.  Today she has loyal customers and her business becomes more profitable every day.  Thanks to her effort and commitment, she has managed to improve her income and her family enjoys a better quality of life.  In order to continue growing, she has requested a new loan to buy merchandise such as lipsticks, creams, nail polish, etc.  We know that Yanina will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work and effort, and that Edaprospo's loans will help her.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es:
Felicidad es una persona muy joven ella vive en la  comunidad de la provincia Mizque del departamento  de Cochabamba, felicidad desde muy pequeña quedo sola su madre y su pequeña hermanita fallecieron en un accidente de movilidad su padre le dio una pequeña parcela de terreno agrícola para que ella haga trabajar  donde ella empezó a trabajar en la agricultura con sus vecinos en el  lugar donde vive  ahí fue donde ha aprendiendo a cultivar tomate y cebolla en el tiempo que creció.
En el lugar donde vive solo cosechan dos veces al año con el esfuerzo de su trabajo y con el  crédito que está solicitando ella desea invertir más en sus cultivos comprando abono orgánico  y productos para recuperar algo de lo perdido de su anterior cosecha que fueron por motivo de sequia  y de esta manera mejorar su  calidad de vida y ayudarles a sus hermanos menores.
texts.en: Felicidad is a very young person who lives in a community in Mizque province, in Cochabamba department.  Felicidad was left alone when she was very young as her mother and her little sister died in a traffic accident.  Her father gave her a small plot of farmland to work.  She started farming with her neighbors in her community.  This is where she learned to grow tomatoes and onions as she grew up.  Where Felicidad lives, crops are only harvested twice a year.  Through her hard work and the loan that she is requesting, Felicidad would like to invest more in her crops, buying organic fertilizer and other products so that she can recover some of what she lost in her previous harvest as a result of a drought.  In this way, she will improve her quality of life and help her younger siblings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and supplies for sowing her crops

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel,  es una persona joven, viven en la comunidad de Mayra de la  provincia de Mizque del departamento de Cochabamba.
Esta época por el desastre natural de la sequia su pequeña parcela de cebolla no maduro bien, este desastre le hizo fracasar en sus ingresos económicos que el percibía para sobrevivir en esta vida ya que sus papas no se encuentran juntamente con y el y solo tiene que auto mantenerse. 
Gabriel es una persona joven  muy querida y respetada en el lugar donde vive, por lo dedicada a su trabajo,  como la agricultura son épocas estacionales en sus tiempos libres se dedica a trabajar en atención de gomería Gabriel está solicitando el crédito para   comprar abonos  y semillas para mejorar sus cultivos  y aumentar su producción para mejorar sus ingreso económico y  tener  asi una mejor calidad de vida.  El crédito ayudara mucho a Gabriel en el duro trabajo que realiza.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a young person. He lives in the community of Mayra, of the province of Mizque, of the departament of Cochabamba.
This season, due to the natural disaster of a drought, his small plot of onions didn't grow properly. This disaster made him fail to get the income he used to get to get by in life. His parents aren't a live anymore and he has to support himself.   

Gabriel is a young man who is loved and respected in the place where he lives. He is dedicated to his work, agriculture in season and in his free time, he works in tire repair. Gabriel is asking for the loan to buy fertilizer and seed to improve his crops and increase his production in order to increase his earnings and have a better quality of life. The loan will really help Gabriel in the hard work that he does.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and feed for his agricultural activity.

loans.name: María Holanda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María, tiene 49 años de edad está casada y de  esta relación tiene tres hijos dos mayores y el menor de 17 años, dos de ellos aun viven en su casa y estudian en Universidad y en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio y con esto contribuir para sacar adelante a su familia, él se dedica a la venta de pescado, para lo cual tiene un puesto en el mercado en el cual vende al por mayor y al menudeo a las personas que día a día llegan hasta este lugar para abastecerse de productos para el sustento diario, él trabaja todos los días, desde la madrugada él se desplaza hasta las playas para comprar directo a los pescadores y luego llevar a dicho mercado donde distribuye sus productos, lleva más de 20 años en este negocio y siempre le ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pago del grupo y le gusta por los beneficios que le ha dado la institución.
 
Su sueño es comprar un camión para transportar sus productos ya que alquilan transporte todos los días.
texts.en:
The María Del Carmen communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton (Portoviejo). This is where the famous toquilla straw hats are from. The city has a cool climate with a lot of natural tourist attractions unique to the area. 

Here we meet María. She is 49 years old, married and has three children. Two are grown and the youngest is 17. Two of them live at home and go to college and high school. Her husband is a merchant.  
 
She is taking out this loan to help her husband with his business and to contribute to getting her family ahead. He sells fish, and has a stall in the market where he sells wholesale and retail to people who go to his place every day to get his products for their daily use. He works every day. Before dawn he goes to the beach to buy directly from the fisherman and later he goes to the market where he distributes his products. He has been in this business for more than 20 years, and it has always gone well for him.

This loan is to buy fish. Since the communal bank started, she has been the payment treasurer for the group and she likes it because of the benefits the institution has given her.
 
Her dream is to buy a truck to transport their products, since they rent transportation every day.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris, de 34 años, es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora con ganas de superación. Es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos a quienes quiere mucho y se esmera siempre por darles lo mejor. Vive en su casa propia, inmueble que construyo con mucho sacrificio. El trabajo que realiza Iris es la compra y venta de productos lácteos, tales como queso, yogurt. Tiene tres años vendiendo de manera ambulante, dedicándose íntegramente y contando con el apoyo de sus hijos para la venta de los productos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que genera ingresos económicos, gracias a ello puede mantener la economía de su hogar, darles una buena educación a sus hijos, y conocer nuevas personas.  Lo que no le gusta es que tiene que caminar demasiado para la venta de sus productos. Espera poder crecer su negocio y tener un local donde expender su mercadería. Este será el cuarto crédito con la institución MFP, se siente muy contenta de integrar en un grupo de personas responsables, y esta comprometida en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos lácteos al por mayor para que obtenga una rebaja, ya que así tendrá más ganancias.
texts.en:
Iris, 32, is a fighter and an entrepreneur who is driven to succeed. She is a single mother with 4 children she loves very much. She takes great pains to offer them the best. She lives in her own home, a house she sacrificed a lot to build. 

Iris’s work is purchasing and selling dairy products, such as cheese and yogurt. She has sold as a peddler for three years. She works with integrity and with the help of her children to sell the products. What she likes about her work is that it brings her an income, allowing her to pay for the family’s expenses, give her children a good education, and meet new people. What she doesn’t like is that she has to walk too much to sell her products. She hopes to grow her business and have a place where she can sell her merchandise. 

This will be her fourth loan with the MFP institution. She is very pleased to be a member of a group of responsible people. She commits to being punctual with the repayment of the loan. With the amount requested, she will purchase wholesale dairy products so that she can have a discount, and this way, earn more money.

loans.use: purchase wholesale dairy products

loans.name: Elsa Diocelina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Elsa, tiene 51 años de edad, hace varios años su esposos falleció pero de esta relación tuvo tres hijos, los mismos que ya son  mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun vive con ella.
 
Ella para ganarse la vida y el sustento diario con sus pocos recursos que tenia puso en su casa una pequeña tienda de comestibles, la misma que empezó con muy poco y que ahora gracias a los créditos ha podido ir aumentándola y surtiéndola con el paso de los días, trabaja todos los días  desde las  6h00 que empieza a atender a sus clientes y cierra casi a las 20h00, este negocio a mas de darle para su sustento también le brinda distracción ya que allí puede conversar con las personas que llegan hasta su local, lleva con su negocio por más de cinco años y le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo quiere invertir en comprar más productos para aumentar su tienda va a comprar arroz, azúcar, carnes, pescado y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace más de 4 años y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una tienda mucho más grande.
texts.en:
The Maria del Carmen Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Canton Montecristi (Portoviejo), the place of origin of the famous 'Panama hats' – a city of fresh climate and with many natural tourist attractions in the zone.

Here we meet Elsa, aged 51. Her husband died several years ago. However, from this union came 3 children, all of whom are now adults but 2 still live with her.

To earn her living and daily sustenance, despite her limited resources, Elsa opened a small grocery store in her house. She began with very little and, now, thanks to previous loans, she has been able to expand the store, better supplying it over the passage of time. Elsa works every day from 6:00 am, when she begins to attend to customers, until closing at 8:00 pm. More than providing her basic sustenance, the store offers distraction, for here she can converse with people who visit the store. She has run the business for more than 5 years and it's going well.

Elsa needs this loan to purchase products to expand her store. She will buy rice, sugar, meat, fish and other products of primary necessity. Elsa has belonged to her communal bank for more than 4 years and she likes it because it makes her loans possible.

Elsa's dream is to have a much larger store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, meat, fish and other products of primary necessity for her grocery store.

loans.name: María Del Pilar

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María,  tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 17 y  15 años de edad, ambos estudian en colegio. Su esposo es ebanista. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal, es la secretaria del grupo y le gusta por la ayuda que les dan con los créditos.

Ella realiza el crédito para ayudar a su esposo en el negocio, el cual tiene un taller de ebanistería donde realiza variedad de productos elaborados con la madera y que las elabora bajo pedido de sus clientes, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo le ayuda cuando está desocupado y tiene que entregar alguna obra. El tiene más de 10 años con su negocio y nunca le ha faltado trabajo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pintura, pega, clavos y otros materiales útiles para realizar su trabajo.
 
Su sueño  seguir adelante con su negocio y que no falte trabajo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'María del Carmen' community bank meet in Montecristi canton (Portoviejo).  This is the home of the famous Panama hat.  It is a cold-climate city with many natural tourist attractions in the area.  

Here we meet María.  She is 38 years old, married, and has two children from this relationship who are 17 and 15 years old.  They are both in school.  Her husband is a furniture maker.  María has been a member of her community bank from the beginning and is the group's secretary.  She likes it for the help that she receives through the loans.

María is taking out a loan to help her husband in his business.  Her husband has a furniture-making workshop where he makes a variety of products from wood.  He makes his products to order for his customers.  He works every day, from 8.00am to 5.00pm, and sometimes until even later.  His son helps him when he is free and he has work to deliver.  He has been in this business for more than 10 years and has never been short of work.  This loan will be used to buy wood, paint, adhesive, nails and other materials he needs to carry out his work.  His dream is to continue making progress in the business and to always have work.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, adhesive, nails, etc.

loans.name: Santa

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Santa, tiene 45 años de edad está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya  mayores y el ultimo  de 11 años que estudian en colegio, tres de ellos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio y con esto contribuir de alguna forma  a sacar adelante a su familia, él se dedica a la venta de pescado, tres veces por semana  en la madrugada él se desplaza hasta las playas  para comprar el mejor pescado a pescadores que llegan hasta este lugar, luego de limpiarlos los envía a la ciudad de Quito lugar donde vive un hermano que es quien se encarga de vender allá. Llevan 8 años en este negocio y les ha ido bien  ya que cada día tienen más clientes.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses y con esto se ayudan mucho. 

Su sueño es comprar un camión para llevar el pescado en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
The María Del Carmen Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Portoviejo in the Montecristi Cantón, a city with a refreshing climate and many natural tourist attractions nearby, as well as home to famous straw hats.

In this place we meet Santa, who is 45 years old, and married with four children. Three of her children are grown, and the youngest is eleven years old and goes to school. Three of her children still live at home. Her husband is a merchant.

She is requesting the loan to help her husband with his business, and in this way contribute somehow to help their family get ahead. He sells fish. Three times a week, he goes down to the beach in the early morning to purchase the best fish from the fishermen who dock there. Later he cleans the fish and sends them to Quito, where his brother, who lives there, is in charge of selling them there. They have spent eight years running this business, and it has done well for them, especially since every day they have more customers.

This loan is for purchasing fish. Santa has been with the Communal Bank since the beginning and she is happy because the loans are offered at very low interest rates, and this helps very much. Her dream is to purchase a truck to be able to transport a larger quantity of fish.

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Son integrantes del comité San Antonio mujeres muy sacrificadas con el deseo de superación.  En total son 13 mujeres que pretenden mejorar su calidad de vida, a través del trabajo,  están motivadas en sus actividades con el deseo y logro de mejorar sus ingresos.
La señora Maria se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, ella vende empanadas, sandwish, tortillas, etc. Por medio de este trabajo ella logra sacar adelante a su familia y también cubrir los gastos que diariamente surgen en el trabajo.  Nos comenta que tiene muchos deseos de poder seguir creciendo con esto y es por ello que solicita el crédito, el cual desea invertirlo en la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, panificados y otros ingredientes que pueda necesitar para elaborar sus alimentos.
Ella al igual que sus compañeras está agradecida por la ayuda de la fundación y de Kiva.
texts.en:
These are the members of the San Antonio Group. They are women who make many sacrifices with a desire to improve their lives. In total, there are thirteen women who would like to improve their quality of life through work, and are motivated by their efforts with the desire to realize increased revenues.
Maria sells many kinds of foods. She sells empanadas, sandwiches, tortillas, etc. As a result of this work, she has managed to help her family get ahead, and also to cover the daily costs that her work incurs. She tells us that she hopes very much to be able to continue growing with her business, and it is for this reason that she is requesting the loan. She wishes to invest it by purchasing meat, vegetables, condiments, breads, and other ingredients that she might need while making her foods.
Just like her colleagues, Maria is grateful for the help of the Foundation and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase meat, vegetables, condiments, breads, and other ingredients.

loans.name: La Union Es Progreso - Cajas Group

texts.es:
La Señora NICOLASA, tiene 55 años D. edad, casada, tienes 03 hijos menores D. edad, mujer muy trabajadora con entusiasmo. Es integrante D. la Alcancía Comunal "LA UNION ES PROGRESO- CAJAS”.   

Ella tiene una bodega alquilada que venD. bebidas, azúcar, arroz, aceites, verduras, etc.
El préstamo solicitó para abastecer con más productos e implementar su bodega, En el futuro desea comprarse su terreno y construir su casa.

Se esfuerza mucho para que pueda dar una buena calidad D. vida a su hijo. La socia  viste con chompa color plomo y sobrero está ubicado lado izquierda,  a lado D. la socia que viste D. polo color rojo.
texts.en:
Nicolasa is 55 years old and married with three children under the age of eighteen. She is a hard-working, enthusiastic woman, and is a member of the Communal  Bank “La Unión es Progreso – Cajas” [Unity is Progress – Banks].

She has a grocery store that she rents where she sells drinks, sugar, rice, oils, vegetables, etc. She is requesting the loan to be able to stock and supply her store with more products. In the future, she hopes to purchase a plot of land and build a home.

She works hard to be able to proviD. a good quality of life to her children. She is wearing a grey sweater and hat, and is on the left siD. of the photo, next to the member wearing the red shirt.

loans.use: Grocery store - sale of food products.

loans.name: Daysi Tatiana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Daysi, tiene 24 años de edad está casada y de  esta relación tiene dos niñas de 9 y 4 años de edad la mayor estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de pescado,  todos los días en la madrugada él se desplaza hasta las playas para comprar el mejor pescado para luego llevarlo a Montecristi lugar que recorre en un triciclo para poder vender todo lo que lleva y con esto lograr ganar lo suficiente para que no falte nada en el hogar. Lleva como 13 años en este negocio y le va bien a pesar de que a veces es escaso el pescado.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva seis ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que su esposo compre un carro para que realice sus ventas.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'María del Carmen' community bank meet in Montecristi canton (Portoviejo).  This is the home of the famous Panama hat.  It is a cold-climate city and there are many natural tourist attractions in the area. 

Here we meet Daysi.  She is 24 years old, married, and has two daughters from this relationship who are 9 and 4 years old.  Her eldest attends school.  Her husband is a salesman.

Daysi is taking out a loan to help her husband with his fish selling business.  Early every morning, he goes to the beach to buy the best fish which he then transports to Montecristi, on a three-wheeled vehicle, to sell.  This allows him to earn enough that his family don't want for anything.  He has been in this business for 13 years and it is doing well in spite of the fact that fish is sometimes scarce.

This loan will be used to buy fish.  Daysi has been a member of her community bank for six loan cycles and she likes it for the help she gets from the loans.  Her dream is for her husband to buy a car for his work.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Karla Gabriela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Karla, tiene 21 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad, la mayor estudian en la escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden artesanías propias de la zona como son las hamacas, las perezosas de madera y mimbre, productos que son muy solicitados en otras ciudades a las que viajan para entregar estos productos,  ellos tres veces al mes se desplazan a Quito, Machala y Guayaquil e inclusive han llevado hasta el vecino país Perú lugar donde venden a muy buen precio estos productos. Ellos entregan en almacenes en estas ciudades,  su esposo lleva más de 10 años con el negocio y ella desde que se comprometió con él lo acompaña.
  
Este crédito es para comprar hamacas, perezosas y otras artesanías que venden. Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy unidas y responsables.
 
Su sueño es comprar un carro para llevar sus productos y vender con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The members of the María Del Carmen Community Bank meet twice a month in the canton of Montecristi (Portoviejo). This place is famous for straw hats, and the city has a cool climate and many natural tourist attractions in the area.

Here we meet Karla, who is 21 years old, married, and from this relationship they have two children who are 5 and 3 years old. The older child studies at school. Her husband is a businessman.

She and her husband work together selling local handicrafts such as hammocks, and deck chairs made from wood and rattan. These products are in demand in other cities and they travel to deliver the products three times a month to Quito, Machala and Guayaquil and they have even traveled to the neighboring country of Peru where they can sell these products at a good price. They deliver to warehouses in these cities. Her husband has more than 10 years experience in the business and she has been involved since she became engaged to become his partner.

This loan will be used to buy hammocks, deck chairs and other handicrafts they sell. She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and she likes it because the members are united and trustworthy. Her dream is to buy a car in order to make it easier and more comfortable to transport their products.

loans.use: to buy hammocks, deck chairs and other handicrafts

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
Renacer se denomina el grupo de 15 mujeres de Ciudad del Este, ellas con la idea de poder mejorar sus ingresos, se unieron a la fundación, pero se dieron cuenta que esto no solo les serviría para ello, sino también para capacitarse y seguir creciendo. Actualmente están en el séptimo ciclo del programa, y desean poder seguir.
Una de las miembros es la señora Felicia, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras de todo tipo, comenta que a muy tempranas horas de la mañana se levanta para poder tener siempre los productos más frescos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Gracias a su buena atención y a la buena calidad de sus productos ella ha podido sacar adelante a su familia, y dice que aunque su trabajo sea muy sacrificado ella seguirá para darle a su familia todo lo mejor, ya que no quiere que pasen por privaciones.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, repollos, lechuzas y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener buenos productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is named Renacer (To be Born Again) and has 15 members from the city of Este. They formed the group with the idea of improving their earnings, but they realized that this would not be the only benefit to them, but that they also would be trained and be able to grow. They are in the 7th cycle of the program, and they would like to be able to continue.

Felicia is one of the members. She sells all kinds of vegetables. She says that she gets up very early in the morning in order to be able to always have the freshest products to offer her customers. Thanks to her good attention and the good quality of her products she has been able to move her family forward and she says that although she makes sacrifices because of her work she will continue with it in order to give her family all the best, and she does not want them to be deprived.

She is asking for the loan in order to buy tomatoes, locotos [a member of the capsicum family], onions, cabbages, lettuces, and other items with which she will be able to stock up and to have good products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, locotos, onions, cabbages, lettuce and other items

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal María Del Carmen se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo). Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla, ciudad de clima fresco y con muchos atractivos turísticos naturales propios de la zona.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Rosa, tiene 51 años de edad está casada y de  esta relación tiene tres hijos dos mayores y la menor de 9 años de edad la misma que estudia en escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito  para ayudar a su esposo con su negocio, él se dedica a la venta de productos químicos como cloro, detergentes, creso, entre otros, él recorre la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que luego lleva a entregar de acuerdo a lo que le pidan sus clientes, trabaja de lunes a sábado y  lleva 7 años en su negocio, los productos los va a comprar a Guayaquil donde los compra más baratos en un laboratorio de químicos.

Este crédito es para comprar cloro, creso, detergentes, etc. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque les va muy bien en el grupo. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda o un bazar.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank María Del Carmen meets twice a month in the canton of Montecristi (Portoviejo). This place is famous for its straw hats, cool climate and the many local natural tourist attractions.

Here we meet Rosa who is 51 years old, married and from this relationship she has three children, two older and the youngest is 9 years old and he attends school. All of her children still live in her home. Her husband is a businessman. 

She is asking for a loan in order to help her husband with his business. He sells chemical products such as chlorine, detergents, and creosote among other items. He travels through the city offering his products, and then makes deliveries in accordance with his customers requests. He works Monday through Saturday and has been in this business for 7 years. He buys his products in Guayaquil where he can buy them cheaper from a chemical lab.

This loan is to buy chlorine, creosote, detergents and other products. She is an original member of the Communal Bank and she likes it because she gets along very well with the group. 

Her dream is to have a store or a bazaar.

loans.use: to buy chlorine, creosote, detergents and other items

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité lleva por nombre Kuña Kyrey ya que las mismas son mujeres muy activas (que en guaraní quiere decir kyrey). Ellas se han unido y han asumido el compromiso D.  mantener unido al grupo y trabajar bajo siempre respetándose las unas con las otras. Actualmente se encuentran en el cuarto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por  17 personas quienes invierten sus préstamos en sus respectivas actividades. 
La señora Justina se dedica a la venta D. gallinas y D. los huevos que estas ponen. Dice que este es un trabajo muy lindo pero muy sacrificado, ya que debe D. estar muy pendiente D. los animales que tiene, ya que quiere ofrecer a sus clientes buenos animales. Comenta que gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante y ayudar con los gastos D. la casa y D. ella misma. Quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio ya que le va muy bien, y es por ello que solicita el crédito para la compra D. gallinas ponedoras y también para la compra D. alimento para las mismas.
Ella, al igual que las integrantes del comité está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que reciben D. la fundación y D. Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is called Kuña Kyrey since they all all active women and in the Guarani language kyrey means to be active. They have been close-knit and have maD. the commitment to keep the group together and to always work with respect for one another. They are in the 4th cycle with excellent rating, and they have 17 members who use their loans in their respective work.

Justina works selling chickens and eggs that they lay. She says that this is very agreeable work but she makes self sacrifices. She must be very watchful over her animals, so that she can offer her customers good animals. She says that thanks to this work she has been able to succeed and help with the household expenses, and with her own.

She wants to continue investing in her business since it is going very well, and that is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy laying hens and to buy food for them. 

She, along with the members of the group, are very grateful for the opportunity they receive from the communal bank through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy laying hens to breed and later sale

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comité Mujeres Luchadoras de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, cuenta con 19 integrantes, en esta oportunidad se encuentran en el noveno ciclo D. Programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. Todas ellas se reúnen cada cierto tiempo para darse apoyo y también realizan otras actividades en conjunto para seguir creciendo.
Un ejemplo de trabajo es la señora Martina, quien se dedica a la venta de pollos. Hace ya un buen tiempo trabaja en ello y gracias a eso formó ya una buena clientela. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajara y luchadora, que tiene como interés sacar adelante a su familia y ayudar en la casa, para que no les falte nada.
Ella comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio y quiere seguir invirtiendo en el, por lo que solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos en cantidad, para que de esa forma tenga más cantidad y pueda hacer frente a la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Luchadoras (Women Fighters) are from the city of Villa Elisa. They have 19 members and they are in the 9th cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs at the communal bank. They all get together every so often for mutual support and for other activities, which helps them to continue growing together.

An example of their work is Martina, who sells chickens. She has been doing this for a long time and thanks to that she already has a good business. She is known as a hard working, fighting woman, who is interested in moving her family forward and helping in her home, so that they don’t need anything. 

She says that the business is going well and that she wants to continue investing in it, so that is why she is asking for a loan, in order to buy chickens in quantity, so that in this way she will have them available in order to meet the requests of her clients.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell later

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus - Jauja Group

texts.es:
El señor WILFREDO OSWALDO, tiene 33 años D. edad, casado, tienes 03 hijos menores D. edad,  con mucho entusiasmo. Es integrante D. L. Alcancía Comunal "CORAZON D. JESUS - JAUJA”. 

Es técnico en mecánica metal. tiene un local alquilado D. ventas lubricantes y  repuestos para automóviles  venD. llaves D. repuestos, llantas para automóvil, lubricantes para motores, etc.

El préstamo solicitó para abastecer e implementar su local D. mecánica, En el futuro desea comprarse su casa y apertura sus talleres D. mecánica en su propia casa.
Se esfuerza mucho para que pueda dar una buena calidad D. vida a esposa e hijo. 
El socio  viste con chompa color plomo que se ubica a lado  D. L. socia que viste con chompa color celeste.
texts.en:
Wilfredo Oswaldo is 33 years old, married, and has three dependent children.  He has a lot of enthusiasm.  He is a member of the 'Corazón D. Jesús - Jauja' community bank.

Wilfredo is a mechanical technician.  He rents premises where he sells lubricants and car parts.  He sells replacement keys, car tires, engine lubricants, etc.

Wilfredo requested this loan to stock and equip his premises.  In the future, he would like to buy his own house and open his workshop in his own home.   He works hard so that he can proviD. his wife and son with a good quality of life.

In the photo, Wilfredo is wearing a lead-gray sweater and is standing besiD. the lady wearing a sky-blue sweater.

loans.use: to buy lubricants and spare parts

loans.name: Virgen De Caacupe Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina “Virgen de Caacupé”. Están en el Primer Ciclo y tiene 11  integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y responsable. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor,  trabajan en conjunto para tener fondos que puedan ayudar al comité en caso de necesidad.
La señora Lourdes es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas interiores, tanto para hombres como para mujeres. Comenta que ya se ha formado una buena clientela y que gracias a sus ventas ella tiene los medios para mantener a toda su familia. Siempre ella tiene mucha variedad de prendas pero quiere seguir abasteciéndose y es por eso que acude a la fundación y kiva y solicita el crédito para la compra de nuevas prendas, para que de esa forma tenga más variedad y atraiga a más clientes.
Agradece a la fundación y a kiva, por esta oportunidad de crecimiento que les da.
texts.en:
Their committee is called “Virgen de Caacupe.” It's in its 1st loan cycle and has 11 members. The group is well known in the barrio for being very responsible and united. The members possess great enterprising spirit and work together to obtain funds to help the committee in case of necessity.

Lourdes is one of the members. She sells underwear for both men and women. Lourdes comments that now she has a good customer base and, thanks to her sales, she has the means to maintain all her family. Lourdes always has a large variety of clothing items to sell but she wishes to continuing resupplying them. And that is why she approached the Foundation and Kiva to request a loan to buy new merchandise, so she will have more variety and can attract more customers.

Lourdes thanks the Foundation and Kiva for the growth opportunity they are providing.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nuevo Amanecer" es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está en el tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar en equipo, y de esa forma fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La Sra. Fatima es una de las miembros del comité, ella se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos. Comenta que le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que le gustan mucho los animales, gracias a su trabajo incansable ella logra mantener a su familia y de paso ayudar con los gastos de la casa. Ella se define como una mujer muy luchadora, trabajadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos para la cría, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio. Esta muy agradecida a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da a ella y a sus amigas.
texts.en:
The group “New Dawn” is from the city of San Ignacio and is in its third loan cycle of the entrepreneurial women program with the foundation.  The women’s goal is to work together as a team and in this way create a spirit of solidarity and reach the highest level of the program.

Fatima is one of the members of the group.  She raises and sells chicken.  She says that she likes what she does very much because she likes animals.  Thanks to her untiring work she manages to support her family and help with household expenses.  She describes herself as a fighter, hard working, and entrepreneurial.

She requests this loan to buy chicks to raise, which will help her a lot in her business.  She is very thankful to the foundation for the opportunity they give her and her friends.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Milagros 1 Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagro I es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está integrado por 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras, con ganas de salir adelante y progresar y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
Lilian es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella tiene una pequeña despensa. Gracias a este negocio ella puede sacar adelante a su familia con mucho sacrificio, trabajo y esfuerzo. Comenta que le va muy bien con las ventas y que le gustaría poder seguir con su negocio, es por ello que solicita el préstamo para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados y otros, con los cuales podrá ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
Ella al igual que las demás está muy agradecida con la fundación y con Kiva, ya que la ayuda que les brinda es muy importante para el crecimiento de cada una.
texts.en:
The group Milagro I is located in the city of Encarnación. It is comprised of 11 very hardworking women who want to be successful and make progress and in this way to help their families. 
Lilian is one of the members of the group and she has a small store. Thanks to this business and much sacrifice, work, and striving, she can move her family forward. She comments that sales are strong and that she wants to continue with her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy drinks, groceries, dairy products, baked goods, and other things that will enable her to offer her clients greater variety.
She and the other members are very grateful to the foundation and to Kiva as the help that they have offered them is very important for the growth of each woman.

loans.use: To buy drinks, groceries, dairy goods, baked goods, and others.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo surgió por contacto de una de las integrantes con la Fundación, ella motivó a sus amigas y vecinas para que a través del grupo puedan crecer y desarrollarse. Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el decimo tercer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación. Todas ellas trabajan de forma coordinada y ayudándose las unas con las otras.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Zulma, tiene 4 hijos y está casada con el Sr. Lucio quien trabaja como chofer. Ella tiene una despensita bien surtida a la cual siempre van sus vecinos. Gracias a su negocio es que ella logra ayudar a su marido con los gastos en la casa, ya que compartiendo las deudas se aligera un poco la carga.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, bebidas, panificados, embutidos y demás artículos de primera necesidad que demanden los clientes.
texts.en:
This group came about from one of the members contacting the foundation. She encouraged her friends and neighbors to get involved so that they could grow and develop as a group. Currently, the committee is in its thirteenth cycle of the foundation's program for women entrepreneurs. They all work in a coordinated way and help one another. 
One of the group members is Zulma, who has 4 children and is married to Lucio, who works as a driver. She has a small, well-stocked store that her neighbors always use. Thanks to this business, she has been able to help her husband with the household expenses, and sharing their obligations lightens the load a little. 
She is requesting a loan to buy meat, drinks, baked goods, sausages, and other stable goods that her clients want.

loans.use: To buy meat, drinks, baked goods, sausages and other items.

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju es denominado el comité que formaron 18 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. Ellas se unieron con el propósito D. generar mejores ingresos para cada una D. ellas, para que D. esa forma puedan ayudar a sus familiares e hijos. 
Una D. esas mujeres trabajadoras es la señora Blanca, quien se dedica a la venta D. helados. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien en su negocio, en especial en la época D. verano, que es cuando más ventas tiene. Una D. sus metas es tener un gran local donD. pueda ofrecer los helados que venD.. Gracias a este trabajo ella logra ayudar con los gastos D. la casa y también ayuda a su familia. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. helados, ya que se viene la época D. calor y quiere tener mucha variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Koeju is the name of the committee formed by 18 women in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. They came together with the goal of generating better income for each person because, in this way, they can help their families and children.
One of these hardworking women is Blanca, who sells ice-cream. She tells us that her business is doing very well, especially in the summer which is when she has the most sales. One of her goals is to have a large store where she can sell her ice-cream. Thanks to this work, she has been able to help with the household expenses and also to help her family. 
She is requesting a loan to buy ice-cream as the hot season is coming and she wants to have a good variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy  variety of ice-creams to sell later.

loans.name: Mujeres Organizadas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Organizadas” se formó con la unión D. varias vecinas D. la comunidad D. Yrybucua D. la ciudad D. Santaní.  Todas las integrantes del comité tienen actividades independientes, pero también trabajan en grupo para poder fortalecer su compañerismo. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz D. trabajar conjuntamente en cualquier actividad. 
Una D. ellas es la señora Yenny. Ella nos comenta que tiene una despensa, la cual está muy bien surtida y equipada, tiene gran variedad D. productos y nos dice que gracias a todo esto es muy conocida en su barrio. 
Gracias a su despensa ella ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y también cubrir los gastos extras D. la casa. Dentro D. sus proyectos está seguir creciendo y en miras a esto solicita el crédito para la compra D. fideos, azúcar, leche, panificados, verduras y demás, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The committee "Organized Women" was formed by some neighbors in the community of Yrybucua in the city of Santaní. All the members of the committee have their own businesses but they also work as a group to strengthen their fellowship. The members form a very united and capable group and work together on whatever activity. 
One of them is Yenny. She tells us that she has a store that is very well-stocked and equipped. She has a good variety of products and she tells us that, thanks to this, her store is well know in the neighborhood.
Thanks to her store, she has been able to move her family forward in life and also to cover the extra household expenses. Her projects incluD. continuing to grow her business and, in view of this, she is requesting a loan to buy noodles, sugar, milk, baked goods, vegetables, and other products with which to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy noodles, sugar, milk, baked goods, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Liborio

texts.es:
El Sr. Liborio es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 51 años, está casado con la Sra. Norma de 40 años de edad. Ellos tienen un hijo, quien ya es mayor y se maneja de forma independiente.
 Don Liborio se dedica a la producción y venta de leche desde hace ya un tiempo. Gracias al tiempo que lleva en esto y sumado a la buena atención que da y la buena calidad de sus productos es que él ha podido crecer en su negocio y ampliarse. Nos cuenta que ya cuenta con clientela formada, buen ingreso, buenas referencias. Es un señor muy trabajador, luchador y emprendedor.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera, con lo cual podrá aumentar su producción y tener más leche que vender.
texts.en:
Liborio is from the city of Santaní. He is 51 years old and is married to 40 year old Norma. They have a son who is already grown-up and lives independently. 
Liborio has been working for some time producing and selling milk. Thanks to the time that he has been doing this and the good care that he takes of his business and the good quality of his products, he has been able to grow and broaden his business. He tells us that he already has a loyal client base, good income, and good references. He is a very hardworking and enterprising man.
He is requesting a loan to buy a milk cow to augment his production and have more milk to sell.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Atanacio

texts.es:
Atanacio tiene 58 años, es casado, tiene tres hijos con su esposa Natividad. Es comerciante, tiene una pequeña despensa, donde trabaja con la ayuda de su esposa.
Hace más de 10 años que tiene su despensa por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien formada y eso le genera muy buenos ingresos.  Comenta que este ha sido el sustento de su familia por mucho tiempo y ahora que sus hijos ya son mayores aprecian el trabajo de su padre hizo, ya que gracias a eso recibieron  educación. Don Atanacio es un hombre trabajador, honesto y responsable. Los vecinos le tienen un aprecio.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de carne, bebidas, panificados, comestibles y otros productos para abastecer su local y para ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Atanacio is 58 years old, married, and has three children with his wife Natividad.  He works in retail and has a little store where he works with his wife’s help.

He has had his store for more than 10 years and because of this, has good customers that generate good income.  He says this has been his family’s livelihood for a long time.  Now that his children are older they appreciate the work their father did since it is what allowed them to get an education.  Atanacio is a hard working, honest, and responsible man.  His neighbors hold him in high esteem.

He needs the loan to buy meat, drinks, pastries, food and other products to stock his store and offer better variety to his customers.

loans.use: buy meat, drinks, pastries, food and other products

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
La señora Angelina tiene 31 años D. edad, está acompañada con el señor Delio, ella estuvo casada por 6 años y D. esa relación tuvo dos hijas D. 12 y 9 años.
La señora Angelina se dedica a la venta D. joyas desD. hace 5 años aproximadamente. Comenta que al principio fue un poco difícil ya que no tenía mucho capital, pero le fue muy bien en el negocio y ahora ya tiene más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Gracias a su trabajo ahora está construyendo para su pequeña casita donD. quiere vivir con sus hijas y con su compañero.
Solicita este préstamo para la compra D. joyas, como ser: anillos, cadenas, pulseras D. plata, lo que le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y poder mejorar su ingreso mensual.
texts.en:
Angelina is 31 years old. She is in a relationship with Delio. She was married for six years and from that marriage she had two daughters who are 12 and 9 years old.
Angelica has been selling jewelry for about five years. She says that at first it was a little difficult, because she didn't have a lot of working capital. However, she has done very well in the business and now has a wider variety of merchandise to offer her customers. Thanks to her work she is building her small house where she intends to live with her daughters and her partner.
She requests this loan in order to purchase jewelry, such as silver bracelets, rings and chains. This will allow her to offer varied merchandise to her customers and to increase her monthly profits.

loans.use: to purchase silver bracelets, rings and chains for selling.

loans.name: Constancia Belen

texts.es:
La señora Constancia tiene 42 años, vive con su cónyuge quien le ayuda en el negocio y su hija D. 17 años D. edad. 
La señora nos cuenta que tiene una despensa y que para poder empezar con su negocio junto a su pareja tuvieron que ir a trabajar en Asunción como empleados domésticos, y gracias al esfuerzo y el trabajo arduo, juntaron un capital con el cual montaron su negocio. Gracias al espíritu emprendedor pudieron ir creciendo hoy en día es uno D. los lugares más concurridos D. la ciudad gracias a la buena atención y a la amabilidad por parte D. los mismos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. fideos, arroz, azúcar, bebidas y otros productos para abastecer su local. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Constancia is 42 years old. She lives with her spouse, who helps her in the business, and her 17-year-old daughter.
She reports that she owns a small grocery store and that, in order to get the business started, she and her spouse had to go to Asunción to work as housekeepers. Thanks to their efforts and hard work, they saved money which they used to set up their business. Thanks to their enterprising spirit, they have been able to keep growing. Nowadays it is one of the most popular stores in town, thanks to how attentive and friendly the owners are.
She requests the loan in order to purchase noodles, rice, sugar, beverages, etc., for stocking up her store. She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity she is given.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, rice, sugar, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 46 años, está casado con Rufina. Ellos viven en la ciudad de Paraguarí.  Marcial se dedica a la fabricación y venta de planteras y mesitas, en lo que recibe la ayuda de su señora, quien se encarga de la terminación y comercialización del producto en frente a su domicilio.
Ellos con esfuerzo están saliendo adelante y desean seguir creciendo comercialmente ya que ven mucho futuro en su negocio.  El señor Marcial comenta que todo lo que hace es por darle a su familia una vida digna y decorosa y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones.
Pretende utilizar el crédito para la compra de cemento para la elaboración de sus planteras y mesitas.
texts.en:
Marcial is 46 years old and married to Rufina. They live in the town of Paraguarí. Marcial manufactures and sells vases and small tables. He gets help from his wife, who is in charge of finishing and selling the merchandise in front of their house.
Through hard work they have been able to get ahead. They wish to continue to expand their business, because they see a lot of potential in it. Marcial reports that everything he does is to give his family a decent and dignified life, and to prevent them from going through any kind of hardships.
He intends to use the loan to purchase cement to make his vases and small tables.

loans.use: to purchase cement to make vases and small tables.

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo tiene 33 años, está casado con Petrona de 35 años, el es macatero (vendedor ambulante) hace más de diez años,  y su señora es modista, y con su trabajo le ayuda con los gastos de la casa.
Gustavo muy joven se fue en la Argentina donde estuvo trabajando como albañil y en donde conoció a su señora, luego de que tuvo capital suficiente volvió a su país, emprendiendo el negocio de la venta, actividad que la mayoría sus vecinos desarrolla. Hoy en día cuenta con clientela formada  por la buena calidad de sus productos y la facilidad de pagos que ofrece.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías sabanas, mosquiteros, frazadas, los cuales son los productos que el vende. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 33 years old and is married to Petrona, who is 35.  He has worked as a traveling salesman for more than ten years, and his wife is a dressmaker whose work helps with the household expenses. 

When Gustavo was young, he moved to Argentina, where he worked as a bricklayer and met his wife.  After he earned enough money, he returned to Paraguay and began his sales business.  Most of his neighbors do the same work.  Currently, he has a customer base thanks to the good quality of his products and the ease of his payment plans.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as sheets, mosquito nets, and blankets, which are the products that he sells.  He is thankful to the foundation and Kiva for the opportunity they are giving him.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, mosquito nets, and blankets to sell.

loans.name: Blas Gabino

texts.es:
El Señor Blas es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción, y provee varias obras con ladrillos, pisos, tejas y otros. Blas, visita diariamente varias construcciones para cerciorarse de sus necesidades y poder proveerles.
El comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio ya que siempre tiene ventas. El se define como un hombre muy trabajador y luchador. Desea poder seguir creciendo para que pueda seguir generando ingresos para ayudar a su familia y también a otras personas, ya que el produce muchas fuentes de trabajo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de ladrillos, tejas y otros materiales de construcción y en el futuro planea contar con un local de manera a poder incluir otros productos para satisfacer más pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blas is from the city of Villa Elisa and works selling construction materials and does various work with bricks, floors, tiles, and others.  Every day, Blas visits buildings to ascertain their needs and can provide them.

He says that his business is going very well since he always has sales.  He defines himself as a hardworking fighter.  He wants to continue growing his business so that he can continue generating income to help his family and also other people, since he produces many jobs.

He is asking for this loan to purchase bricks, tiles, and other construction materials.  In the future, he plans to have a store so that he can include more products to satisfy more orders from his customers.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to sell.

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
Hernán es de Ciudad del Este,  está  casado con la Sra. Ramona, tienen 1 hija mayor de edad que ya se maneja de forma independiente.
El señor Hernán tiene una despensa bien surtida donde trabaja con su esposa. Comenta que se iniciaron con un dinero que recibió Hernán como parte de una indemnización que había recibido en un trabajo anterior. 
El es una persona muy responsable y con ganas de superación, tiene un espíritu jovial y emprendedor que no cabe duda que vaya a llegar a conseguir todas las metas que se ha propuesto.
Hernán manifiesta que la ayuda de la fundación siempre le fue muy útil, y es por ello que una vez más recurre a ella para solicitar un crédito, pues desea abastecer con más productos su despensa.
texts.en:
Hernán is from Ciudad del Este and is married to Ramona.  They have one adult daughter who is independent.

Hernán has a well stocked store where he works with his wife.  He said that they started the store with money Hernán received as compensation from a past job.  

He is a responsible person with a drive to get ahead.  He has a happy and enterprising spirit who no doubt will achieve all of the goals he has proposed.  

Hernán says that the help of the foundation has always been very useful, so he returned again to request a loan because he wants to stock more products in his store.

loans.use: to purchase food, drinks, milk, and other items to stock his store.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
La Sra. Ramona es de ciudad del Este,  está casada con el Sr. Humberto y  tienen 3 hijos menores que aún están en la  primaria. 
Ramona tiene una despensa bien surtida y es la única del barrio. Ella se inicio hace varios años con muy pocos productos, pero poco a poco con el pasar de los años logró tener una despensa bien surtida y con buenísima clientela ya que es la única despensa que se encuentra en su comunidad. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a sus hijos. 
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, verduras y demás, con lo que podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Está agradecida con kiva y a la fundación por la oportunidad que estas le dan.
texts.en:
Ramona is from the city of Este. Her husband’s name is Humberto and they have three young children still in elementary school.

Ramona has a well-supplied grocery store and it is the only one in the neighborhood. She began some years ago with very few products, but little by little with the passing of the years she has managed to have a well stocked store and very good customers because it is the only store in the community. She is a hardworking woman dedicated to her children.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy drinks, foodstuff, dairy, vegetables, and other items so she can stock up and meet the requests of her clients. She is grateful to Kiva and to the community bank for the opportunity that they give her.

loans.use: to buy drinks, foodstuff, dairy, vegetables, and other items

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, 54, is married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Felisa has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for six years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Felisa aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Lider De Defensores Group

texts.es:
Dora es miembro del grupo “LIDER D. DEFENSORES”  son 09 socias que pertenecen al grupo, ella al igual que sus compañeras tienen sus propios negocios, la Sra. Dora se dedica por más D. 10 años a dos oficios  la artesanía donD. confecciona joyería hecha a mano como pulseras, argollas en hilo D. plata y cobre   también se dedica a la costura confecciona manteles, cortinas, set D. cocinas etc. Estos oficios los aprendió asistiendo a cursos libres y  le sirven para poD. brindarle a su única hija una mejor calidad D. vida con sus ahorros pudo comprarle una computadora algo que le había prometido si ingresaba a la universidad, estos son algunas D. las satisfacciones que le da su trabajo y eso la hace sentir feliz con su nuevo préstamo  comprara telas, hilos y paño lenci para empezar a confeccionar productos para las fiestas naviD.ñas sus clientas le han pedido manteles naviD.ños, pie D. arboles etc. 
 
*Dora es la primera D. las paradas viste blusa blanca y negra.
texts.en:
Dora is a member of the Líder D. Defensores group.  There are nine members in the group.  She and her fellow members have their own businesses.

Dora has worked for more than ten years at two jobs.  In handicrafts she makes jewelry such as bracelets and rings in silver and copper wire.  She also works as a seamstress making tablecloths, curtains, kitchen coordinates, etc.

Dora learned these jobs attending free classes, and they allow her to be able to offer her only daughter a better quality of life.  With her savings she managed to buy her a computer, something she had promised her if she enrolled in the university.  These are some of the satisfactions that her work gives her, and that makes her happy.

With her new loan she will buy fabric, thread, and Lenci wool to begin making products for the Christmas season.  Her customers have requested Christmas tablecloths, tree skirts, etc. 

*Dora is the first of the women standing, wearing a black and white blouse.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and wool

loans.name: 03.10.111.thiệu Chính Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Ban, 37, is married with two children. She has a food stall selling rice and is requesting a loan to purchase rice to resell. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years.

Ban is the leader of a five member group, the 03.10.111.Thiệu Chính solidarity group. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. In 2010, Ban joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and she has successfully repaid two loans.

The main hardship Ban faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profit, Ban hopes to buy land of her own, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase rice to resell.

loans.name: 03.10.112.thiệu Chính Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Hợp, 35, is married with two children. She works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle and has been involved in this business for seven years. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Hợp is the group leader of the 03.10.112.Thiệu Chính solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. In 2010, Hợp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and she has successfully repaid two loans.

The main hardships Hợp faces in her business are natural disasters and droughts. With her business profit, she hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her children, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 06.08.01 Đông Vệ Thanh Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thủy, 47, is married with two children. She has a stall selling votive objects, a business she has been involved in for more than ten years. She is now requesting a loan to purchase more votive objects to resell.

Thủy is the group leader of the 06.08.01 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives with her two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. In 2010, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business and she has successfully repaid one loan.

The main hardship Thủy faces in her business is the lack of capital. In the future, she hopes to maintain her business, to buy a motorbike, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase votive objects to resell.
